Reviews.Title: “Mold alert! You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: J O
Reviews.Content: The renovations to the lobby are decent. It's a nice a fresh look when you first get in. But when you finally check into your room-- it's a different story. Small rooms for sure, but wasn't expecting a black substance under the cups in the bathroom. That was MOLD! Bathroom floors were dirty and grimy looking, the entire room just felt old and musty. I was prepared for a small room in HK, but just not the old, dirty feeling. I called the front desk to request another room, they offered just to clean the bathroom again, but I pushed for a renovated, new room like others on here had mentioned. Instead, I just got the same old room, three floors up. Come check out-- waited 25 minutes in line-- several customers from the same party took the attention of two staff. Manager walked by to see what was happening, but did nothing to relieve the situation. Would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, great staff, great view”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: The Ibis is slightly away from Hong Kong Island's hot spots so it's never going to be a 5-star hotel. The rooms are tiny and fairly austere. During my stay the foyer was being redecorated and some fumigation was also taking place but it would be unfair to complain about this. On the plus side it's very close to the MTR, the staff were consistently very helpful and the view of the harbour is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Compact Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but clean and functional. Staff is attentive and helpful. One annoyance is the sound proofing between the rooms and the hallway outside - if you are a light sleeper you will be woken up by the ding-ding from the elevator or other people entering/exiting their rooms on your floor.

Reviews.Title: “the best budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: rpd6
Reviews.Content: i loved my stay in this hotel, considering the high cost of hong kong city in general. its at the best location with the bus stand opposite and subway just next door. the staff were excellent, rooms are very comfortable and modern and clean. hot water, minibar, hair dryer, inroom tea coffee and electric kettle. the works, highly recommended. nice restataurant on 2nd floor and the best of all, free wifi.even the 5 star hotels dont give u that..opposite lane 2 macdonalds and a kfc and money exchanges place, not to mention 3 7-11a 24hrs. thanks ibis and hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough Location, Very Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: olegnatadero
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was reasonably-priced (for a weekend stay), had access to the MTR, and wasn't too far away from the shopping and dining areas. The hotel rooms were very clean, but very small. The bathroom was tiny and needed some renovation as it looked fairly dated. The hotel isn't exactly located in a shopping or dining area, so you'll have to take the subway. The station entrance, however, is just a few steps away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ibis north point”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: rooms are to small (very) , cleanliness is quite good ,good location (near mtr station) , good service when checking in. sleep quality is ok (not to much noice) but the weaknes is on the door, we can hear people talking from outside.

Reviews.Title: “not suit for family trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I go with my family, and we take 2 room, actually we want to spent for 4 nights but the room is too small, we can barely move in the room. the bed is small too we can not sleep well since we can not move well therefor we take only a night than we move to other hotel

Reviews.Title: “Location, the hotel is one step away from the metro.”
Reviews.Author: UTor
Reviews.Content: Ibis North Point is an excellent option, priced reasonably well, is not a luxury hotel but has enough to visit Hong Kong, is one step away from the metro. Rooms are small, but the view of the bay is great, two people and their luggage will be a little tight but it is acceptable. The breakfast is simple but honest Ibis standard, including the price. From the airport to the hotel there are two ways to get the hotel, at Terminal 1 there´s a bus terminal take line A12 or subway (check the exit to North Point Port which is identified by letter). The hotel is a few stations from Causeway Bay area, great shopping area. Take subway in Hong Kong is very easy, at machine tickets just select the destination and you will have the ticket price, pay, take and go. So, the hotel have good price, good service Ibis standard but no bad surprises, good location and great ease of mobility by metro or bus.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good quality”
Reviews.Author: czxkace
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there while my trip to Hong-Kong in February this year. The hotel is located just few meters from NORTHPOINT metro station and just oposite bus stop (you can take bus from airport and it is 3 times cheaper than train service). Rooms are very small but clean and bright. The only thing is bathroom which needs some painting and renovation. You can book Harbour view rooms for less than 110EUR per night which is very good deal in HongKong. Nearby you can find lots of shops and restaurants. Overall it is very good place for low budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location, near MTR North point”
Reviews.Author: Mink C
Reviews.Content: My first time here with my friend with - nice location - only 10 steps from MTR North Point, Hong Kong - nice view from room (Harbour view) - clean and tidy room - bed quite small (fit for 2 slim people) - budget hotel - bed is quite small - there are so many restaurants near hotel (Local restaurant with afforable price and also international restaurants with nice food) - has 7-11 shop not far from hotel (about a min walk) - bathroom is a bit smelly

Reviews.Title: “A great budget hotel, suitable for those who intend to be out all day.”
Reviews.Author: Jonatanw
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 20 meters from a metro station (northpoint), which you can take to get anywhere. The hotel itself is nice, with small rooms and amazing harbour views. Did not take the breakfast option since there are a lot of places around the city to eat and I don't think its worth the extra bucks. The service of the hotel personall was great, room was cleaned daily and any questions were answerd promptly. This is a good choice for those visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dewan R
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of June and actually did not expect a lot from Ibis, It is of course a Budget hotel, So usually small rooms and average service. However this time the Service was excellent!, the staff made sure they tried to find a solution for every question you might have and if something was missing or not enough it was there as fast as it could get there (The elevators are a bit slow, but what do you expect with so many floors and rooms). Also they give you a choice for the regular Breakfast or the 'Lazy Sleepers' which made it convenient if you had a late night before. The only thing I do miss in an hotel like Ibis are the nice soft hotel beds that you would get in a Pullman for example, For me personally the bed in Ibis was too hard however still doable. Overall: Great Budget Hotel! Tip: If you are a beach lover, right in front of the hotel is a bus stop from where you can take a short 20 min drive to Repulse Bay..;)

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently location, closely MTR Northpoint”
Reviews.Author: Patama_bee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very near to the MTR Station Northpoint. It's very convenient for travel around Hong Kong Island. I'm very appreciate for free WI-FI. For the hotel staffs, They can speak English very well with Friendly and service mind. For the room, it's very small and poky.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! You get exactly what you pay for.Cheap and nasty!”
Reviews.Author: Debra T
Reviews.Content: Like others I read Trip Advisor before I booked this hotel. Took a chance and was REALLY disappointed. The room was so small,I expected it to be, but was so shocked by the size I burst into tears! Maybe it was the long plane trip from Europe and I was looking forward to a shower and a nap ! My husband and I each had a suitcase but we could not fit 2 suitcases on the floor of the room and the bed was not a double but a king single(for 2 adults to share) I honestly thought that they had made a mistake and had given us a single room. My husband went back to the front desk and was told that this was our room and no others were available. The worst hotel stay I have ever had NEVER ,NEVER again. Please If you book this hotel be aware that it has the smallest rooms and hardest beds in Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Short Getaway in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located very near to the MTR Station Northpoint which runs from East to West on Hong Kong Island. Getting to Disneyland was easy using the Interchange at the Central Station. The Hotel rooms are a little smaller than the IBIS I stayed in Singapore, but overall it was value for money, as many other properties were much more expensive. I would have likes 1-2 bottles of water in the room, which was missing. The other very good thing about the location is the Bus Depot in front of the hotel which has buses from everywhere parking here. Also the City Flyer Bus A11 has it's last stop here from the airport and departs here to the airport every 20 mins. I would recommend this hotel to couples and solo travellers who are price conscious. Don't try to take a taxi from Kowloon to the Hotel as this will cost you easily 120-180 HKD. Everything else around the hotel was great, eateries, supermarkets, 7-11, etc. I will come back here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Mattress top not free”
Reviews.Author: Upsetchoice
Reviews.Content: I have made bookings for 2 standard double bedrooms here. As I have heard of its famous firm beds in this hotel, I obviously took the tip to request for the mattress top as suggested but were surprised that this is not provided free for a standard room and it will costs you $55 per night. I am really disappointed at this class of discrimination as I didn't expect a respected hotel group such as Accor Hotels to begrudge a little comfort for its guests due to its hard beds.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis hong hong”
Reviews.Author: 663Brian48
Reviews.Content: Modern clean hotel at North Point, Hong Kong, for a reasonable price. Only 40 meters away from the Metro Station and easy access to the airport train. Bus terminal is directly across the road. My only criticism is that the bed was very hard, otherwise my five day stay was very enjoyable. The staff are friendly and helpful. The North Point area is a great place to stay with plenty of outdoor markets, restaurants, and great shopping. A good hot buffet breakfast is available for HKD 61.00, very good value. Other than the hard bed, the only other downside was that my room had a door (locked) leading to an adjoining room. On one occasion the occupants were very noisy and could be clearly heard throat the door. Room had great views over Hong Kong harbour on the 28th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Basic lodgings, good transport options, good value 4 budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: Pamsmick
Reviews.Content: There is a bus (A11) from the airport that terminates its route a short walk from the hotel. The rooms are small but inline with their price. Pluses are view of the harbor and free wifi! Also loved the little refrigerator at the reception where I could buy a cold cocacola light when I came in from the heat! AC worked fine! While North Point is a bit away from the center, it is a compact city and this location had very good transport options. The subway metro was nearby (need to be sure to check area map when returning to get to the best exit). Also the double-decker tram just a few blocks away. Came across a Sat street market near the tram stop. When I needed a taxi the staff helped hail one. Staff was pleasant and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I don't recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_and_Pieter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights, 4 nights too much! I have never seen a room so small like this one!! We hadn't enough place or our luggage. The room was dirty and the toilet didn't work. When we asked at the reception to fix the toilet, they were prepared to fix it, but when we came at our room in the evening the toilet wasn't fixed yet. The airco was making a lot of noice and the walls were very thin! The location is good, nearby a metrostation, but that's the only good thing. The beds were very hard and so small, it was more like a 1-person bed! I don't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis North Point”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, with excellent views of the harbour. Compact room that has everything you need. Very convenient for aiport shuttle bus and all local transport. Convenient supermarket nearby and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Its so-so, you get what you pay for, I guess..”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much of the hotel - since reading about it here in Tripadvisor. The only thing I was looking forward to was that it was a few steps a way from the MTR station, and that the Airport bus stops directly across the hotel. TO BE VERY TRUTHFUL: a) The MTR station is NOT just a few steps away - yes its nearby BUT its quite a number of steps away. The most appropriate terms is A FEW METERS AWAY. b) The Airport bus does not exactly stop ACROSS the hotel. There's a BUS STOP at the pier which is across the hotel. There are barriers that hinders you fast access to the hotel. You'd need to lug around your baggage through the bus stop and cross the street's pedestrian lane and walk a few more minutes to get to the hotel. CHECK-IN - The check in went smoothly for me, because I emailed them ahead of time that I needed a room to rest in as I am pregnant. When we got to the hotel, surprisingly - there were 3 rooms that were available. So we were all given an early check-in. STAFF - They're just OK. They're helpful but not in a sense that they will go out of their way to help you. The night that we arrived, I asked for extra pillows (I asked for 3) and the Front Desk person even asked me 'Why do you need so much?' which shocked me! Another time, I asked the front desk for the number of Yung Kee restaurant in Central because we wanted to eat there, I was asking nicely if that particular staff can make the reservation for me and she replied with 'HERE'S THE NUMBER, USE THE HOTEL PHONE TO CALL THEM, PLEASE DIAL 9' WTF?! ROOM - The room we got had a Harbour View. I was expecting a smaller room, but what we got was just alright - for Asians that is. If you were a Caucasian, I'm sure you'd complain on the space because it can be quite crowded. There was no where to place your luggage except for the floor. And when you peep under the bed - it's quite a mess because it will seem like your housekeeper will just sweep all the dust and rubbish under your bed! The bathroom is quite small too! Since I was pregnant, I was having a hard time moving around the shower. BED - The bed was so hard! I couldn't sleep well the whole trip! I had to toss and turn and change positions every so often. Since I am pregnant, I couldn't find a comfortable position. I dreaded going to sleep at night! Had I not been pregnant, I guess - the bed would be okay. LOCATION - The location is I guess just alright. There's an MTR station a few meters away. The walk to the trains was quite long too! I was expecting it to be near, but you need to walk meters to get to the ticket booth and another few meters to get to the trains. Its not as near as you would think and expect. There are a LOT of food choices nearby if you are not the picky type. There are congee places and a ramen house near the hotel. There's a small Wellcome around the corner that closes at 10pm. BREAKFAST - Breakfast was okay, I found it good enough. They serve bacon, potato wedges, scrambled eggs, ham, hardboiled eggs. Salad greens, breads with butter and jam. Fruits and orange juice. Cereal and milk with coffee and tea. They also have congee! If you want variety, you can try going to the restaurant nearby for a local fare. My only complaint really is the BED. Had I not been pregnant, the hotel room is good enough. I guess you get that you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Jaideepghosh
Reviews.Content: Location is not central Hong Kong, but a very short ride away on MTR; North Point MTR station entry is a few meters away from the hotel. Causeway Bay and WanChai are just 3-4 stations away. North Point Ferry Pier and Bus Terminus are bang opposite the hotel, including buses to HK Airport. Real convenient. Surroundings of the hotel are fairly unimpressive. I was upgraded to a Junior Suite on the highest (31st) floor of the hotel - which had stunning views of the harbor. 'Junior Suite' of course is smaller than a standard room in most parts of the world - but then this is Hong Kong ! The room was clean, and everything fitted in somehow. Restaurant buffet breakfast is adequate, though over hyped through several prominent advertisements within the hotel. I had read other reviews on the lift being small - well it is - but somehow I did not have to wait long and did not find over-crowded ever. In short, in Hong Kong this is a place with good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable small basic room.”
Reviews.Author: MontysDouble
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides very basic rooms, many with good harbour views. Your are a bit further along Hong Kong islands from popular central and main causeway bay areas. However, it is very accessible from North Point MTR station. From the station it is worth taking your time to follow the signs and use exit "A1" from the station - from this exit the hotel is only 20/30meters down the road turning right. [If you are pulling luggage, exit A1 has some stairs up and down between it and the main station concourse, so you might want to take a lift to the surface and then make your way across a block or so.] The hotel is generally fine, although it only has two lifts. Becasue the reception is also a couple of floors up from the ground, you can spend sometime waiting for a lift as they shuttle people up and down from receiption. Personally I think the hotel would be wise to try and fit a small mini-lift into the open space to take people up and down from the main entrance to reception, freeing up the two main lifts. Or alternativly lock one off so it always prioritises the bedroom floors, and another to prioritise the shuttle up and down from reception. This is the only thing that bugged me, and it is minor although you do notice it every time. But based upon location, you are not going to be poppig back and forth all the time as you might if staying in an expensive hotel in Central.

Reviews.Title: “Little oasis in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great service for a small hotel. Seaview is excellent making the stay much more enjoyable. Room is clean and bright. Location is convenient just opposite the North Point ferry and bus terminal. It has always been our favourite place of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Though room is small but comfortable and clean. MTR is close by so access is very convenient. Good choice for budget stay in HK

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Phil A
Reviews.Content: Clean, small room. We booked this hotel specifically for the harbor view. We were on the 20th floor at the end of the hall. The view was pretty good, but could have been better as our room was recessed from the front of the building, which blocked the view to the left. Good WiFi connection with individual passwords for each device. (I'm not sure if this makes it more secure) It is extremely close to the North Point MTR station (about a 30 second walk), which is really convenient, but the North Point area in general is not as exciting as other sections of the city.

Reviews.Title: “The service is a bit too slow”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stay in the 2nd night and have requested some ice so I call the housekeeping, it take me so long then the call when to the front counter. And I waited for more then 20 min then the ice is being brought up to the room..We thought that we saw the card that the hotel will sever within certain min..

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms with superb view but Small and no WiFi, and impolite Front Desk Officer”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean rooms (Booked 2 rooms), Superb Harbour View, very Near to MTR & Bus Station, Cons: Rooms Size so tiny, No WiFi in room (have to pay, so shame!!), Impolite Front Desk Officer, Only News Channel on TV, rather 'slum' area, difficult to find Muslim/Halal food.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very strategic, it's near to north point MTR station.So, it's easy to go around Hong Kong.This hotel also provides free internet access that's very helpful for travelers to find information about Hong Kong attractions.The price is acceptable and average.However,the size of the room is too small but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: hui88
Reviews.Content: Across the road is airport express bus station, HKD40 per way to or from airport with about 1.5 hour journey. Subway station is just few step away from the hotel. Nice view if you request a harbour view room. Food stall, shopping mall, convenience store etc are in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Firmest mattress I've ever slept on”
Reviews.Author: nykp
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel with little amenities. The best part of this hotel is location - public bus (A11) right across the hotel at the North Point ferry pier which takes about 50 minutes (no traffic) and costs HK40. The hotel is also right next to the MTR North Point station (3-minute walk). The room was small with noisy AC. The worst part was the mattress. It was too hard even though I sleep on firm mattress myself. One plus - we arrived very early in the morning and the hotel did accommodate us without too much waiting time.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with my stay and would gladly stay there again”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: Yeah the rooms aren't that big but unless you want to pay BIG bucks that's the form in Hong Kong so that was a non-issue for a regular visitor like myself Was very happy with the customer service when I had need to speak to members of staff which is always a good thing The free Wi-Fi worked a treat and having a free English language newspaper was a bonus Housekeeping staff were very friendly and efficient and whilst the bed was towards the harder end of the scale I soon got used to it and got good nights of sleep In room facilities - kettle, safe, cupboard, bathroom etc - were all more than sufficient. The beds wouldn't need to have a much higher clearance and you could slide one of the modern breed of "chest" suitcases underneath but having it under the desk area by the window wasn't a major issue Travel to the hotel is easy via the A11 bus from the airport - it terminates directly opposite the hotel - and North Point really isn't that far from the action (10 - 15 minutes tops) thanks to the very nearby MTR service (exit A1 for the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and are coming back in September”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyOMildura
Reviews.Content: Most enjoyable and close to all amenities Can not find fault The staff are pleasant and helpful It's our favourite hotel on Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Our 4 day stay at IBIS North Point, HongKong in June 2012”
Reviews.Author: Subra A
Reviews.Content: From all the reviews we had apprehensions as to our stay at this hotel, but most importantly, its location, although far from the centre of activity is ideal for those with luggages. One can simply take A11 Bus from the Airport and sleep through till coming to the North Point Terminal and drag the suitcases for 4,5 mins to the hotel. The rooms are awfully cramped, being about 70 sq.ft and a fairly tiny bath room & toilet, but with adequate fittings. If 2 average adults are sharing the room with not more than 2 medium sized suitcases, then this room is adequate. The TV works, but most of the channels are uninteresting. The furnishings are minimal but clean. The restaurant food is OK in emergency. We did not take breakfast in the hotel. Due to the Metro being almost next door, we had no difficulty in going anywhere, but one should note that HK Metro is expensive as compared to Beijing, where 2 Yuan carries you from anywhere to anywhere. The elevator could delay you considerably (several minutes), but that did not happen for us. For the price paid (about 65 US $/day), the place is OK.The hotel staff were pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “small room but clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: ioks
Reviews.Content: hotel price quite cheap for HK but location is very far from city although MTR station just 3 minutes from hotel, north point bus terminal just opposite hotel , room very small but clean with good shower/bath room, very small and hard bed not comfy at all.. there's plenty restaurants around hotel.not far from hotel you can find wet market, clothes with cheap price and money changer (good rates).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Excellent View”
Reviews.Author: JTEM
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are small compared to most US hotels, we had a wonderful view of the harbor. The staff at the desk were always pleasant and helpful. Room service is not really an option here, although they do have a restaurant on premises. Very near the MTR and across the street from a ferry, it makes for a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Harbour view at a budget price”
Reviews.Author: filthiestfish
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for one week in May and if we ever return to Hong Kong we would be happy to stay here again. As has been said many times before, the hotel is conveniently located opposite the bus terminal and harbour with Northpoint MTR station just a few steps away. There are a few local restaurants in the vicinity, and tram terminus is about a 5 minute walk. The A11 bus drops you outside the hotel for $40 but I recommend the A12 bus for $45 which takes the shorter route from the airport. The hotel is basic but excellent value for money for those who want a Harbour view without breaking the bank. Our room was small, but not as small as some people have mentioned. There is definetely room to swing a cat here if you try! The double bed was big enough for us both and because it had a mattress topper (as we requested by email prior to our arrival) it was comfortable and we were able to sleep well. We stayed in a non-smoking deluxe room facing the harbour which was great and I would highly recommend that you ask for a high floor. The room had a hairdryer, small empty fridge, flat tv set with a number of local and foreign channels, kettle, tea and coffee, and a chair. One day we needed an iron and ironing board and requested one at reception and this was handled efficiently as housekeeping had them ready as soon as we had entered our room. It has been mentioned that the lifts take 10 minutes to stop but when we were there they never took more than about 3 minutes, and our room was on the 22nd floor. Reception staff were quite pleasant and efficient too. In fact, the only negative was the breakfast which was of poor quality and very basic. I would not bother paying for breakfast here and would instead try Dim Sum somewhere outside. All in all, having low expectations, this was a pleasant experience for us, and with a fabulous harbour view for a fraction of the price we would have paid elsewhere, It was certainly worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, easily accessible by subway and airport bus”
Reviews.Author: YTOAY
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I stayed in this hotel, last time family of four we needed two rooms and double bed is small. Towels are clean and floor are hard wood floors. This time I had a room with harbour view, if you need free wifi ask front desk they will give you login codes. There is a 7 11 just around the corner in case you need to buy drinks or snacks. First time to Hong Kong, show your passport at any MTR stations and ask for tourist tickets for HKD55.00 unlimited travel for 24 hours within MTR and train up to Sheung Shui. Does not include Airport Express.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but skip breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ChrisDesNZ
Reviews.Content: Great location and brillant value for money. We stayed in a deluxe room which had good harbour views. Friendly staff and very close to MRT and bus stop. Easiest way to get to the hotel is by bus from the airport A11 - it will drop you right outside the front door, accross the road - only $40 HKG for two. The rooms are typical for Hong Kong, smaller in size compared to what you might be used to - also skip the breakfast buffet, better to take this elsewhere. Overall a good stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location with friendly reception”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location was strategic near the MTR North Point Station. Around the Hotel very easy to find local food and also near the food court and ferry Terminal. Very convinient. But the bed was too hard.

Reviews.Title: “North Point Ibis”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms too small location good view great i have very little to comment about. would stay again if we could secure corner room which appeared to be larger

Reviews.Title: “The cheaper alternative”
Reviews.Author: Walter_triccie_reese
Reviews.Content: My intention for this trip was to shop and not to relax to the bodies contentment that why I chose a budget hotel like ibis north point .At my check in they were very accommodating, letting us use the room 2 hours early since we arrived at almost lunch time. That was a big factor for us to have time to freshen up before going in our shopping adventure. The hotels location next to an mtr station was great! We can go by public transport and a save time with the reliable and efficient train system. We were able to head to our shopping destinations and back with no waiting time, just a speedy walk . The hotel is surrounded by homegrown restos that would satisfy your palate. Only that everything is written in their native dialect which is Cantonese . We had to settle with those offering pictures of the food that we could easily point out. The art of sign language is very useful. After dining, have some water to go, the hotel does not give complimentary bottled water . But there is a refrigerator only that it is empty. The view from our room was expectacular! Get to see the whole bay . We stayed on the 25th floor. I guess the higher the better in this case. The bed and pillows were great. Although the television was kinda small, it was useful. The breakfast choices were not that much but would already satisfy the need for a decent meal. The hotel was worth it's price .

Reviews.Title: “Decent value hotel but skip the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: NobleEngineer
Reviews.Content: Small but clean room, I even had a good view of Victoria Harbour, and is less than a block from the Java Road MTR stop so reaching it is easy. North Point is a bit away from central Hong Kong, but that's part of the reason for the reasonable price. My issue with the hotel was the breakfast selection. I selected it as an option when I reserved the room, it was extremely limited- only juice was orange, only cereal was cornflakes, fruit was limited to a few apples and oranges, bread was just toast and croissants. There were a few meats, but thought it was mediocre at best even for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Strictly for Business ONLY”
Reviews.Author: nitinkalra
Reviews.Content: Staying at Ibis North Point with my wife was good but not what you expect on a vacation. The rooms were extremely small, the bed wasn't even queen size - It surely was for 1 person only. The sleep was disturbed by the size of the bed for sure. The bathroom was too cramped, rooms so near to one another that one could hear the other person talking in the room. Breakfast was again average - nothing outstanding to talk about. The only good thing was its location next to the MTR and Ferry terminals. Well, if you are out there for business and alone - use Ibis. Else avoid, especially if you are with a kid or two kids - they simply won't fit in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel for single/couples. Not for family with kid(s)”
Reviews.Author: amalan_2012
Reviews.Content: A good budget hotel for single travelers or couples. We stayed for a week in June (1st to 7th) with my son (7 yrs old). Cons (first): Rooms are a difficult squeeze. No space below bed to slide in bags (must increase floor to bed bottom clearance). Rooms extremely small. Corridors ridiculously narrow (< 4 ft.). You'd think that a city like HK would have standards for minimum width (considering evacuation during emergency purposes). The sprinklers, fire/smoke detectors and alarms would only serve to alert/wet people. Evac is the key to safety. The air-con thermostat doesnt work (Room 1703). TV channels (free) are sparingly provided. But given the room size, not an issue. cant stay in and watch TV except prior to nap time. Pros: That aside, the front desk staff are all right. Not too welcoming. But not too cold either. The major plus is the bus terminal right across from the hotel. A-11 from the airport drops you at the terminal at HK $40 (adult) / HK $20 (child). Real cheap when you consider train + taxi option (> HK $250). North Point to Central MTR is about $6 (adult) / $3 (child) which is nearly the same even if you were to stay in other areas in HK. This side of the island is less crowded and you can breathe. Eat-outs are less, but you have two Wellcome Dept Stores, 7 Elevens, McD and a bunch of chinese shops. Manageable. Area is also quite safe. Although post 10 pm, all shops/joints tend to close-out quick and the area empties itself. Try to book before 2/3 weeks and the rates are THE BEST/LOWEST in HK. You will average about HK $600 for a city-facing room. Can't beat that. Nuff said.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience”
Reviews.Author: GLKY
Reviews.Content: 5D4N with IBIS. A magnificent harbor view from my "11 sqm" deluxe room. That aside you would get a value for money nite stay in HK for this. If your size is slightly above average weight (L size and above) you might have some difficulties moving around the bath and toilet area - be prepared for bruises on elbows! Breakfast was reasonable, serving local and American buffet style meal all for HKD55. Plus point is, it has great location in HK Island where it's just few shops away from the MTR, on the high street. I reckon its about less than 5 mins brisk walk. Staffs are friendly, speaks English. On a frequent basis, they seem to have lots of tourist from mainland China. When this happens, you might find yourself "squash-ed" in the lift areas and lobby as they just don't queue! :) so just need to be wary of these and where your room might be located as the level of noise pollution from your "neighbours" may interrupt your peace.

Reviews.Title: “With the same budget, one can get better hotels elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: thegohtravellers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ibis for 1 night in Feb 2012. The check-in counters of the hotel is located at the second storey. Check-in was rather fast with a friendly staff who upgraded my brother's room. However, i would not say the same for the counter beside us, the lady at the counter simply raised her voice and stared sternly at the guest in the queue and said "Can you wait!!" when the guest tried to ask a random question. Though the guest was also in the wrong as it was not his turn at the queue yet, but i feel that the lady could have used a gentler approach to handle the situation. Was disappointed upon entering the room as it was very small, the toilet looked very aged and did not make one feel like it's a hotel toilet. The corridor leading to the rooms was also quite dull looking. Perhaps, the only good thing about this hotel is the location, it's just a few steps from the entrance to MTR NorthPoint. But with the same budget, i will spend my nights in better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Near and yet far....”
Reviews.Author: myusrin
Reviews.Content: The reason why we chose this hotel in the first place is because of its location, near to the MRT station. But we didn't realized that the distance from the North Point MRT station is far from the most of the places of interest. Thus we ended up spending more time on the MRT. Overall: Location is Great for Business but Good for Vacation Room size... I think everyone knows about the hotel room size in hong kong... it is super small

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ibis North Point while in Hong Kong and found everything about the hotel great. Would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Xavieralv
Reviews.Content: Almost perfect if you stay for business. But if you need to take the lift, stay calm. Only 2 for so many story.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: jkt_traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and booked 5 rooms. Pick this hotel just because theres no more hotel with 5 rooms available for our big group. The only positive thing about this hotel is that North Point MTR station is very close, other than that? Nothing!! If you come with a taxi, no matter from, either airport nor city center, no driver would directly know the place, the name of the hotel does not familiar, even the name of the street. One evening we return from Nathan road, and the kind driver spent almost the entire trip making phone calls using his personal cell phone just to know where exactly the hotel was. Check in, no smile, no greeting, no nothing. We arrive at 00.00 and the check in lady probably is tired, but what about us?!! Guests who had been traveled a long way to HK, should we told her that we were tired too, but yet we still greet her with a smile. Price is ridiculously expensive considering the location and the level of the hotel (3 star? i dont think so). Although this is not our first stay in HK, and definitely not our first experience with HK hotel, I still think the room was very small, again compare to the price we pay. Shower also very small, typical Ibis I guess, but what worst is that they dont provide bath mat, so for sure the whole bathroom area was flooded after you showered. Can not comment on service, as we receive none. Last night of our stay there, one of my friend wake up because she feels something on her hand, which turn out to be cockroach!! They do compensate us for this horrifying experience, and only after this they start to treat us nicely, well too late mate, we're off soon then ever!! I've stayed in Ibis chain in several expensive cities, like Paris, but I can honestly say that this one is definitely the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service very POOR”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Customer service of this hotel is the worst I have experienced. We (with my wife and kids ( 3 and 5 yrs old) stayed in the hotel for 5 days, May 2012. One of the best attribute of the hotel is its location - close to the terminal of the Cityflyer just across the street and exit of the Northpoint MTR. On our last day upon checking out, the weather was bad, it was raining pretty hard. With my 2 kids, 2 luggages and backpack, it was very difficult for us to walk across the street and go to the bus terminal without getting wet. So I asked the manager on duty at that time if they can assist us to just cross the street and get to the bus terminal. It really wouldn't take really long because the terminal is just walking distance, we just need someone to carry one of our luggages so that we can safely take our 2 kids. The manager declined. What's more surprising is the reason why he declined. He said that they cannot help me because the insurance of their employees is within the premises of the hotel only. If something bad happens to their employees outside the hotel, the company will not be able to compensate them. Wow, is this how Ibis Hotel define Customer Service? They did not even consider the fact that we have 2 kids and that the weather is just simply bad at that time. What could possibly go wrong to their employee crossing the street which could not happen to us crossing the same street? Good location, affordable price but customer service sucks!

Reviews.Title: “nothing fancy but in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Alexander C
Reviews.Content: Clean, simple hotel and nothing fancy. Price is reasonable and affordable in an expensive place like Hongkong. Location is also great for those who are familiar and have frequently travelled to Hongkong . Best accessible by airport bus as last stop station is just in front of the hotel. Plenty of eating places to choose from in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “IBIS hotel overlooking Victoria Harbor”
Reviews.Author: MarkOlsen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the IBIS North Point at the beginning of May 2012. The hotel is very easy to get to from the airport (HKG) by taking the A11 CityFlyer bus for $40 HKD and getting off at the last stop (#21) and then walking across the Ferry Terminal parking lot to the hotel. I could also have gotten on the Airport Express Train for $100 HKD to the Central Station and then a taxi or the Metro (North Point station, exit A1, Java Road) to the hotel. The hotel lobby is actually on the second floor (the ground floor has nothing). The hotel is small with 31 floors and only 2 incredibly slow elevators. I paid extra and got a room with a view of the harbor which, from an upper floor, is really amazing as the window was large and there are were no buildings to block the view. The hotel is a good value for the money in a city where everything is incredibly expensive. I had a double room and the room is so small the bed was pushed up against one wall - acceptable for a single traveler but it could be a problem for 2+. The bathroom was obviously very small with weak water pressure in the shower. The room had only hardwood floors, great blackout curtains, a small Samsung flat screen TV, desk, chair, full length mirror, safe, refrigerator, hairdryer, tea kettle and comfortable bed with mushy pillows. I did hear the people in the neighboring room talking and doors slamming in the hallways so it was not as quiet as I would have liked. There was breakfast available but it wasn't included in my room rate so I can't comment on the quality. The hotel does allow smoking on some floors so be sure to check the "non-smoking" option when making your reservation if that's important. There were 2 Internet PC's in the lobby to send and receive e-mails but no printer. The room was small, the hallways were small, the elevators were small and the price was small. I was only in the room to shower and sleep so I was looking for a good value hotel near the Metro and Tram and the IBIS North Point fit the bill. If you're looking for a clean, good value hotel near a CityFlyer bus stop and a Metro station then this hotel would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money (by HK standards!)”
Reviews.Author: AndyI2
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong is not a cheap place when it comes to hotels, but I was really pleased with my stay at the Ibis North Point. Rooms are typical Ibis - clean, modern and functional. Yes, the rooms are on the small side, but if you're expecting to find capacious, palacial rooms for this sort of price, then Hong Kong isn't the city for you! It's worth paying the little bit extra for a superior room - not only are the rooms slightly larger, but you're also likely to get a harbour view which, if you're on a high-ish floor, is quite stunning (as other reviews have mentioned). The room has a fridge, tea and coffee facilities, and as a single traveller who just wanted somewhere to sleep, shower and shave, it was more than adequate. A lot of reviews make reference to the lifts. Yes, there are only two of them, and they're a bit on the small side, but I never really had a problem with them the whole time I was there, rarely having to wait more than 3-4 minutes for one to arrive. The location of the hotel is a little bit out of the way, but with a MRT station almost next door (turn left out of the hotel and walk for a few metres - entrance is on your left), and the trams stopping nearby, it's pretty easy to get around. In getting from the aiport, I'd recommend the Airport Hotel-link Limousine coach service (especially if you're arriving late at night), as it'll drop you right at the hotel door. Would defintely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “So so hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickvegas
Reviews.Content: Yes, the view is nice, but there are a few issues. I arrived late, knackered and checked in only to discover I was on a smoking floor. My fault, I should have confirmed I suppose, but there are so many non-smoking floors, so I assume they were quite full. 2 lifts for 30 odd floors??? This just doesn't work. 5-10 minutes to wait for a lift. Breakfast was bland, but then again, it is a budget hotel of sorts. There is a 15 minute guarantee for service requests which I saw too late after I called reception to ask for a adaptor for my laptop. Lastly, I have never stayed in a hotel where there wasn't water in the room...even during the floods in Bangkok lat year when it was impossible to find water on the shelves of 7-11, the Ibis Bangkok had water.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms. Staff wasn't great. But the place is clean an location is great!”
Reviews.Author: debu s
Reviews.Content: Great hotel at north point station. The rooms are really tiny but it's clean and functional. We barely stayed in the room. It's definitely a double bed at most so of you are large or need the space in bed I wouldn't recommend this hotel. Extremely close to metro which was helpful! It's only ten mins by metro to causeway bay and central areas. Staff at the hotel Sorrta sucked. The visitor info tour kiosk staff wasn't that knowledgable. Maybe it was a language barrier? Do not do the bus tour the hotel offers as it seemed like it was a tourist trap. It's easy to get to places in hongkong and walking around is great! Staff behind the counter too seemed to not care. At first I thought it was a language thing but we've been traveling now for a few weeks and hit countries with language barriers and never felt of bad staff till we got here. But if you don't care then don't worry. The hotel is 1 min from exit A of north point metro station. To save money, take the bus A11 from the airport to the hotel. It literally drops you in front of the hotel in the bus lot.  Don't take the mtr from the airport. It's more expensive and be a pain to lug luggage at the mtr station as you would need to transfer. Bus has free wifi and is only 40 hkd.  Hongkong has one of those double decker bus tours. We didn't do it as it was expensive and everything in hongkong is easy to find. We bought a day metro pass for 55 hkd each but it didn't include the buses. Only the underground metro. If you do Victoria peak, do not pay extra for the sky terrace. Just take the tram up, and go to the peak gallery building and u can view from the top of that. It's not worth he extra money for the sky tower option. It's a tourist trap. U can walk easily from central station to the entrance of Victoria peak. It was about a ten to fifteen min walk. Or you can take a bus from central station. Be sure to goto the nunnery at diamond hill metro stop. It was fantastic. We also felt the ladies market was by far the better market. The night market was just really crappy compared to it. So all in all the hotel is fine but really small. Book it if you are ok with small rooms. For the price and location it's great!

Reviews.Title: “Basic rooms, outstanding views”
Reviews.Author: Dennis B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at quite a lot of hotels in HK of various standards. The ibis North Point may be one of the best value-for-money. Located about 10 minutes with MTR (subway) from central areas of HK Island, and a bit more to Kowloon. My room had spectacular views over the strait and towards Kowloon. Rooms was quite small, and I probably couldn't swing a cat. Fridge (no mini-bar), small plasma TV (various international channels including english, german, french, japanese), safe. Free wifi internet. While HK is one of the safest cities in the world, I do find it a bit worrying that everybody can walk into the hotel and take the elevator without passing the front desk (1 floor up from ground level) or any staff. Odd odor in the hallway. Bus A11 from airport directly to the front of the hotel (about 60 minutes). Breakfast nothing to write home about, very basic, standard ibis stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall very good, clean and very convenient which is a short distance from the MTR. Also a bus station opposite where you take the bus direct to airport. Excellent location. Room size a bit small though however for single occupancy should be alright. Reception very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Quite OK”
Reviews.Author: Postcode
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ibis North Point a few years ago and vowed never to return. It was dirty, very dirty, service was bad, internet access was expensive. However after reading some recent reviews here I decided to give it another try. I am glad I did. Gone are the old carpets that I would not walk on, replaced by new flooring. Cleanliness of the room and bathroom were good. Staff at the desk were very pleasant at check in and obliging with storing my luggage for the day on my departure. Internet was good, fast, reliable and password protected. North Point is a bit away from most tourist sights, however transport is excellent and it gave me the opportunity to take the tram each day. Yes, the rooms are small. Just be aware of that. I took the breakfast option and was very satisfied with that. Management has obviously taken on board feedback from previous customers and has made considerable improvements to the hotel and how things operate. As long as the price remains at a competitive level I will return. Tip - For a few extra dollars, wake up to the harbour view room.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for overnight”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrive from the Airport after mid-night to check-in, Staff very friendly and helpful. Late checkout was excellent we have much time to do our things in HongKong. Room clean and tidy. Transportation is easy to find, MTR (North Point) just 5 minutes; Bus stop station just in front of the ibis North Point. Many cafe just around the corner. I like staying in ibis. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Poor wifi signal”
Reviews.Author: llengs
Reviews.Content: The wifi in the room are not working at all. Bad Internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: zx0tc
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is really good and convenient. Next door to MTR, bus station and ferry pier. Really friendly staff. Free WiFi in rooms. Good choice for its price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Economical Option in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Nigs67
Reviews.Content: Even though the rooms are quite small (more suitable for a single or two small adults), this is an excellent budget option in a city where cheap hotels are a thing of the past. Although Northpoint is a bit further away from Central (...than say Causeway Bay), the entrance to the Northpoint MRT station is about 50 meters from the front door of the hotel (and therefore most of Hong Kong is easily accessable).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: dredrums
Reviews.Content: I liked this place! The staff was friendly. Room was ok for my needs. Free wifi. Breakfast buffet was reasonable. Location was good. The view from my room too was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with recent stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to others and would stay here again next time I'm in HK - but opt for the habour view rooms to get a great view of the harbour especially at night. I took the A12 airport bus which dropped me off opposite the hotel and the hotel was happy to hold my luggage until check in time in the afternoon. The nearest metro station entrance is a 1 minute walk from the hotel which made it easy to get around Hong Kong. The room is small but was fine for me as I wasn't in the room much. You do hear some noise from the hallway and next-door rooms, but it wasn't too bad. I found the hotel breakfast of good standard with various options and it filled me up. I didn't experience any problems with it only having 2 lifts - I usually didn't have to wait long for one to arrive. Free wifi in the room worked well - you need to get a code from reception.

Reviews.Title: “Good and cheap !”
Reviews.Author: tiago_ken
Reviews.Content: The room was small but clean (superior double room with harbour view). Hotel Staff was helpfull and friendly. Restaurant is cheap and good. Breakfast choice could be better but dinner is really great ! Hotel is just next to the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location and cheap for HK.”
Reviews.Author: stellalocal
Reviews.Content: We had a double and single room with harbour views. The single room had more floor space than the double, even though it was a slightly smaller room , we pushed the double bed to the wall to make slightly more space in the double room. The wifi worked well and the rooms were perfectly adequate, much better than we were expecting for the price. The location is very handy for everything in HK, the MTR stop is right next door and is quick and efficient. You need to book in advance to stay here, we had booked for 3 nights and wanted to extend but it was full, so had to move to another place which was twice the price, smaller and nothing like as good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Vladdhu
Reviews.Content: First of all let me tell you that this is a budget hotel, so you shouldn't get your expectations too high. The rooms are probably the smallest I have personally seen. The bathroom is the same story, you can hardly sit on the toilet or get in the shower and I don't have any extra kg. Apart from that, the rooms are well equipped with small desk, A/C, TV, safe, fridge and Wi-fi, which from my room didn't work that well (it freezes at 15min intervals), from the lobby worked just fine though. The A/C is another story: the windows don't open, so without A/C it's practically impossible to sleep in that hot/moist environment, and with A/C on, even on minimal power you will need a blanket on you all times because it gets very cold and windy because of the extremely small room. It's very conveniently located 15 meters away from the North Point MTR station on the Island line, you can be downtown in 15min. The personnel is decent and the hotel in general is very clean. They only have two slow elevators, and when servicing a 31 story hotel that could mean a few minutes wait to get up and down. So, it's a good budget choice, the price is the top argument here. You can sleep, hop in the MTR and stay in the center all day without paying 2-3 times more. They have continental breakfast which gets boring really quickly and a limited choices restaurant. You are better of eating at the incredibly good and cheap Japanese restaurant nearby (20 meters away, just ask at the reception about it). Their Asahi Japanese beer is among the best beers I have ever head from around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: rsindelar
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a wonderful location for exploring Hong Kong! Literally steps from both the MTR stop as well as the ferry terminal. Like everyone says, the rooms are small, but who stays in the room very long in a city like Hong Kong. Room and bathroom were very clean. Had a room on the top floor facing the harbour and the view was breathtaking. Breakfast buffet in the morning had quite a few options, both Chinese and western. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Great value overall!

Reviews.Title: “Far from city but clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Phanuphong
Reviews.Content: This is actually my 3rd time stay at iBis North Point. This time I booked Standard Room with 1 Single Bed Harbour View which allow only 1 person in the room. The room is a bit smaller than normal double bed room but it's a good fit for 1 person. I tried to find more actual single bed photo from Tripadvisor but can't find it so this time I want to share the actual photos from Standard Room with 1 Single Bed Harbour View. Hotel now provide free wifi for every guest, passcode need to ask at hotel reception, the passcode will valid only for 48 hrs, if you want to extend the wifi access you have to ask the new passcode again. The only thing to complain for this room is the room is a connecting room and you can hear the voice from another room because there is the connecting door. All the Standard Room with 1 Single Bed are Harbour View, so if you are solo traveller you won't regret the view from your room window.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, but slightly away from the action”
Reviews.Author: PhileasFogg1980
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only about 50metres away from exit D1 of North Point metro station, which is a plus! But if you use the lift, when you come out do a U-turn and cross over the main road and carry on straight. Take the 2nd right and the hotel is about 100metres on your right. One negative is the lift is abit slow and has a funny order....it will sometimes pass you to collect someone then come to you, which can use up time! The breakfast was good serving local and western food. Reception were friendly and very helpful! The rooms were a little small, esp the bathroom but as I was travelling alone it didn't bother me too much. If you take the harbour view rooms, you wont be disappointed. They are spectacular, esp at night! It seemed like the main areas were Causeway Bay, Wan Chai and Kowloon (this was my 1st trip to HK) which are not too far from the hotel but it means you have to take extra time for travelling! The hotel has its own spa and tour desk which was convenient. A good hotel, and would not have a problem returning

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but tiny rooms!”
Reviews.Author: sazkebab
Reviews.Content: When I had read other reviews prior to our stay at this Ibis I thought the size of the rooms were merely an exaggeration.......but they truely are tiny. Please note that I am only giving an average rating because the size of the room affects this, otherwise this hotel would score alot higher. However all else aside this hotel forms a good base for exploring Hong Kong. We stayed here for 3 nights and to be honest spent so little time in the room the size was not really an issue in the end. This hotel is cheap for Hong Kong although like Manhattan, expensive in the real world at £70 per room per night. The hotel was clean and rooms very basic but we were pleased with our stay. Located 2 mins walk from North Point subway it makes exploring the city easy, with also the bus station directly outside. Get the bus number A11 bus from airport directly to bus terminal in about an hour which is ideal. The staff here were extremely helpful and stored our bags until our evening flight with no issues. Free wifi in the rooms was also great. Can't really fault our stay except the small room size, a longer stay may have been not quite as comfortable. All else aside we would probably return here if looking for low cost accommodation in the city.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: JobeeToronto
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel. The rooms are very small, but that is typical of Hong Kong. The rooms are newly renovated, clean and comfortable. Ours had a stunning view overlooking the water. It is just steps from the North Point subway station and the North Point neighbourhood itself is tons of fun. Lots of shops and restaurants around. The staff were very helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Valued place to stay at HKG”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Just only a minute walk from A1 exit at North Point MTR Station, I was arrived at the one of the valued place to stay in HKG. Will return to this hotel whenever visit HKG again.

Reviews.Title: “BOTH GOOD AND BAD!!”
Reviews.Author: 1globetrotterSweden
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at a comfort room on the 18th floor and a week later, five nights, in a standard room at the 26th floor. Very different experiences. The comfort room at the 18th floor was just ok. Nice clean room with great view. The standard room at 26th floor (room 2607) was a very different experience. For some reason that room was connected to the the room next door with just a thin closed door, And that meant that you could hear EVERYTHING from the room next door. All standard room are not in this way but my room should have been half price!! It's a real disaster to have it the way I had it!! So look out for that!!!! The area where the hotel is located is a great area of Hong Kong. Very genuine with great shops and markets. I really liked the North Point area!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Enoikos
Reviews.Content: I used to be an A-club silver member, until they didn't credited my account with the correct points, despite several emails and lost my status. I became once more the victim of their promotion about "get your lost points back" ... by staying in one of the Accor group hotels. Apparently there are many reasons for selecting a hotel, ... do not underestimate the loyalty schemes... especially for frequent travellers. Since this was the primary reason, I cannot complain for the extra tiny room which was "functional". Room was seperated with an inner locked door with the adjacent one, therefore "sound isolation" was inexistent. Sleep comfort is also an important factor and again this was one more "hick-up" due to the hard-matress and the short-length bed. I gave above average rating due to outstanding price for Hong-Kong standards, free internet, very good breakfast and the fact that by just crossing the road you get on-board to the Airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Peninsula, but a good second choice”
Reviews.Author: WHDavies
Reviews.Content: The Penthouse Suite at the Peninsula was booked, so we stayed for 4 nights at this ibis instead. The location is excellent, just a few yards from the Metro station, or a block from the tramways. Rooms are small, but manageable if you don’t plan to spend much time in them. There is a room safe, good WiFi, and English speaking channels on the TV. If you’re just looking for somewhere clean and safe to stay in Hong Kong, this is as good as anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Daytripper1on1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week, tiniest room I have ever stayed at in HK, great ocean view though !!housekeeping was quite good, buffet breakfast was actually better than expected given the cheap budget atmosphere prevailing in the hotel, no complimentary bottled water in the room - however, lots of convenience stores in the neighbourhood, lots of local eateries with some really good food. Just 2 elevators, so it could take forever to get the elevator to stop if your room is on the mid level floors. Convenient location - just a minutes walk from the MTR A1 exit

Reviews.Title: “Good deal.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I like Best : Excellent room service, friendly and efficient front desk. great view of the harbor, next to MTR and bus terminal. Good restaurant and store nearby. Single bed room is best for single traveler. Good hot water kettle. I like Least : Very Hard bed, would be a plus if a thin foam mattress is added on top of the existing mattress. TV is place too high and wrong angle make it difficult to view in bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: SG__traveller8585
Reviews.Content: Stay for 5D4N in the harbour view room early this month.. TV, bed, toilet pretty good as a tourist. Internet access at lobby, pretty good to do some quick-research on daily planning. Housekeeping top-notch, pretty glad on the cleanliness when back to hotel room every night. Nearby there was a dessert shop(5-10min walk, located behind the hotel) selling nice desserts at night(tried it 3/4 nights there).. Will book this hotel if coming back to HK for another holiday trip

Reviews.Title: “sometime the lift not able to keep up with the customer's need not stop at the level and skip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The lift wasn't very convince to the customer, occasional which did not stop at the floor, need to walk down the stairs few occasion, need improvemnet on this point

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Convenient to move around only two beds were too small for two people.Breakfast cost is quite reasonable.WI-fi only access around the second floor. Difficult to get access in the room. Convenient to board the bus totheairport which park infrontof the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very nice service, the stuff is very friendly.... good location, very beautiful view, the worth price. I will chose this hotel next time when I visit Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Away from the city center, small but inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: Cmon83
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an affordable Hotel in Hong Kong which is clean and ok, you're right in the ibis. Sure, the rooms are very small and you're not near the city center. But if you take the subway it's not a big deal (the station is less than a 1/2 minute from the hotel). And who stays in the hotel room when visiting Hong Kong anyway? ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Great budget location”
Reviews.Author: 2travelersLondonUK
Reviews.Content: This is a clean hotel that is well used its in a great location, North Point Metro stop is just a few doors away and there is a bus terminus opposite the hotel. The rooms are small let's be clear about this right away, but who goes to Hong Kong to stay in their room? The En suite bathrooms are a little tired but the shower is brilliant. The hotel has free Wi Fi you need to ask for a code when you check in this will last you 48 hours so if your stay is longer ask for two codes... Simple. The hotel says each room has views of the city but ours didn't but we didnt mind as we were not in it very much. The hotel can be a bit noisy as building standards are not what we are used to. The bed was a very firm Chinese type but we had four good nights sleep on it. The staff were a little indifferent at times and could use some Customer Service training as they did not seem to realise that the guests are the ones who bring money into the hotel. Having been a little critical over all this hotel, it was terrific value and staying there did not take anything away from our visit to a wonderful city

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A combination of good location and, by HK standards, a reasonable price recommend this hotel to travelers without fat expense accounts. Service is minimal but the cleanliness and functionality of rooms make up for this.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Agreed that meal come with 10% service charge in the restaurant, but why must pay the tips also? as I was being asked by your waitress when I made the payment, so I top-up twenty dollars as tips.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in a great city!”
Reviews.Author: ACtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the IBIS North Point in March. The location is a bit out of the way but nice to get away from the super busy Nathan Road area. Take the A11 bus from the airport, end of the line is right in front of the hotel, cheaper than taking the airport express train (and you can enjoy the view on the way) Had the hotel breakfast each day, not bad, not great either but it was convenient. The rooms are small but that was OK, you have to expect this in Hong Kong. Staff were all very helpful. The Harbour view is great! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at IBIS North Point Hong Kong.”
Reviews.Author: thaicuisineexperts
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviews that room is small but I have stayed in Sheraton paid double and room was same size. IBIS North Point is a excellent clean hotel with good price. Reception should be on ground floor. But Hong Kong is a city where space is a problem. I would like to write about this hotel staff: Mr.Parkon Chung, such a great Customer Service Agent, who looked after my reservation very professionally. Mr.Vincent Ho Customer Service Manager,a professional who accommodate and solves problems at spot. I recommend these two IBIS Hotel personnel to be commended. I will come again and stay in IBIS Hong Kong North Point because of these individuals. Say my thanks to them personally.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, an awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: EYLAH44
Reviews.Content: After reading the Tripadvisor reviews and canvassing for a hotel to stay in from Feb 25-28, I finally found myself finalizing my booking in Ibis North Point. From the airport, we bought an Octopus Card (worth 150HKD) and used it to pay for the A11 bus (fare going to North Point is 40 HKD). W rode the A11 Bus to North Point (Exit is at the right side of the MTR Airport Train from the arrival area), and the last stop was at a bus stop across the hotel. In was a scenic drive that lasted for about an 1 hour and 30 minutes, and the driver's maneuvering skills attest to the fact that when they say 2:25pm, they mean it. :) Cross the street to get to the hotel, past the North Point MTR station entrance. Everybody's quite disciplined and listens attentively to the cow bells, so crossing won't be a problem. Check-in was a breeze. Though nobody helped us bring our bags to the room, it was ok since the elevator was right beside the reception area. It took us 10 minutes for each elevator ride. Wasn't a big deal for us though, as we only had the need to use the elevator twice in a day - when we leave and arrive. We got Room 2610. Though it was really foggy during our stay, the view was spectacular. Yes, the room is quite small, but it gave us ample space to move around. Wifi in the room was good, and they gave me the mattress topper that I requested prior to check-in. The receptionist even confirmed this the moment we arrived. And yeah, the mattress wasn't as hard as I expected it to be (based on the reviews). True that the walls are not sound proof, as I can hear the guests in the other room talking. I even remember one of the guests saying "hush" to her companion as the walls were quite thin, so probably that's why we were able to sleep well - as everybody was mindful of everyone else. :) There are no guards in the entrance but we felt pretty safe. Everything is just an arm's stretch away - from the North Point MTR Station to the 711 where you can re-load your Octopus Cards to restaurants that serve local food early in the morning til late night. Felt dismayed though that I wasn't able to eat authentic hand-pulled noodles around the area - probably because of the language barrier. The buffet breakfast was good value for money. Food selection was pretty good for the price. Have breakfast by the window so you can appreciate the harbour while dining. They allow late check outs for a fee; so if paying extra is not an option, you can just leave your luggage with them after you check out. For my next trip in HK, I'll stay in Ibis again. Thanks for the awesome stay!

Reviews.Title: “A ( not too expensive) hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong hotels are very expensive, so this is not a bad alternative , its location is great for access to the metro, just a few metres from North Point Station. It is in a more residential area , so not much to see nearby, exept the usual markets and local eateries. The staff were very polite and very quick to respond to a problem. The only downsides were that there seems to be a ventilation problem , my room was full of condensation every morning and there was a damp smell in the bathroom. Also there are only 2 lifts and you could find yourself waiting 10 minutes to get into your room.

Reviews.Title: “Average Experience”
Reviews.Author: Pet1966
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Hong Kong Feb-Mar 2012 and stayed at the Ibis. If your a solo traveller with small bags itsokay to stay at the Ibis, but if your staying as a couple and have large luggage dont go near the place. Rooms are too small.... Staff were proffesional

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: FarewellFire
Reviews.Content: Pros: Next door to the MTR means a 10-15 trip to Central and relatively painless transfer to airport via Express Train. Cheap (this is Hong Kong after all) Clean rooms Free WiFi Cons: Tiny rooms (this is Hong Kong after all) Unexciting neighborhood. Hard bed Two elevators to serve 30+ floors Would I stay there again? Yes, all in all it is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located on the Java Rd. Obviously it is less touristy than the other part of the city. But it is easily accessible by any transportation modes. The MTR North Point station is only a couple of doors away while the airport bus stop is just in front of the door on the other side of the Java Rd. North Point Pier for ferry to Kowloon is also in the vicinity. The rooms are very small in size. So are the beds. The twin-bed appears to be one queen bed divide by two. It is definitely not for the one who loves to move around while sleeping. Ask for the room on higher floor to enjoy the view of the Victoria Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: DelOwul
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel last year during my two day trip to HK. It was very pleasant stay. I've checked in earlier than 14:00 without any problems and had a perfect room with harbour view without asking for it. Really amazing harbour view!)) The room was big enough, although I have book the cheapest one at the official web-site. Everything was clean enough. The second day I have checked out early and have left my luggage at the reception without any fees or problems for around 5-6 hours. I had a very good European style breakfast for a quite reasonable price. The staff was very courteous and assisted me in any way possible. And the location is very good - 30 seconds to MTR North Point Station and facing the bus terminus and the ferry terminal. Just perfect for both business and sightseeing trips!

Reviews.Title: “Good Views overlooking the Harbour.”
Reviews.Author: nickyaskey
Reviews.Content: On arrival the Front Desk Guy was extremely rude however the other 2 were friendly and helpful the manager from here has contacted me and apologized for this. The room had a lovely view of the Harbour this is why we picked this hotel. There is a shuttle bus from the Airport it drops you off across the road from the hotel for 40Hkd this was very convenient it's 1hour from the Airport. The lifts can be very slow at times you can wait up to 5mins for it to come. The rooms were a decent size, the beds were really comfortable too. I don't think they are worth 80euro which is what we payed they were worth around 50euro we only stayed here for 2 nights though so it was ok if you were here a week it would be a bit too pricey. There was free Internet in the rooms too. You are 2 mins walk to the Mtr train station and buses outside and trams too. So it's very easy to commute from here.

Reviews.Title: “poor hospitality and tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: prettygis
Reviews.Content: stayed from february 17-19 and paid for 2 beds for 1300HK$. the single bed is about 18in in width and seems custom made for the ibis chain of hotels since i have not seen a bed narrower than that. the pros of the hotel are 3. location (bus stop is across the street) price per night (90USD a night) and the lone bellhop who helped keep our bags for us. the cons include slow elevators, tiny room and bed, and the smell of smoke on the 1108 room. while we specifically asked for a non-smoking room, the room smelled like cigarettes bec the floor below ours was a smoking floor. perhaps the exhaust did not work enough. in any case we refused to stay despite their "solution" to spray room freshener. we demanded to be moved to another room and was told that the hotel was fully booked (which we refused to believe). if we did not make any threats, they would never have transferred us. upon checking, they said a room was available on the 15th floor and so we moved. there was no need to lie to us and say that the hotel was fully-booked. even if it was a budget hotel, we expect to be given what was due to us; a non-smoking room. if you want something done in this hotel, you have to be extra assertive. perhaps next time we will look into staying at central even if we have to pay a little bit extra.

Reviews.Title: “Really Bad for what they're charging!”
Reviews.Author: buttonville
Reviews.Content: We're staying at the Ibis and all I can say is I will not return. The bed is small and as hard as rock. When we asked for extra pillows they only have one to offer! The size of the bed would not fit two an average North American couple. It's no wonder they take your money up front because you'll want to leave after the first night. I'm sure there are other choose given what they charge. There is no tube and the size of the room is not much bigger than a cruise ship. The only thing it has going for it is that it's opposite to the bus terminal when you take A11 bus for 40HK dollars. During the summer we stayed at the City Garden up the street and it's so much better for the same price. Too bad when we booked there was no room.

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled”
Reviews.Author: COCOLINA1962
Reviews.Content: We were NOT so excited to stay at this hotel due to the previous stay's experience. ( Super-small-room and super-tiny-bathroom and anything was kind of gross) but the price is good and we heard about the renovation, so we decided to give it a try again and booked the harbor view, twin room.
