( cheapest room) And a pleasant surprise! The room was renovated and much better and the bath looked a little bigger, even though the twin bed was like for the toddler. Very very tiny bed !!! I am an Asian woman so I could manage to sleep but NOT for the big fat tall people!!!!!!!! So if you are NOT an asian and are not used to this kind of bed, don't book especially for the twin room. Otherwise, the subway North Point is right next door, so very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: jillie_sg
Reviews.Content: 1. Location Bus A11 stops at the terminus outside the hotel. Bus ride took about an hour. MTR stop is just a hop away from the entrance of the hotel, but I've tried taking bus from the street behind the hotel and it is just as convenient. 2. Service Much as I understand that standard check in time is 2pm. But most places I go to make an attempt to check if the room is available and allow you to check in earlier if the room is available. Regardless of that, at least they did offer guests the options of leaving their luggage behind and coming back later to check in. Service was clearly lacking in some of the staff, or it could have been just a Hongkong thing. I read about the lack of service standards in some reviews but thought it was purely objective until I have experienced it. As the staff who was attending to my check in seems pretty curt, I have attempted to make small talk and asked if there was any international exhibitions going on in HK that weekend. His reply appalled me. His comment was that, HK is always crowded and I should not expect too much out of it. Before I could recover from the unfriendly retort, I was faced with a keycard which does not work. Bear in mind that lifts in this hotel is pretty slow (which is of no fault to the hotel), I have to lug my luggage down to the reception to change the keycard. Once again, another staff changed my keycard with no apology. Surprisingly, it was the housekeeping staff who saw me struggle with the keycard, and she kept apologizing for the inconvenience caused. With my first day of the trip affected, what impressed me most was the GM's prompt reply to my grievances. His service recovery was excellent and definitely something his staff could learn from. 3. Room Basic. No frills. Much as I've read reviews that the mattresses were hard, I've basically slept very soundly for the 3 nights I was there. Harbour view was amazing. Water pressure excellent. Check out was fast and efficient. Pity I did not see the name of the guy, but at least it was friendlier. Took a cab to the HK Airport express station, which costs about 50HKD. Would I stay here again? For the price/ location, perhaps. For the GM's dedication to guests' satisfaction, yes.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are small but this is Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Frozensage
Reviews.Content: Location location location. If you want good access anywhere and don't mind spending time in transit then this place is great for you. This is my third time to Hong Kong but first time staying on this side of Victoria Harbour. When people say the airport bus (A11) is right outside the hotel, they literally mean just that, although being the last stop of the route, expect to be on the bus for a long time. The MTR station is practically 5 doors down from the entrance to the hotel. Whether it's yumcha, ham and egg sandwich, congee or rice dishes you want, there are plenty restaurants and cafes in this area to fulfill your need. For visitors wanting highend shopping, Pacific Place @ Central is just 4-5 stops away. Or take the ferry to Kowloon opposite of the hotel. Now for the rooms. it's small and the bed is small and uncomfortable. You either pay extra for a harbour view room or you get a room, on the other side, looking at some guy cooking in the next apartment. Don't bring alot of (big) luggage, you won't fit them in the room. The beds are on wheels which are supposedly locked down but still moves! We also had to ask for more pillows. The lobby is on the second floor. If you have alot of luggage, best to send one person to check in and then use the elevator from ground floor to save time waiting for the elevator twice. My keycard stopped working on the second day, I had to go all the way down and come back up again. Elevators are few (only two) and far in between!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly pros but be prepared”
Reviews.Author: ikelmay
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Ibis North Point prior to leaving on a cruise. We really liked the area as it retains some authentic character and bustle; it is very well served by bus and metro with an MTR station only 200 metres away and was very easy to access from the airport with an express bus service dropoff directly opposite the hotel. The Ibis was clean and tidy with exceptionally helpful staff. We upgraded to the 'deluxe' room on the first night and this was extended for our whole stay (despite originally being told we would have to move). Deluxe in this case meant the spectacular harbour view rather than anything else. The room is tiny but functional. When I say tiny, I am not exaggerating - you had to move the bed over to access both sides of the bed and it was definitely smaller than a north american queen size. The mattresses are also very much on the firm side. There is barely enough room besides the bed and a wall shelf and chair for anything else, including luggage......Forget swinging a cat, there's barely enough room to swing your arms. Given the price for the room, this was not unexpected and still represented great value for money. The optional buffet breakfast was very good for the price and well worth considering if you are planning on a day of sightseeing. If you need room to move about or are looking for a hotel with the frills of a north american chain, then this hotel isn't for you. If, however, you are seeking great value accommodation and will be out and about all day, then the Ibis will make a worthwhile option for a budget stay in an exciting and fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “budget room with an expensive view”
Reviews.Author: inxpekto
Reviews.Content: I was glad I book the deluxe room as all rooms in this category is facing the Kowloon city. Northpoint MRT is just 3 minutes away from the hotel and there are also trams, taxi, buses easily available. A main bus terminal is just across from the hotel. Very convenient indeed. The room is rather small but that's quite a budget room size and hence I don't complaint. I love the view of the Kowloon city, from my bed. This is the only budget hotel I know in Hong Kong that has the unobstructive multimillion dollar penthouse view of the city. Staff are responsive and courteous. Many mainland Chinese staying here as I was told there're bus pick up service to link Hong Kong to mainland China . There's also a bus stop in front of the hotel for the airport. I highly recommend this hotel for those who loves the room with the metropolitan city view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mastodon38
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ibis from Jan 15th to Jan 18th. For our first time being in Hong kong we found the location to be perfect just a short walk to the the north point mtr station. The front desk staff were very nice and the check in went smoothly. The rooms were a little on the small side and the beds were a little hard but that was ok because we only used the rooms to sleep at the end of the day.They offer free wifi and it was very fast which was nice. Next time we are in Hong Kong we would like to stay in Causeway bay but we would not hesitate at staying at the Ibis because its very affordable and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: pokoberry
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Ibis in North Point in HK. The rooms are VERY small, but are clean and have everything that you will need - TV, hair dryer, in-room safe, and fridge. The room that we got this time was on the 12th floor and upon entering, we could smell the humidity...of course this is due to the weather more than the hotel iteself, but I think something could have been used in the room to get rid of the smell. Again, the room was VERY tiny. We had 2 single beds, but there was only about 3 inches in between the two beds. And the single beds are very narrow (about 2/3 the size of a twin bed). Because the room was so tiny, it was difficult to get around even with just two people in the room. We ended up with a room that had a nice view of the North Point ferry pier. The biggest problem with the hotel though were the elevators. There were only 2 elevators for around 25 floors. Several times we had to wait about 5 minutes before one of the elevators would have room to take us up or down. The staff at the hotel were EXTREMELY polite and friendly. They knew the answer to every question I asked. The hotel is located about 30 seconds from Exit A1 of North Point Station. Very convenient. Also, there is a big bus station right across from the hotel. Even the airport shuttle (A11) stops there. Overall, a very good hotel. If only they could fix the elevator problem...

Reviews.Title: “Hard bed but great location”
Reviews.Author: Tsz_Shan
Reviews.Content: Subway station is just right around the corner. One of the main bus station is across the street. For 40 HKD, you can take bus A11 from the airport straight to the hotel. The bed is hard but you can ask for extra pillows at the lobby and just sleep on that. I would also recommend paying the extra money for the sea view other wise you look into the other building.

Reviews.Title: “the room is very small.”
Reviews.Author: aivychia
Reviews.Content: I guess the only good thing about the hotel is the location as it is located next to the North Point train station. If you do not mind the room and toilet is small, you can choose this hotel. Frankly speaking, I will not come back again. For the amount of money i paid for this hotel, i would rather save it to stay in Hostel or B&B.

Reviews.Title: “Simple & basic”
Reviews.Author: FRHR80
Reviews.Content: As HK is probably one of the most expensive hotel locations in the world, the Ibis seemed decent value upon booking. The good part is the location. It's in the heart of North Point and right next to the MTR, which gets you to HK Central in about 15 minutes. The rooms boast very nice views over the harbour and were clean. Breakfast was cheap and plentiful and staff friendly and efficient. However, the rooms are extremely small, the a/c did not work well and the rooms where humid and moldy, smelling like it had been crashed by a group of crunchy backpackers returning from a three week jungle trail. In addition, the beds where very narrow and short with hard matresses, which would probably be better off in an army barracks. Getting a lift in the morning would sometimes require a ten minute wait, which is a pity when one's room is on the 27th floor. All in all, decent value for money but have no expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest hotel room seen in years!”
Reviews.Author: AlexC_RO
Reviews.Content: I selected the Ibis for an overnight stay in Hong-Kong, because of the price - ~600 HKD. I never thought though that I will stay in a pantry. My room was identical to all other rooms on 18th floor - 3m x 2.5m, and this includes the bathroom :) Th ebed was enough for one person, but the only way I could open my suitcase was to put it in bed, no room on the floor. It is very close to MTR station and convenient for access from teh city, but I would not book again if I am not travelling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for China Coast Marathon”
Reviews.Author: 05toes
Reviews.Content: Located 5 mn walk to China Coast Marathon Shuttle Clean hotel , efficient staff, free reliable Wifi we had a Harbour View room . all toiletries provided, Kettle in room ... PS : if you ask for some extended time in order to take shower after Marathon and check out afternoon... make sure about rate wiht front desk !

Reviews.Title: “Cold room, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Heating in the room is not working. With 14 degrees outside we've got the same inside. Breakfast is poor - small amount to eat. 2 small elevators for 31 floor hotel - you can wait up to 10 minuts because a lot of people trying to move up/down.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ibis North Point”
Reviews.Author: colino1978
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Hong Kong Island / North Point. You can easily reach the hotel by Airport Express-Bus A11 to North Point. It costs just 40 Hong Kong Dollars and the last stop is in front of the hotel. Travel-time >> About 70min. Be careful bus driver don't give change. Close the hotel you can find the Subway station "North Point" and the tramway line, that means you can reach the city center by MRT within approximately 12min. There are many cheap chinese restaurants in the neighborhood and also a MC Donald‘s and a KFC. The room and bed size are very small. But the hotel is clean and there is a free WI-FI acces. Also available in the room are satellite TV, coffee and tea making facilities, a little refrigerator and in room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Small clean room, harbor view, convenient transportation”
Reviews.Author: annageish
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are small, but not that small. They are clean and the view of the harbor is very nice (if you reserve the harbor view room). We were on the 16th floor and were annoyed by the elevator service: both elevators simply passed our floor when we pressed the call button. Once we waited for quite a long time seeing the elevators go up and down without stopping, until the cleaning lady showed us a service elevator on the right side at the exit door. That one stopped right away, so take notice that you can do that. The mattress was very hard. The breakfast was good. The location quite good too: it's not in the center, but all the possible transportation is right there: the subway is in the next building, there are buses and trams on the parallel street, and even the ferries to Kowloon right across from the hotel. From the airport you take the airexpress to Central and change to the Island subway line to North Point.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and Friendly Staff, but Room is too Small”
Reviews.Author: Deddy A
Reviews.Content: Despite a bit remotely east, the hotel location is considered moderate as it is close to Subway station that links us to most parts of the city. North point bus terminal is also lied in front of the hotel making us easy to reach the airport. The main disadvantage is the room's too small, particularly for family travelers like us, and therefor will prevent us to take this hotel again in the future. It is definitely not a recommended hotel for family traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for low cost stay”
Reviews.Author: AP_Russia
Reviews.Content: LOCATION. The hotel has good location just 50 meters from the North Point underground station and 50 meters from the terminal station of the A11 airport shuttle bus. If you are a 1st time HK visitor I would highly recommend you to use this bus instead of underground to go from the airport to the hotel. You will see a lot of locations and get a lot of impressions during this route. ROOMS. Rooms are tiny but clean. But as I understood tiny rooms were peculiar to HK. All of them have local sockets so you should have an adapter or ask for it at the reception desk. In our room we had a problem with electricity. Somehow part of sockets didn't work and we had to call for an electrician twice. After his 2nd visit the problem was fixed. VIEWS. I would highly recommend to book a waterview rooms and ask for an upper floors. Views to the harbour are really magnificent! LIFTS. Yes, they have only 2 lifts for 30 floors so you'll have to wait for them. At the same time I wouldn't consider it as a big problem. STAFF. Reception girls and guys are effective but not exactly friendly (too many visitors probably, no time to smile :)). BREAKFAST. Not delicious and not various. Cannot recommend at all. GENERAL IMPRESSION. Iа you are looking for a low-cost stay and use hotel only for sleeping I would recommend this Ibis to you.

Reviews.Title: “The more things change, the more things stay the same”
Reviews.Author: flapflap
Reviews.Content: Returned for a 5 night stay in January 2012. In the three years since our last stay, our favourite cafe has been replaced with a restaurant and there's now free wi-fi internet in the rooms, although you have to get a new password every 24 hours which must be annoying for both the guests and the reception staff. Other than that the things we liked about the Ibis have remained: clean, convenient and relatively cheap. The things that we didn't like about the Ibis have also remained: slow lifts and hard beds!

Reviews.Title: “Low cost, tiny rooms but with a magnificent view”
Reviews.Author: Richadis
Reviews.Content: The Ibis offers a dream view of the Hong Kong Bay as seen from North Point. If you can bear a small room, with a bed only 2'-4" wide, at an incredibly low rate, no doubt this is your place to stay in HK. When making your reservation, insist on the bay view (because there are rooms looking to the opposite side) and on a high floor (for a yet better view). Great advantages: Excellent connections, the bus from/to the new HK Airport is just opposite the street, and a subway station is next door on the same block. Use the restaurant at the hotel only for breakfast, and you are all set...

Reviews.Title: “valuable hotel in hongkong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is far from the shopping area and the center of hongkong city , it is in a good location because it is a minute walk to the mrt station. The room is as small as in the other hotel in hongkong in the same price but you will get the beautiful scene in the sea-view room. Actually I highly recommend this hotel to everyone. Moreover MRT, bus or tram fare are very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Only one con!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I liked every parts of this hotel except one: The room is not noise-proof at all. Talking and TV noises from the next door were easily heard through the thin connecting door or the wall between the rooms. Also the noise from the housekeepers' cleaning in the early morning really disturbed my sleep after the late night out in this "non sleep" city... Apart from that, I loved the good location, the great view, the reasonable price of this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: near harbor and mtr north point only 3 minutes walks beside hotel so easily go to another place . Near bus station and ferry to Kowloon .good view through a harbor and cruise from hotels windows. A hotel have a lots of room and stairs high over 30 floors

Reviews.Title: “An average experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is not bad, but not close to central attractions either. The cleanness of the surroundings is just ok. The room was somewhat clean, but could have better vacuumed better in the bathroom as during both periods of my long December stay there were always long woman's hair on the floor. The room is extremely small (11sqm). Absolutely not the pattern for an IBIS room. It was more like a Formula 1 room, with the IBIS price at its top. Staff very reliable and helpful (and smiley). I probably would recommend this hotel to a friend after letting him know all the pros and cons.

Reviews.Title: “regular ibis”
Reviews.Author: BanditoUA
Reviews.Content: I was staying in the hotel with my girlfriend 3 nights in late December 2011. This is regular ibis hotel with typical ibis service - simple but good. Rooms are small as in majority of HKG hotels. But it is OK. We were on 19th floor and the view was just perfect. Our window was facing the Kawloon and Tsin Sha Tsu bank. Restaurant is cheap and OK but there are lots of places to eat around. Another good thing is subway station in 40 meters from hotel entrance. Next time I will consider this hotel for staying.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a Spectacular Harbour View”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel provides good value for money but they can improve on the bed mattress quality, it was too hard to sleep and the pillow was too way to soft. Even 2 pillows doesn't help. I want to praise the front desk night manager who check us in with great efficiency on 25 Dec. He was practically super multi-tasking having to also pick up room service calls at the same time. He did a great job! We appreciate the hotel as it is just in front of the North Point MTR station and A11 airport bus terminal. Also, you will never feel hungry as there is one good noodle and porridge shop next door. It was really good for breakfast or supper. Housekeeping was efficient and free Wifi is available. Though the room space was tight but it is more than compensated by a great Harbour View.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very accessible via the MTR North Point station exit A1. Room was clean, but the standard room is very small... View of the harbor was nice though! Staff was good. Had a good night's sleep as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: ellenklhui
Reviews.Content: Went back to visit family and stayed there for 4 nights Nov. 9 - 13, 2011. All reviews I read before said the rooms are really small, and it was, but it wasn't that bad at all, at least my husband and I had a bit of room to move around (I stayed at a hotel with even smaller rooms before "Bridle Tea House in Aberdeen") and we even had a side harbour view. For someone grew up in HK and know HK quite well, Ibis has a great location. The bus terminal (the Airport Bus A11 comes here, HK$40 one way) and the ferry pier (to Hung Hom) are right across from the Hotel, subway is a 5 minutes walk and ten minutes walk you are on Kings Road with numerous bus routes and the trams going all around the Island. Shopping is way too easy but if you prefer some higher end purchases you need to go to Causeway Bay or Central District. There are lots of restaurants in the neighbourhood although we didn't consumer there much since we generally met our friends in Causeway Bay. Buffet breakfast was included in our package, they served pretty much the same thing everyday but the choices and food quality were not bad at all. If you need a nice little hotel with a reasonable price and a great location, I recommend Ibis. p.s. - these areas need improvement though: 1. the bathroom was a bit tight and dated. 2. the elevators. During rush hours, the elevators didn't stop at your floor when they were full.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Son_UK22
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a harbour view room for 3 nights. Very convenienty reached by the airport bus A11 (North Point is the last stop, 20m from the hotel) in about 70min. The underground entrance (MTR-North Point) is 50m away, so very convenient. Previous reviewer reported about long waiting times for the lifts. I was expecting it, but plesantly surprised, so not a problem at all. The rooms are small (but hey- we are in Hong Kong), spotlessly clean, with kettle, free tea and coffee and the harbour view is spectacular! The reception staff is extremly polite and helpful (could store luggage and valuables till my evening departure there). Free WiFi (you need to ask every evening for the daily password at reception) is an additional bonus. There are small/ cheap restaurants and a bakery nerby. The area felt safe any time of the day/ night. So all in all highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, fantastic view.”
Reviews.Author: nola c
Reviews.Content: Stayed over xmas 6 nights. Fantastic location 1minute from MRT. The harbour view is spectacular and rooms clean, friendly staff. We spent about 2 hours awake in room and then sleep time, The rooms are small so if lots of luggage can be a problem. if you want clean, location Highly recomend. Some hotels we researched were up to $300 night and we pay $100. Yes room small but we are in it for so little time and when you come back from busy day bed clean, tidy and comfortable. shower hot, tea and coffe in draw as well as small fridge. 7eleven 50mt up road. tap water safe to drink. breakfast plenty, but basic. Bring ear plugs as walls thin and if you are easy disturbed may hear the neighbours. only 2 small lifts but eventually they arrive, Had a meal at resuturant and my oh my 10/10 delicious. soup. ckicken, custard pudding, xmas special, excellent one of the nicest meals both partner and myself had in HK Thankyou Ibis.

Reviews.Title: “Small room”
Reviews.Author: chopeta
Reviews.Content: Pros - definitely location is very convenient - smooth check in - friendly cleaning staff - bed is harder than usual but we managed - view is just ok, semi-blocked by the hotel building - room is clean, comes with slippers - some eating places outside are just ok Cons - too far from city & airport - very small room

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in a good location for the price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The ibis North Point was a relatively good hotel in a decent location. This hotel is not located in the center, but is only about a 10 minute subway ride to central Hong Kong. Because this hotel is not in the center, it is an excellent deal. The rooms in the hotel are quite small, but in order to get a large room in Hong Kong you will pay at least $50 more a night. The hotel is a great location if you want to experience real Hong Kong. Breakfast is a really good price and is both a western-style and asian buffet. Would recommend this hotel for people who want comfort on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service with Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff were polite and most helpful. The location is great because is just at the MTR exit. I suggest bottle water should be supplied at no cost because all other hotels supplied two bottles at no cost. Coffee and tea should also be supplied because this is the most basic a hotels should supply

Reviews.Title: “Small but new”
Reviews.Author: Baron45
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in near Christmas time and the more central hotels were charging more than I wanted. However, I was able to get the Ibis for HK$660 a night. Check-in was smooth, although there was a big Chinese tour group checking in simultaneously. As mentioned in other reviews, there are only 2 elevators and they are small and slow. MTR station is conveniently located 200 feet away. My room was small which was expected for HK, but I had a nice pano view of the harbor from the 22nd floor. Bathroom was really small and didn't come with any shampoo (but I brought my own just in case). This is a good place if you're on a budget and don't mind being further out from the "downtown" area. Not many tourists in the area which is nice. I used both the MTR and trams. There are also a couple of money changers on Kings Rd which were offering good rates compared to the ones near Times Square in Causeway Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view of HK at Night”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: ibis North Point is a very nice hotel. Location wise, it might be far off on the map but not really so considering the MTR station is less than a minute's walk away. You can walk further for 711 which is mighty convenient. The rooms are well kept and very clean. The bayview we were promised was just awesome. We were given a room on the 22nd floor which looked over the streets, the bay, yachts and sailboats, the ferries, the highways, and the buildings from across HK. They even took note that we were not locals, hence giving us an english paper to read in the morning, whereas our neighbor got one in chinese. There's a ferry cruise tour of harbour view just about 3minutes away from here though we didn't have time to take on that offer. The only 'problem,' if we can call it that with this hotel is its elevator. There are only two that service all the floors. Other than that would be the limited staff on the reception which can create some waiting time. Nevertheless, the staff can speak english quite clearly which was a plus. Not much of a big deal but those two are the only downsides I can honestly give :)

Reviews.Title: “Value depends on the price”
Reviews.Author: onelightyear
Reviews.Content: Not the first time staying with this hotel. The rooms are really really small even by Ibis' standard (my 6'1 partner can almost touch both side of the wall with stretching arms). But the service is good and efficient and the harbour view is superb! Quite convenient as well. The WIFI is a bit slow (maybe because it's free for both hotel & restaurant guest). It would have been a good value for money if they charge their usual price range of HK$500-HK$800 a night. But I am not sure about it when they charge us over HK$1000 a night because they are fully booked...

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dannyc1973
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at this Hotel because it was cheap. Its a nice tall hotel with many room overlooking the wonderful view of Victoria Harbour & its very close to the North Point MTR rail station & other good transport links to Central Hong Kong. The hotel was not bad for the price, but i thought the room was quite small for a double size with not much space in the wardrobe for clothes storage & also the restaurant had a limited buffet choice of food. Overall i'd say this is a good hotel for a short break or stopover but maybe not good if you're planning a long stay as i did.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel Room overlooked the harbour which i would recommend Out front door turn left and you are 30 seconds from North Point MTR entrance. only issue is two lifts serving 31 floors serving the reception area, Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Afforable harbor view”
Reviews.Author: travellevret
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was about the cheapest option for my dates with the exception of hostels. I had a harbor view, which was nice to have at this price point and could be a reason for selecting this hotel (note that it is not a good view of the most Central part of harbor, though. Overall, this hotel does a good job of providing key amenities without extras in order to keep the cost down. The neighborhood is less touristy than others where I have stayed. Not a lot to see around the hotel, but plenty of restaurants (not Western), 7-11, and coffee shops. Pros: -Very close to MTR stop (though transfers will be necessary to get to many destinations.) -Clean -Helpful desk staff -24 hour restaurant (though basic) -Views on harbor-side -En suite bathrooms with towels and shampoo (not a given at this price-point in HK!) -Free wifi (though you have to keep calling for a new passcode and need a different one for each computer) -Safe, hair-dryer in room -Travel services, China visa available (though not the best prices) Cons: -Small, colorless room -Long wait for elevators -Lobby and restaurant are small and spartan -Location not very central Bottom line--good value, but not for everyone. Check to make sure amenities that amenities you need or want are available.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Hotel in a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated just a stone throw away from North Point MTR station, thus allowing convenient traveling with the subway. The room is small but has basic toilet amenity and a safe, television with 20 channels and a refrigerator. It is good for budget traveler who just need a place to sleep and not suitable for those with big luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel in a Good Location but small room”
Reviews.Author: SQFlyer72
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ibis Hotel North Point for a night during my day trip in Hong Kong before flying off to Taipei the next day. The hotel is situated 50 metres away if you turned right upon getting out from the A1 exit of the North Point MTR station. This station is on the blue Hong Kong island line and is 3 stations away from Causeway Bay station and 6 stations away from the Central Station where one can connect with the Airport Express Hong Kong Station from/to the Hong Kong International Airport. I was allocated a twin room on the 30th floor (smoking floor but there was no cigarette smell in my room except the glass ashtray) and it was facing the harbour. The room was meant for two but it was rather small for two persons as there was not much space to walk about with the double bed taking up most of the space. I was staying alone and travelled with small weekend bag and so the size was adequate for me but there would not be sufficient space to open up big luggage, However, it was clean and basic, with safe, hair dryer and refrigerator in it. The shower was good and basic toilet amenities were provided. The bed was alright and there were about 20 TV channels on offer beside the paid movies channel. There were 2 elevators to serve the 31 floors and the wait could be long in peak hours since they were not very fast. The counter staff was courteous and was keen to inform me of their free wi-fi facilities but i did not use it since i did not carry my laptop for the trip. There was a restaurant in the hotel but i did not use it for meals or paid for breakfast service. Overall, the stay was a pleasant one based on the room rate that i paid and the hotel location. If you are on a tight budget (hotels in Hong Kong can be pricey during the busy periods) and do not mind small room, this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: MikeDav
Reviews.Content: We stayed because this place was fairly close to the City Garden where my wife and daughter were staying. What a contrast between the two hotels (although the price we paid was not that different). Our twin room at the Ibis was tiny, with two narrow beds that were smaller than normal singles, and little space between them. The condition of the bathroom left much to be desired and the quality of food at breakfast was depressing. Our previous Ibis stay at Gatwick Airport was much, much better. I hope that I never have the misfortune to have to stay at the Ibis North Point again..

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but terrible beds”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good and convenient location, but the beds are terribly hard and inconvenient. The staff are friendly, and the internet is free, which are two good things. The hotel also has a restaurant, but this has not been tested.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Ibis in North Point provides very good value for money. While it is not located right in the centre of Hong Kong, it is only a few doors down from an entrance to the North Point MTR station, so is actually quite convenient for those using public transport (which is excellent in Hong Kong, and very inexpensive and easy to use). There are many shops and restaurants in the area. The hotel has excellent wi-fi (free) and a safe in the room (also free). There are several TV channels in different languages and a small refrigerator. Service is excellent, as is typically the case in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of town, but still good location”
Reviews.Author: cindi83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in November, 2011. Just like everyone else has said, the rooms are small and you can hear noise from the hall. The elevators are slow and there are only 2. They have separate floors for smoking and nonsmoking, but we always ended up on an elevator with smokers, so we smelled it anyway. That is most of the bad. However, there was a lot of good stuff too. It was clean. Very nice people at the desk. A few steps from the entrace to the MTR (please note, the entrace is close, the actual train is a few block away. But, you are underground, so if it is raining or something, you are out of the elements). It is real close to a 7-11, which was great to grab some water and beer and snacks. Right next door to the 7-11 was a little restaurant that had great buns with hot dogs and other stuff in them. They were awesome for breakfast!! The ride into central or TST took about 20 minutes, but was really easy and not an issue at all for us. We would leave in the morning and didn't need to go back to the hotel during the day.

Reviews.Title: “good view & service & location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: it's pretty good!near train station and many delicious food near hotel ! The staff are very kind for anything. I booked the harbour view room type!it's really beautiful!! I'll choose Ibis next time if I visit HK!!! GOOD!I love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location,pleasant stay-recommended”
Reviews.Author: asterisk1964
Reviews.Content: This is budget hotel on great location in Hong Kong Island only 100m from the metro station We use this property on our visit to Hong Kong mostly because of the location average comfort and great price. Reception works perfect,rooms very very small and bed very tough. Breakfast nothing special and thats all. There is a excursion desk in the lobby and nice offers can be found there with reasonable rates. Anyway this hotel is to be recommended and we will use it again.

Reviews.Title: “To small, but clean”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeTraveller21
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a last resort to watch the Hong Kong 7’s last year and I suppose the only good thing is that it prompted us to book ahead this year! The best thing about the hotel is the location, which is very good. Just next to the MRT station so easy to get from the airport (make sure you take the train into the city- quickest and easiest way) and then its a 2 min walk from North Point. There is a great little cafe just outside the hotel and 1 day turn around laundry at a 10th of the price any hotel would do it for you! The hotel itself is cramped and small, even more so then I expected for an Ibis. There are 2 working lifts that are very small and slow to serve the 4+ floors that they serve. You will need to wait a while for one with space in the mornings. The room itself, although I can’t fault on cleanliness, was like a box. The beds were hard as rocks and the pillows were about 10cm deep. The double bed was 2 human width beds pushed together that separated in the nights and the sheets were so small that they didn’t remain tucked in either. The beds are also on wheels so slide around the floor every time you get in or out. There is not enough room to lie a suitcase by the bed, it has to go outside the bathroom door. But you get what you pay for. Dont eat the breakfast- you will feel cheated! Go to the cafe downstairs to take a 5 min walk to McDonalds! There was a nice view from the room to the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “good value for 8 nights in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: ilikeithere72
Reviews.Content: A friend and I recently stayed at this hotel for 8 nights late October early November 2011. The hotel was clean and the room (although small) was very comfortable for a single traveller. The lifts where very busy at peak times so would take considerable time – easily avoided by not leaving the hotel until after the rush hour. The view of the harbour is spectacular. The hotel is in a great location in Northpoint and only minutes from the metro station and a ferry pier out the front with a service to Kowloon. It is also very near the tram lines. The hotel staff where very friendly at check in and check out and where most helpful during our stay. The breakfast in the restaurant is great value and the meal we ate one night was good quality. I would recommend this hotel as the rates are very reasonable for Hong Kong (given we where there for 8 nights) and it was nice to stay away from Central and Kowloon for a change. The local area was very interesting with great restaurants, supermarkets and laundry places etc nearby. I would stay again for an extended period given the value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff couldn't do enough for you. Clean rooms and the view over the harbour was breathtaking. Food was also excellant. Would be hard to find anywhere near the price. Good central hotel near subway. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “submarines are bigger”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms are tiny, hard to walk around the bad, these are not rooms for 2 people Can not open window, feels like a submarine, no fresh air, No fridge, mini-bar WiFi signal is low, very low Doors are NOT sound proof, Elevators are painfully slow, can not transport requird number of people. Bay view is spectacular, Breakfasts are good, service is good

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at North Point which is away from the busy town area. We reached there mid nite and there was only one person at the front desk. We had 3kids and 3 big lugages and there was nobody to help us with the lugages. It was very dissappointing first thing when we reached the hotel. Most of the frontdesk guys are not friendly however there were a few friendly ones. We catch hold of them to get advice to how to travel around. The rooms and the bathrooms were small but it was clean. Nice bed, table to write, TV and coffee makers. The view from the hotel was cool. It was looking towards the Victoria Harbour. The jetty and bus station was so convenient that it was rite in front of the hotel. The MTR station was 1min walking distance and the tram station was 15mins walking distance. There were some restaurant near the hotel, as well as 7 eleven which was very convenient for us. But the food in the hotel restaurant was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Stay !”
Reviews.Author: Yao2011
Reviews.Content: My room faced the habour, very good view. Too bad it's was not a non-smoking room. I requested to change another room but full occupied. However, good view of the habour did compensate and we finally were ok with the smell. The location as asy to find food shops. It is very convenient to access all areas ; close to metro North Pont station.

Reviews.Title: “2 day stay at the Ibis Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Bolton64
Reviews.Content: My overall thoughts are that this is like all the other Ibis hotels I have ever stayed in. Functional but lacks that extra bit of quality to make it great. The check in was very good. I was much earlier than the stated 2pm check in but that was not a problem at all. The room was ok, clean enough and being on the 18th floor the sleep quality was very good. The view across the bay towards Kowloon was probably one of the best I have ever had. My main gripe was the awful lift system. 31 floors serviced by 2 lifts just is not good enough. Many times I had to wait 10 minutes before one arrived. Being on the 18th floor did mean I had little choice but use them. The worst lift system I have ever used. The hotel is slightly out of the main area but the underground is just next door so it is not a major problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ibis North Point Hotel and was very impressed about it's location and view. For this room rate we have expected a small room but it's still a little smaller than our expectation, however, the view is nice and you can find everything you need from a hotel, cleanliness/service is pretty good, receptionist is helpful but quite cool (don't feel a warm welcome). Our only complaint is the size of room and the elevators, it's very tiny, hardly can fit in 4 people with 2 baggage. Internet is free but need to call every night to get password (that's annoying). Great location, service is so-so (acceptable), we are satisfied overall and will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient Location & value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very close to the North Point rly station just a minute walk. The room is very small when compared to other hotels but if your purpose of stay is to see the places this is immaterial. The break fast is good and value for money other than the the restaurant could not offer much for lunch / dinner. The not so good factor about the hotel is you have to wait a lot for the Lifts to come & we were offered a room on the 31st floor and it takes a hell lot of time to reach the top. The room service & in house dining will close by 10 pm hence if you are late pl ensure to have / get your food from outside. There are few food joints very close to this place

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: 287Brook6
Reviews.Content: I am a member of the Accor Advantage Plus Club and used their hotels many times. I have also been to Hong Kong on many occasions. I am not one usually to criticise but for the money this has been my worst experience to date. The rooms were small, there were no real facilities and North Point is not really near to anything in Hong Kong. There is no concierge service and the counter staff were less than helpful.

Reviews.Title: “small room, breakfast disgusting. staff very kind and helpfull.”
Reviews.Author: mariodambrosio
Reviews.Content: perfect location for hong kong. you can walk everywhere. bus stop to the airport just in front the hotel (40$ one way) very cheap and internet on the bus for free (amazing idea). rooms are asian style (like a small box). elevator too slowly for 30 floors hotel. recomended only if you are in low budget.

Reviews.Title: “good basic hotel ,right beside mrt station”
Reviews.Author: frank b
Reviews.Content: Stay here for a few days last week and found it to be a good hotel only 20 meters from the mrt station . Fantastic views at night from your harbour view room over the harbour and kowloon . Room is a little small but adequete and clean . Enjpyed my stay here

Reviews.Title: “Stay for its startegic location!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is very good as it is walking distance (approx 100m)to subway and main bus terminal (you only pay HK40/person) to Int Airport otherwise will cause you HK 350- HK400/trip to Airport. Walking distance to morning wet market and flee market. Bed size ,esp width was small for bigger size guest might have problem to adjust to the small bed, other than that , everything is good

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fabulous view from the room, which was small but perfectly adequate. Staff very helpful, area very easy to get to with lots of shops and services nearby. The bed was comfortable, and the room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Hongkong hotels too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was expecting more confortable hotel. But it was not realised. The room was narroew and bed was small. Stuff was not friendly. But there was Hongkong. It is helpless. The subway station was very near. Local restaurants were there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really good though the room is small. We got 2 rooms and the price is reasonable. They will clean your room everyday. Haven't tried their breakfast. Location is very good as it is near MTR. Just a 30 seconds walk and you are there. There are restaurants everywhere so need not worry about your meals and it's really yummy. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled my reservation”
Reviews.Author: CXM
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation at this hotel for the 21 - 22 of November. I was confirmed a bay view room, however after reading several postings I contacted the hotel wondering if even with a confirmed bay view room I ran the possibility of not getting a bay view. They responded quickly that room views were not guaranteed. So I did change my reservation to another hotel which guarantees room types and views. For bait and switch I give this hotel a poor rating in customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but breakfast need to be improved”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family. The hotel is just in front of North Point Bus Terminal, so we can alight easily from the Airport by A11 bus. The MTR (exit A1) is only 50 meters from hotel. So this hotel is strongly recommended for easy access. The room is typically Hong Kong hotel, small but clean and efficient. The problem is in the breakfast. I am a moslem, and cannot eat pork. They mix the pork and chicken sausage in one plate. They are supposed to separate it. So, we had a breakfast without having any meat on it. Prefer to have a breakfast outside for Moslem..

Reviews.Title: “Not So bad”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service was ok, location is great , price was ok a bit steep for the room type but its the cheapest i think you will find in Hongkong. The only downer is the room is tiny- 11 square metres is small. The harbour view is great but when i saw the size of the room i did think of going somewhere else, but I figured i just need a place to sleep and so this was more than adequate.All in all its a 2.5- 3 out of 5 in my opinion. Id only recommend it if you just need a place to sleep and will be touring most of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room at the right Place and Time”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As usual, this Ibis room is very small, clean, and convieniently located. It has a great view of the Harbor - right where the Harbor Light Show happens. It had a Teapot and cups - but hidden so well that we almost didn't find them. Lots of TV Channels in several languages. The neighborhood has great places to eat and shop, and good access to Buses and the Subway. As usual, the Ibis is a good travel Value

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean but the bed too small”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Impeccably clean and tidy, and efficient service. Great location, next to North Point MRT Exit 1A. A few minuses: 1. City view Double Room are not double room... the size of the bed is a super single rather than queen, will be a squezze. The tiniest bed on an Ibis hotel that i'e ever stayed at 2. The lift is too small, so at the morning peak hours you'll be bypassed many times if you stay on the mid levels. My longest wait was like 15 mins!

Reviews.Title: “Just fine. Clean and no surprises. It is what it is.”
Reviews.Author: melonfawn
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at Ibis in October 2011 and was content with my stay. You're not getting extraordinary value nor is it overpriced. The breakfast is OK, nothing special. The staff are friendly although were slightly inept at retrieving our luggage even though they were aware we were in an extreme hurry. The cleaning lady who did my room (2610) was lovely, very friendly. I'd stay here again if I could find a deal on the place as it was clean and in a good location. The rooms are small but this is Hong Kong on a budget, what did you expect? A note about the mattresses: request a mattress pad if you're used to anything other than sleeping on a board - the beds REALLY are as hard and uncomfortable as the reviews make out, although once you have a mattress pad they are totally fine. Also, they have a good promise - your problem resolved within 15 mins - and I found this was true every time I needed anything.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty bathroom - noisy rooms- good location”
Reviews.Author: Sarita00
Reviews.Content: I really like ibis hotels as they are usually good value for money, but this was the worst ibis I've stayed at. As soon as I got in the bathroom I had to clean toilet seat to be able to use it, there was dust on top of the water tank , that you could see had been there for ages , behind the bathroom door on the floor , there was hair and fluff. Next morning I explained this to the person behind the desk as we were going out on a tour to china , I asked for the bathroom to be well cleaned and mentioned the dirty spots , but when we returned late at night, was exactly the same . Room doors and walls did not block any sound, so if your neighbour used bathroom you could here it, as well as any small noise in the corridor, actually sounded as if people are inside your bedroom !! Good location and great view if you are staying on floors above 15th.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sinny7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for total of 6 nights. The room and bathroom is very small, so I would not recommend it for bigger people. However, the location is excellent for all forms of transport - MTR, bus including the Airport Express, tram or ferry are within minutes away. The breakfast was basic but sufficient; they provide the same thing every morning. There are 2 lifts for guests which is very slow. There is another lift around the corner for staff/service it is much quicker - we often use this one instead. Overall we were happy, in comparision with other hotels, the Ibis North Point seems to be of good value. Especially if you intend to go out most of the day and only wants to stay in the hotel for a good rest after a busy day of shopping or sightseeing. Accommodation is expensive in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Average in every possible way”
Reviews.Author: strainu
Reviews.Content: Ibis North Point is average from just about every point of view, the good parts being compensated by some bad marks. The price is fair for the prices of Hotels in Hong Kong. The rooms are clean, but extremely small and with absolutely no noise insulation. The view is superb, but in our case we only had half of it, as there was a wall just besides the window. The service was good overall but the English skills of some employees would need improvement. Also, in one of the days we forgot to put the "don't change the sheets" note on the bed. As the sheets were changed the day before, the janitor considered appropriate to place the note himself. Also, you have to ask the staff for some basic services, like an universal power adapter or WiFi access (which is free, despite what you will read on the Accor site). Also, each WiFi code is valid only 24h, so you have to go back to the reception every day.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: FernandaMaria
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty standard Ibis Hotel: as usual, prices are very competitive (specially in the absurdly overpriced Hong Kong market), rooms are simple but comfortable, and service is efficient (although the reception got crowded sometimes). Some surprises about this one: 1- the room is really tiny, even for an Ibis; 2- breakfast is average, but the set menu for lunch is tasty and amazing value (it is a very popular spot for locals too, it seems); 3- there is an affordable but somehow weird massage parlor (the foot massage after a long day was a relief); 4- the lifts are insufficient during the morning (ask for a low floor!); and 5- although the hotel is in a rather so-so part of Hong Kong island, it is a few steps away from the MTR, which makes it very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain if all you need is a room, but service needs improvement.”
Reviews.Author: deorr
Reviews.Content: The room was fine, a little out of the way, but close to the metro. Service was unreliable, and the food at the restaurant was very good but gave me reason to question the hotel's sanitation. Rooms were clean with minimal furniture, a small refrigerator and coffee service. Mattress was hard. Free WiFi was a fairly consistent 265kbps. The walls were thin and it's bad luck if you have someone loud next door, though. North Point Metro is two doors from the hotel and most places on Hong Kong Island were less than 45 minutes travel time away. L'Accor (Ibis's French parent company) prides itself on catering and the food in the restaurant was surprisingly good. While breakfast was only average, the sliced duck and green curry off the dinner menu were delicious. However, three fruit flies drowned themselves in my wine glass when I looked away for only a moment. A fourth, no doubt despondent at the death of its friends, circled the glass ominously. After that, I lost confidence in the cleanliness of the kitchen. Service was not very good. The concierge desk gave me inaccurate information regarding air travel requirements to Vietnam and quoted a price that was 20% above the airline's listed ticket price. In addition, you have to get a new WiFi key each day (annoying), and most of the four days I was there the front desk did not pick up until the second or third time that I called. On one occasion when they didn't answer the phone, I went down to the desk and found three hotel employees talking and taking a break while the fourth was swamped trying to help four guests. No wonder. All in all, Ibis's sub $700 HKD a night prices are a bargain in Hong Kong, but you'll get what you paid for, no more.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Clean”
Reviews.Author: Jason C
Reviews.Content: I had one night in transit in Hong Kong, instead of spending the night in the airport, I chose to spend it in the city. The Ibis Century Hong Kong worked out great for me. I took the bus A11 from the airport transit terminal and it brought me to the North Point Terminal. The hotel is just across the street from the terminal. The rate is affordable, the room is clean, the mattress is firm, and that was all I were asking for transiting one night in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “DAVES HONG KONG TRIP”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the mtr access right at the hotel made getting around the city very convient and inexpensive in one of the most expensive cities in the world.the room was small but functional.the tv worked fine but espn should be in english and cnn should be available as they broadcast from hong kong most weekdays.the staff was helpfull and well trained . as a resident of pattaya thailand i will recommend the hotel to my friends and look foward to staying again thanks dave

Reviews.Title: “PERSONAL”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked on line for the room I stayed with the words "street view", yet from the room window i saw nothing---streets view, as said, All i can see was rear windows of the buildings acrossed the other side, 20 to 30 meteres away. Very disappoint. I strongly suggest you alter the words--street view, to ''no view''.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay - simple and clean”
Reviews.Author: kim_night
Reviews.Content: Not sure if this was a 2 star or 3 star (as it says different things in different areas) but for either it was a good stay. The staff were friendly and helpful. The internet was free and fast (we also got some free printing of travel documents). The breakfast was ok and it was only a short walk to the MTR. Although the room was quite small - understandable in Hong Kong - the view over the harbour was amazing and it was always clean and neat. The beds were comfortable and suited us just fine because we were not spending much time there (out seeing the sights). Would recommend if you are there for a short stay and want somewhere that is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Top value and ok location”
Reviews.Author: Foolfin
Reviews.Content: The Ibis offers a basic but fairly nice option while staying in Hong Kong. The rooms facing the harbour have a great view of the harbour for half the price of equivalent hotels at the time of the stay. The room was tiny but, more important, in good shape and clean. There was an issue with the TV though which remained stuck to FOX News, lucky me... They finally fixed it as I left the room. The MTR station was 2 mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Strategic Location but Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: One of the Attending Receptionists was less than helpful and not so friendly. I was an Accor Platinum Card Holder but with this hotel, it really didn't make any difference. And to think I was getting 3 rooms. There weren't even complimentary bottled water in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean room at a very convenient location. However, the bed is just big enough for 2 slim people. Just across the road is the Java Road food centre where one can find good food at good prices. Hotel is just a stone's throw from the North Point MTR station. Very convenient. Several eateries nearby for a quick suppper.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view, great locations. Good price.”
Reviews.Author: CMarkUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a last minute booking and the price for that was excellent compared to other hotels. Staff were very helpful and friendly. The view from the room was stunning. I just sat in my room and looked out over the hrabour for hours. Location is great, a few steps from the North Point MTR Station. Rooms are small, but this is expected in HK. Free WiFi was appreciated. Bad points? The rooms are pretty run down. Or at least mine was. Peeling wallpaper and a mouldy/musty smell. My fridge didn't work despite having power. This is also a huge hotel tower with many many guests and two ridiculously slow lifts. This may sount trivial but was irritating after a time. This aside, I would go back for the price, location, free WiFi and oh the view. But you can find better hotels for the same price or less on a search engine if you can book in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - suggestions for greater service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with great staff. It is very well located in Wanchai - which is centrally located to all of Hong Kong. My wife and I had a wonderful stay over three days. We would only suggest that the hotel provides their guests better information on the facilities that are provided with each package. We upgraded to a Premium Room after one night. This had complimentary facilities -breakfast, tea etc. At check-in it would have been good if the Reception had advised us of these facilities and where they were available - instead of our having to learn of these from other guests or by asking! We would have also appreciated being told that we had the option of having breakfast at the Cafe - instead of being confined to the Lounge!! We would have enjoyed the ambience better. An excellent stay in HK nevertheless.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view!”
Reviews.Author: michelw88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights. We had opted for a 'superior room' with a harbour view, and that was a great decision: the view was lovely! We could see over the water all the way from former Kai Tak Airport to Tsim Sha Tsui. Both during the day and at night it gave spectacular views. Breakfast at the hotel is overpriced, it is a better choice to go to one of the restaurants surrounding it. We really liked that there were two computers at the reception with free internet. The location is a bit further out from the main tourist areas, but the subway is less than a block away. Also I did like North Point for its restaurants: more authentic Asian food than in the Central area, and very cheap. So it was nice to come back to North Point at night and enjoy a nice dinner before going back to the hotel room. The only thing we didn't like about it, was the check-in: we were told the room would be ready in 30 minutes when we arrived, in the end it took almost 1.5 hours to check-in. If we had known that before, we would have dropped off our luggage and done some sightseeing first.

Reviews.Title: “Don't take your cat! You will not be able to swing it!”
Reviews.Author: yted
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small (11 Squares) so there's not much room after you have decided where the suitcases go. Hotel does not have a bar, or lounge, although alcohol is available from the restaurant, open from 4am to god knows when.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dbrown007
Reviews.Content: Had a great few nights here. Location is a little bit out of the central areas but it's only about 15 minutes on the subway. As mentioned in other reviews, the beds are rock hard but if you ask for a mattress protector it makes it much more comfortable. Only 2 lifts for a rather large hotel, so you can end up waiting for ages. Make sure you book one of the larger rooms - even these are pretty small so I hate to think what the regular rooms are like. We paid for breakfast as well - the selection was great. The room rate was also fantastic, especially when other hotels in Hong Kong can be insanely expensive. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice location. good quality service and staff.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good price. fair room. clean and accessible location. near subway 30 second walk right to Ibis. 30 second left walk to 7eleven. Can take Bus 11A to airport right away. the room is fairly small but can't complain in HK. all rooms are quite small. don't buy internet package at hotel. buy a 3G internet sim card at 7eleven cost 98 HKD. internet cost 28 HKD/day.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable room in expensive HK”
Reviews.Author: Emeraldcity50
Reviews.Content: Yes rooms are SMALL at this hotel, especially for those of us visiting from the USA. But the location is great if you like to explore HK on your own. From the airport, take bus A11, $40 HKD pp one way will arrive in less than 40 min, get off at the bus terminal, last stop and walk across the street. The harborview rooms have a fantastic view of Victoria harbor, capturing both sides of Kowloon and hong kong. Make sure you request for non-smoking room, if you are a non-smoker, as we noticed there were many hotel guests from china, and many of them are chain smokers. The hotel is next to the MTR, subway station- North Point. Take the MTR to anywhere you need to go, it is cheap, and efficient, as traffic during peak hours are very slow moving. Also the Northpoint Ferry is right across from the hotel, ride it to cross the harbor to Kowloon east. As other reviewer point out, don't stay here if you bring lots of luggage, there is no room to store them in the small room. The room has coffee/tea service, also a room safe. There are many neighborhood eateries to choose within walking distance. A wet market is two blocks away with lots of vendors selling inexpensive clothing, bags, household stuff that are in addition to produce and meat. Shopping at these markets will be easier if speaking Chinese, but the vendors will try hard to make the sale using the international language of $.

Reviews.Title: “IBIS North Point”
Reviews.Author: stretch7250_1
Reviews.Content: Very good location, close to MTR, Airport bus and other bus routes. Rooms are VERY small although they are updating the rooms. En-suite works well, and staff are very helpful. Breakfast is not included in standard accommodation, but buffet breakfast is available for a small extra fee, and there are many restaurants, cafes etc nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Just a place to stay overnight.”
Reviews.Author: RhondaMi
Reviews.Content: Small. I know hotel rooms in Hong Kong are small, but hey, ibis is a brand name (under the Accor Group) and I expected a bit more space. I have only 1 mid-size suitcase and it's already hard to move around. Don't stay here if you have 2 suitcases. Toilet doesn't flush. Bonus: free wifi!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good price !”
Reviews.Author: FL360
Reviews.Content: In western standards the room in this hotel is small, however its location is excellent. MTR exit right next to the hotel, airport bus A11 right next to the door. They are progressively updating the rooms from the old ones to the new international IBIS standard. If you want to try the tram HKD 2 will take you from one side to the other side of HK island. Will stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Northpoint”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location (Near the MRT) and with lots of food in the surrounding. Also comes with top notch service from the staff. Unfortunately the rooms are very small and the beds are not that comfortable for a good night sleep. All in all its value for money if you are looking for a place to spend the night before going out the whole day on the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: mideastexplorer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ibis with my girlfriend in February. Our room was very small, although I'm led to believe this is normal by Hong Kong standards. This was more than made up for by the view though. We upgraded to a harbour-view room and it was definitely worth the price. The tv was small and many of the channels didn't work, but there's plenty of better things to do in Hong Kong than watch tv anyway. The location was excellent. It's slightly away from the heart of the city but there's a subway station right next door to the hotel so you can be in the centre of things within minutes. The hotel was very clean and the bed was relatively comfy. The staff were friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis stay abandoned after one day”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have travelled extensively and stay in hotels weekly, i have stayed in some very good motels and some very poor ones and as a result i have a good feel for quality and value for money. Ibis north point was the worst Ibis i have stayed in. I booked three nights in the Ibis north point using my complementary night to pay for a 3rd. my wife and i only stayed one night, paid for the other 2 and left for Macau where the standard of motel for the same price was much higher. The bed was very hard, the elevators slow, the service at reception slow and the location was not very good for what we wanted. close to shops, the ferry and the train but a long way from the central city and the markets.

Reviews.Title: “The floor may have been softer”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are small but I expected that, it was a bit far from the airport for a short stay but my main beef with this hotel is that the beds were rock hard and by that I don't just mean firm. Even after a long flight and late check in I still found it near impossible to get to sleep. The second night they offered to put a foam topper on the bed but still I was tempted to try the foam topper on the floor to see if it was softer. I have never, repeat never slept on a bed so solid and brick like! I was tempted to ask for another room until I found out my friends beds were exactly the same. Could not recommend this hotel to anyone - unless that is you enjoy sleeping on bricks. Have used other Accor properties and never come up against this arrangement before.

Reviews.Title: “Bed hard as a rock... but the view alone was worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) The North Point MRT station is just 2-3 doors away (buy an Octopus card or even better a Tourist's One Day Travel Card) 2) The North Point Harbour is right infront of the hotel (can take a trip via the ferry to Kowloon) 3) The North Point Bus Station is right infront of the hotel (super cheap HKD40 per trip via Bus A11 from the airport and it stops directly at the bus station) 4) Magnificent view of Kowloon if you are taking the harbour view rooms 5) Clean rooms 6) Excellent staff service esp the girls at the front desk (Alsa and gang) Cons: 1) Can be a bit noisy due to the ongoing renovations on the higher floors 2) Only 2 tiny lifts servicing the entire hotel - the wait for the lifts during peak periods can be a killer 3) No movie channel (its pay to view for movies) but there are adequate news / Nat Geo / normal non movies channels 4) No free WiFi 5) The mattress is hard as a rock, I didn't sleep well for a few nights and only got smarter to request for a mattress top on the last day (after reading some reviews here). Make sure you ask for a mattress top and that would be a life saver!

Reviews.Title: “Small room as expected - city view not really accurate”
Reviews.Author: Norman186361
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife AND an 18 month old toddler in one of these small rooms for TWO weeks! We knew that the rooms were small and we knew that we would have even less space than others as we needed a cot in the room too. They knew this and were quick to bring the cot to our room when we arrived. We actually turned our bed around so that the cot could fit in the room more comfortbly. The cot must have been from the 1980's , it was on wheels and it could not be lowered therefore we had to keep an eye on our toddler everytime he was awake in it as he could easily climb out. The room was modern and refurbished as described but the real disappontment was the view from our window. As it was described as a city view we expected to be able to see the roads down below, instead our view was of a block of flats, which felt like they were just 5 metres across from our window. We could see into these peoples appartents, infact we could see so clearly what was in their rooms. This meant that we had to keep our curtains closed most of the time as they could obviously see straaight into our rooms too. We saw the amazing habour view and if there was one piece of advice it is to book a habour view room, this would certainly help compensate for the room size. We asked if there were any habour view rooms availble but there were not which was a shame. The lifts are increadibly slow. There are only two and once they both passed me on the way up AND on the way down I got so fed up I walked down the steps from the 22nd floor! The cost of the room is good value for HK and such a good location for us. We never tried the breakfast, alway went down to buy breakfast from the many local bakeries nearby and the supermarket down the road.

Reviews.Title: “RE: Conversation inside room can be eavesdropped because door is not sound proof”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When waiting for the lift in the corridor, I can easily hear people talking inside the room even with the door closed. This means people can eavesdrop on private or business conversations outside the room. Door is not sound proof. Hope this defect can be corrected before my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “We like this hotel very much”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_CanadaAnita
Reviews.Content: To my first feeling, Ibis is a very small hotel without any attraction. However, when I stay there for the first day, I feel its location is very convenience. Easy for me to go shopping, having food and visiting my friends and family. My boy friend and I like it very much. It is not a high class hotel, however, its room is clean and tiny. The staff is friendly and the price is reasonable. I highly recommend to somebody who want to stay in HK with a lower budget.

Reviews.Title: “Average...Small Rooms..Good location”
Reviews.Author: premjit_pc
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the late review since this dates back to Jan and things might have changed since then. Us (wife and me) stayed in a harbor facing room, which seemed new with furnishings and smelt fresh. The view was gorgeous with a wide expanse of the harbour visible from the room. After this though, things went downhill as far as the hotel is concerned. - Rooms were very very small, even for IBIS standards. Both of us travel very light and only carried two small cases. Just try opening one case and you'll find there is no space to stand at the foot of the bed, which is terrible. - The area around the bed will even make an infant claustrophibic since there is no room at all and the same can be said for the toilets. - The check in and check out was lengthy since there were just two folks handling travelers checking into a 34 story hotel. There were queues snaking all over the small lobby. - The service wasnt great and most of the staff seemed to be in some kind of pain. No smiles, no goodmornings at all. - While the location is next to an MTR, it isnt so great if you want to shop etc. If so, better to stay in places near Tsim Tsa Shui - TV sucks. No great channels at all. Well there are a few pluses as well: - The location is perfect, just next to the North Point MTR station. Just buy yourself an Octopus card and you can reach any point in HK. - Gorgeous View...needs to be so, since every moment you spend in the room is spend sitting on the bed. - Room rates are among the best in HK. Nothing comes cheaper. - Good area all around with lots of stores and eating outlets. Veggie Indians might have a problem since there arent any pure veg outlets nearby. We're non veg so its cool. All in all, if you're looking for a cheap place to satay in HK, want the MTR nearby but willing to compromise on space (i dare not use the word luxury), this is IT...!!!

Reviews.Title: “small and expensive room”
Reviews.Author: Rutrancano
Reviews.Content: The room is very small for the price 660 HK$. I reserved port view and got terrible inner yard. The guy in the reception told me that the hotel was full and for the money I paid...The elevator is very slow, sometimes you feel claustrophobic. You have to pay for everything. The breakfast cost 55HK$ and the orange juice is not natural.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but small everything”
Reviews.Author: santyIndia
Reviews.Content: pro - next to northpoint mtr, very convenient travel to city. daily housekeeping service. this is a great place for someone looking for affordable place in hong kong. The location is probably one of the most convenient, but rooms were small, bed and shower were smaller than expected

Reviews.Title: “Small but convenience location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Almost good but except the first night that we been put to a corner room with air circulation not flow and could not see wide harbor screen. We asked to change the room and got it in the second night. There will be a very bad trip if we could not get the new room for the whole 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “decor and smell overhaul needed”
Reviews.Author: WayfaringTraveller
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its location, due to needing to be near the North Point area in first few days of my stay in Hong Kong. If you get a harbour-facing room the views are spectacular. In fact, that view was probably the most spectacular I've ever had in a hotel room. The problem with the hotel is inside the rooms and corridors. The room decor was very dated - not just style-wise, but in terms of cleanliness. They had soiled carpets, walls needing repainting, and a pervasive sewagey smell in the rooms and corridors.
