I asked to change rooms because on my first night the bed had hairs in the sheets, a tiny blood spot, and one insect crawled towards me. Okay, I don't know what that insect was. The reception staff and housekeeping staff were nice and enabled my room change within minutes. The next room felt cleaner but the sewagey smell remained. As well as that, there was a very odd repetitive sound through the air vents at night - sounded like a machine or something. I had to wear ear plugs to sleep. The bathroom was icky, a urine smell which I know is probably ammonia cleaning fluid, but they shouldn't use it. The rooms are really small, with decor and bedding reminiscent of a boarding school circa 1987. There is no wardrobe or adequate storage space. The TV was really tiny, tinier than the average notebook computer. They charge extra for breakfast, and it is really, really not worth the 55HKD. One staff member at breakfast was quite brusque. The food tasted very odd: the bacon, ham, croissants, tasted metallic, the coffee was badly brewed and weak. The yorghut was watery. One morning there was virtually nothing in the trays, until I asked them to refill it - I reckon if you pay for a buffet there should be actual food in the buffet trays. One plus is that the hotel does not take a deposit from you, if you've prepaid your stay there. There was free internet access at the reception lobby computers (if not using them for long). Another plus is that right opposite the hotel is the North Point bus terminus and ferry terminal - from there you can get buses to so many parts of Hong Kong and ferries to Kowloon and another location. All in all, I regretted opting for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Got a very good deal. Room facing the harbor. Room a little bit small but comfortable. Location is excellent, MTR North Point station just nearby. 7 Eleven also nearby if you fancy some snack in the middle of the night. Sometimes, you can get better rate directly on their own website rather than third party booking engine.

Reviews.Title: “New Renovation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room is much more comfortable and brighter after renovation,however the TV was installed too high from eye level,easily get tired & pain to eyes or neck! If the plastic chair can be changed to a cushion chair, then it's more than perfect at it's price!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient to MTR, Hard Beds”
Reviews.Author: monkeysort
Reviews.Content: First, the good: it's very close to the North Point MTR station and across the street -- literally -- from the North Point ferry pier (also where many buses have stops, including the A11 to/from the airport). It's also very close to the Java Road Cooked Food Centre, which is great for local eats. The hotel is clean and rooms were well maintained. However, the walls are relatively thin and you can very easily hear doors from nearby rooms slam shut. Bathrooms are a bit tiny, but clean and functional. No toiletries except hand soap and shower gel (via in-shower dispenser) are provided. The harbour view rooms are nice, but you're so far East on the island that you cannot really see much of the Kowloon/TST skyline. Now to the bad: the bed. It's hard as a rock. I really haven't had a more uncomfortable night of sleep in a hotel. It's as if the mattress were replaced by a box spring. Now, I have traveled the world and stayed in many hotels, inns, and hostels around Asia, and I know that in general beds in Asia are much firmer than in the U.S. But this was beyond firm -- it was hard and uncomfortable. I was actually sore after my night's attempt at rest, and one point in the middle of the night I considered sleeping on the (hardwood) floor instead. If Ibis could upgrade the mattresses, or provide even a pillow top (heck, even make it optional!) to improve the very hard beds, this would shoot to near the top of my list for inexpensive, transit-friendly accommodations in HK. As it stands now, I simply cannot recommend the hotel to friends, family, or colleagues. The point of a hotel, after all, is a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Piaaaa
Reviews.Content: I came to Ibis Northpoint bringing all with me the trip reviews by the previous travellers and it was good that there were no high expectations on my end. The room wasn't entirely small for an Asian person that I am. We were two in a group and I found the space more or less ideal. Since I was aware there aren't too much comfort to offer (toiletries, slippers etc.), I took note the things I needed to buy and provide for the trip. The lift was alright. Though one would wait for a while to bring you to your room floor. The positive side is that the hotel is very much close to the MTR Northpoint Station exit A for Java Road. If one prefers to take a ferry there's Northpoint Ferry Station across the hotel going to Kowloon. And Java Road Market is very near as well. The Front Desk was helpful and tried their best to give assistance. Ibis Northpoint should take note of the guests' requests. I specifically called for an extra towel and advised Housekeeping for one. They forgot my request. I waited for it but I had to forego. Because of this, the next time I advised the Front desk, i made sure to remind them again of my other room service needs. You have to be persistent in telling them what you want. Bed was yes hard but I expected it. I found that there's another pillow placed at the very top of the cabinet which is difficult to reach and get for a small person. The city view of the hotel was interesting. Since I got an email, they said my room is only good for city view and when i looked at the window its the side bldg. of the hotel and thats for them the city view. Misleading. Overall it was an experience and if given a chance, i can still recommend this to other of my friends who are looking for alternatives and prefer to stay far from the city. The district is abit laidback and I think its a good place for those who need some quiet time for themselves. Just clear yourselves from high expectations so you wouldn't feel disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - average”
Reviews.Author: molmax
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and it was average at best. As I was on my own I wasn't too fussed about where I stayed and therefore I probably got what I paid for which was basic facilities as I wanted to spend my money shopping. The room was so small that I couldn't walk around the bed when my suitcase was on the stand. So glad that my husband wasn't with me as it would have been a disaster. Hotel was close to a train station but have to lug bags up to the street. Area next the hotel was okay, a little dirty but safe to walk around at night. Bed in the hotel was as hard as a rock and I didn't sleep much. Shopping in Hong Kong was better than my visit a couple of years earlier - the Outlet Mall on Lantau was awesome and some shops will process credit card payments in the currency of your choice so no additional bank fees.

Reviews.Title: “I always stay here when I am in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I always stay here when I am in Hong Kong! The location is perfect for public transporation and the price provides great value. The rooms are small but adequate, and recent renovations make them even better! The only drawback is the wireless Internet service in the rooms are a bit slow, so it's good for email and Facebook but not for streaming video. However, with so much to do in Hong Kong I did not have much time to stream a lot of video while staying anyway. Absolutely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located with good value for money. Room is big enough to sleep alone. Quite when housekeeping staff not cleaning up room nearby. Staff are frienly. Room is clean enough. Mattress is on the firm side. I enjoy the clean sheet and good quality comforter. More tv channels to choose from would be a bonus. The size of the tv fits the room. The earliest check in is 12 noon, I would appreciate if it can be sooner for early arriver after a long flight from North America to HongKong. I did not try the only restaurant and room service therefore no comments there. The complimentary newspaper every morning is a nice touch. Wireless internet comes with a price and it would be thumps up if it were complimentary. Cell phone reception may be an issue if you stay at lower level facing the city/other buildings. No problem if you stay at harbour view room but room rate with a premium.

Reviews.Title: “Very average rooms, uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very standard of all Ibises so even though the rooms are small it's to be expected. The bed was rock hard. It was like sleeping only on the base of the bed without a mattress! So unfortunately as I am used to a softer bed, I found it extremely uncomfortable. (It would be perfect for those who like to sleep on hard beds) I didn't like the service at all. It might be in the culture, but while waiting to check in, I followed the ropes and queued up. There were 5 staff at the counter but only one customer was being served at a time (why?) everyone else just didn't seem to know what to do with themselves. I thought I would be polite until I was called to go to the counter, but all these other local tourists just go right up to the counter and cut in. The staff didn't seem to object and left me there waiting as they served those who had cut in! They were all very polite, but extremely inefficient. What would have take other Ibises in Australia 10 mins to check in, took me half an hour. Location is right by North Point station, which is great for public transport, but there isn't much around North Point (for tourists) so in that sense you are always needing to get the MRT to be able to go anywhere. However the view from a harbour view room was fantastic at night. But I still paid AU$100 something for the night which really wasn't worth the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value budget hotel - Excellent for few days stopover.”
Reviews.Author: Friendly_Gardener
Reviews.Content: Good value budget hotel. The room was a little on the small side but had an excellent harbour view from the huge window (worth paying a little extra for room with a view). Room cleaned everyday. Hotel is not central but easy to get to as only a 12 min tube journey fron centre. Tube station only 1 min walk away from hotel. Plenty of shops / places to eat nearby. Dont fly all the way to Hong Kong to eat and drink in Starbucks & KFC!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellently located on North Point MTR, near King's Road transport and at the Hong Kong terminus of the A11 Airport bus service. The rooms are typically small which is a feature of Hong Kong and are functional and comfortable. The staff are knowledgable and friendly. Rooms are fitted with internet access which unfortunately is NOT included in the room rate and is expensive. The area around the hotel is a local shopping area and gives much better value than areas such as Causeway Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and clean, but it had the hardest bed I've ever slept on”
Reviews.Author: Copyedster
Reviews.Content: We didn't pay much for the hotel at all, so it's hard to be too picky. We were on the 18th floor, with a harbour view. The room was the second smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in, and a I take several trips per year. The elevators were ungodly slow, but there's a third freight elevator through the door to the stair well, so you might have better luck with that one. It must be said: The bed was absolutely rock hard. We forgot to pull the sheets off to have a look at it, but it felt we were lying on a wooden table. Again, the price was right for us -- we always like to go on a budget, but you should know what you're going to get.

Reviews.Title: “Small but OK”
Reviews.Author: petrjarv
Reviews.Content: We had double room which was very small even on Ibis standards. I think that the room and bed are too small for two persons. Room was recently renovated and clean. Location is very near to North Point subway station and ferry pier. There are many restaurants and shops on the streets. I don't recommend the breakfast it would probably be better to eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Some Pluses and some minuses”
Reviews.Author: mandarchougule
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the North Point metro station. The rooms are small but clean. However considering it Hong Kong it would have been a good deal for 80 USD. However the hotel scores negative when it comes to service. I hotel management was very slow to respond to my needs (many times the phones were not attended even). Overall I would say it is an average hotel and I would choose to stay there in case no better options are available.

Reviews.Title: “unfortunately not too good.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: its quite a convieniently located hotel, opposite the ferries and 2min walk to the north point metro station. plenty of authentic restaurants around, and 7-11 for those necessities! i have stayed at a number of ibis hotels recently, and i thought i knew what i was going to get. however, the room was very small (the main problem being where we would have put 2 suitcases, most people don't just travel carry-on!) and the bed was literally like sleeping on a concrete block. the hallway carpet is incredibly faded, and we were not asked whether we required smoking or non smoking room. we also had trouble with the lift occasionally, for example, on one occasion it refused to stop on our floor. the maid came in to tidy when we had specifically hung the "do not disturb" sign (jetlag). the good parts are that there was a fridge, handy for a humid climate like HK, there wasd free tea/coffee (2 things you don't often find in an ibis) and the shower was a perfect pressure and never took too long to heat up.

Reviews.Title: “will go back”
Reviews.Author: tinaaugustalofts
Reviews.Content: A bit far from the places I needed to go to, but since the railway system of hk is very efficient, it doesn't really matter. A few steps from the exit of the train station. The room is small as is expected in of hk hotels, but it's not so small that you hit your knee on the bed upon entering the room. Bathroom was ok, shower was not above the toilet (there are places like this in hk, believe me!). Will probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location - tiny room”
Reviews.Author: ShabbirMerchant
Reviews.Content: Location is just next to the subway station and close to causeway area. Room which I stayed in was tiny and barely had space to keep my one bag. Good for a 1 - 2 night stay for solo traveller. View from the window was awesome....

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a nice one night stay at this hotel. Though it s far away, it was convenient cause the train station was literally one minute away from the hotel! There are nice small restaurants along the street...small rooms but cool, comfortable and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough, but small beds and no guarantee of a non-smoking room!”
Reviews.Author: BigFatTourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a reasonable location, with many small shops and restaurants within 1 minutes walk. The central parts of Hong Kong can be easily reached by a pleasant tram ride (2 HKD ; 25 minutes) or subway (5 HKD ; 10 minutes). Unfortunately as there were only 2 elevators and over 30 floors in the hotel, it was always a long wait for an elevator. We stayed in two rooms at this hotel because we were initially allocated a smoking room but upon complaining (twice!) we finally got allocated a non-smoking room from the next night onwards. The rooms were almost identical, and both rooms were very compact but this was not a problem for us. The bed was against one wall and this left a walkway along the foot end and side of the bed, which would be even smaller if bags are placed there. However there was a good sized desk and a safe, both of which we piled stuff on for storage. We did not find the size of the room to be a problem. The main problem for us was the size of the "double" bed. I would say it was more like a single-and-a-half bed, and myself and my partner struggled to sleep comfortably (or at all!) there. I would recommend opting for twin beds if this is possible. The room was spotless but the bedspread/blanket combo and the curtains were a bit dated. I suspect that we were given a non-remodelled room, but I am not sure why or how the remodelled rooms are given out. Overall I felt that this hotel has seen better days, but I suspect that had we stayed in a remodelled room I would have been more enthusiastic. I had no issue with the room size, but the bed size was an issue for us and for that reason I doubt we would return to this hotel. Having said that, we were unable to find a better price for the location!

Reviews.Title: “bad rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: small rooms, small bathrooms, dirty, and bed too small for 2 persons....room rate are expensive...not worth,room smells bad,i cannot sleep when i stayed ibis north point hongkong. too noisy i will not recommend to our relatives n or friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Tiny Room.”
Reviews.Author: UKonthego
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location - a few doors down from the underground station and the bus to/from the airport is just across the road. The hotel feels modern and in good repair. Our room was one of the recently renovated ones and had a city view. As every other review has highlighted, the rooms are tiny. Having said this, there is still tea/coffee making facilities, a safe, drawers and a tiny closet in the room! There is also a TV with a good range of channels. The one major issue that I had was the noise in the hotel - we could hear other people flush the toilet etc. and the air-con units from other rooms etc. were very noisy. I will admit that I did have jetlag and this meant that I was a light sleeper! The lifts were also rather annoying - it took ages for them to arrive so prepare not to be able to rush anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Clean budget hotel, no-frills”
Reviews.Author: SummerGB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. The room is very small, with a small bed as well, but this is typical for Hong Kong. Everything was clean, we had a nice harbour view (you have two choices: harbour or city view). This is a place to sleep, not to hang around. No internet, no mini-bar, but a safe in the room. The entrance to the MTR North Point station is just 25m away. Clean, simple, cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Price was right, but not comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: pine129
Reviews.Content: I am not a big fan of tiny hotel rooms, but I stayed here because of nearby meeting and very good price HKD $500. I wish I had enjoyed, but I did not. Pros Location ideal near MTR and decent shopping Outstanding staff for attitude and being helpful TV channel selection ok for English channels Bathroom was tiny, but adequate and shower was bigger than expected Cons Tiny rooms 2.5m x 3m in bedroom space. Internet - Wifi is expensive and I had lost signal 80% of my stay. This made me angry Bed - too hard and it rolls around on wooden floor too much! Elevators- only 2 , very very small and long delays due to 25+ floors - terrible Noise - I had 2-3 rooms of noisy neighbors at midnight and 6 AM Security - elevators are on ground floor- people can bypass the lobby and go directly to rooms I stayed here for price, but in review, it was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel that in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: special_kk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the location is great - just right next to metro station. We booked a room with he harbour view, the view is fantastic which blew us away. However, we did not enjoy our stay there. The room is very old, tired, stains all over the carpet, and a incredible tiny TV...the room just didn't feel clean or inviting at all. The bed and pillows wasn't comfortable. It really needs to be refurbished. No shampoo/shower gel/ tooth paste supplied, which is supplied in most hotel even the budget ones. Our main purpose going to HK was for shopping. Next time we will stay in Kowloon as we found the metro ticket costly and time consuming to traveling from North Point to Kowloon. (Generally speaking we found things in Hong Kong island is more expensive than Kowloon)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: EdMed
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice, for a total of four nights. The best aspect of this hotel is its location --- across the street from the A11 airport bus (final stop) and just down the street from a metro stop. Several small, inexpensive eateries and a cooked food center are nearby. For both stays, we had a harborview room. The views were great. Neither room had been renovated, though, and the carpet was badly stained. The hallways, too, had stained carpet. Room size was about average for Hong Kong --- tiny! Many reviewers have commented on the elevator situation, so we made our reservation knowing about the problem. During busy hours, the two small, slow elevators are completely inadequate; during other times, they get the job done.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In front of this hotel there stands the bus terminal where the airport bus A11 departs. MTR North Point station is just a couple of minutes' walk. I believe this location will help you enjoy your visit most.

Reviews.Title: “Connections”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is opposite North Point bus station and adjacent to the MRT metro that connects to Central. The airport bus starts/stops here, 1 hour 10 minutes from the airport, and is good value. The staff are very helpful and the rooms are clean. The views from room 2702 are to the back where as the front rooms have a view of the harbour. The room was quiet and the hard bed easy to sleep in. The room does not have enough room for 2 large suitcases and 2 small guests and the bed was to the wall on one side, although the furniture could be altered to give narrow all round access. The lavatory / shower was small, however the shower worked well. We eat in the "transport" cafe 2 doors along which offered good value Cantonese food. The bus to Stanley Market left from the station and access to central Kowloon was easy via the MRT and taxis passed the hotel. This is a good, low cost. transit hotel and for users on a budget offers good value. The cake shop around the corner makes tasty , old fashioned "British" style cakes!

Reviews.Title: “Average Rating”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room is small n tight. No bathroom floor mate and after showering the bathroom floor very wet and slipery. Dangerous, especially for the elder senior person. Need more attention to the wet floor. Also, the security is insufficient as anyone can go directly to the floor they want without any supervision. Th wirless internet is good enough and always disconnecting. need to re connecting every time.

Reviews.Title: “overall ok...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Its very easy to get to this hotel from the airport. But the hotel gets very noisy and also the lift is always so slow. Some tourists are very inconsiderate, they speal very loudly at the corridor. Overall i will stay here again but only a short stay. see picture to see how small the hotel is

Reviews.Title: “The smallest room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Ibis Hotel at North Point has the smallest rooms I have ever stayed in. It isn't actually possible to keep your suitcase open and be able to walk around the room. However I knew the rooms were small, and as I was only staying for 36 hours, this was no great hardship. I had booked one of the newly renovated harbour View rooms and on arrival at around 0100 was allocated a room on the 28th floor, which in the morning I discovered to have fantastic views of the Harbour across to where the old airport used to be. The bed was quite hard (good!) and comfortable so I slept well. The air-conditioning however was not convincing and didn't get the room cool enough for my preference. The bathroom was small, but as they say, perfectly formed, however it smelt of mould on the shower curtain. Surely the housekeeping staff can smell this and properly clean the shower curtain? The location of this hotel, right above an entrance to North Point MTR is very handy. There are lots of reasonable - and cheap by HK standards - places to eat within a few minutes walk of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great room with a great view, bed was comfortable, location a little far out from the city centre but still good, free tea and coffee every day made this great value, nothing bad to say here! Staff were friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “They don't care !”
Reviews.Author: Kenny-Lyle
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights from 13 April. Was allocated room on 30th floor which turned out to be a smoking floor evven though I had booked the room 4 months in advance . Okay, you pays your money and you takes your choice but that is no excuse for just the downright ineptitude and surley attitude of staff. 30 floors up is bad enough but when there are only 2 elevators that travel at a snails pace it can take anything up to 10 minutes to reach terra firma or the clouds depending on arrival or departure. The carpets in the rooms are disgustingly stained and not any better in the communal areas.There were net curtains in my room which at one time may have been white but have resigned themselves to be a dark grey with years of nicotine and tar absorbed like some sort of filter to the outside Hong Kong air. Accor Hotels are better than this shambles and need to sort this place out as I for one and others I was travelling with will certainly be looking elsewhere on the island for accommodation next year.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Hong Kong impressions”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: Ibis Hotel, North Point, Hong Kong is in a great location right opposite a bus station, ferry terminal and the Hong Kong tram system. But, as in all Hong Kong hotels the rooms are small and this had one of the smallest rooms I have stayed in. A little cramped but adequate for a few days visit. Check in was quick and efficient except that I was given the wrong room key and had to return to the reception to change the key card. On the first day the toilet would not flush, so traipse down to reception again to report it, fixed quickly though. The TV had a very small screen and a limited range of channels - no BBC News or Entertainment. But the dreadful Fox News and Sky News in my opinion a both not worth looking at, so this was very poor. My room window faced a block of residential flats just a few feet away from the window so lights were essential even in the day time. On my third day there the lift did not stop at the 11th floor but we used the nearby service lift. The food was good value for money and quite tasty. Over all a fairly reasonable standard for an Ibis but the decor needs a but of touching up.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room is smaller than I expected. No toothbrush, toothpaste, and other, only have soap. 30 floor, but only 2 small lift. Room quite clean and place is also quite good. Do not think it is a three star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at good location”
Reviews.Author: iammahler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ibis North Point for 1 week and just returned from my trip. Like many reviewers mentioned, my room was small but it is typical in Hong Kong. I arrived the hotel in the morning before the check-in time, so their staff helped me store my luggage (no extra charge) and asked me to come back at 2pm when my room is ready. The front desk staff are polite, efficient and helpful. The cleaning crew did a great job keeping the hotel clean. My room was a "city view" one and looks newly renovated (on one of the high non-smoking floors). I have to say that it was pretty quiet. The hotel locates across the North Point Ferry Terminal (take A11 bus from the airport to the last stop, HK$40/trip) and a few steps to the MTR (subway) station and 7-11. The restaurant on the 2/F has good food ranged from HK$55 to HK$68+ for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, convenient location, rooms so compact that you can hear guests across corridor”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful no matter what time, response to my internet questions were immediate, even recommended on checkin that I buy 7 day package rather than daily internet package to save considerable costs- HKD120 for 24hrs whereas HKD300 for 7 days. Lots of eateries and local colour, airport express bus A12 stops right in front of hotel, but beware that you need to get to the bus interchange behind the open public carpark flanking the ferry pier as the return route to airport on Bus A11 is not in front of the hotel. MTR station is just 4 doors away. Room is clean but very small, barely any room to open my solo luggage bag, so had to lug onto bed everytime to retrieve what I need. Guests can be quite noisy and you can hear them across the corridor from my room. Not a typical IBIS as missing amenities which they do not provide when I asked ie bedroom slippers, shower cap. Clothes are hung above this little cubicle housing the useful in-room safe so clothes or trousers cannot be hung full length.They have some single rooms which has a 3' bed instead of the double or twin beds and such rooms can only be booked by speaking to them - something I accidentally found out when I tried to book online on dates that listed them as fullhouse.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel if you are looking for a deal and don't mind compromising”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: it's a no frills hotel but the bed was too hard to sleep on...did not get the best sleep. Other than that hotel staff are friendly. The mini bar was totally empty despite hotel blocking securoty deposit on credit card while checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Small but good services”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ibis North point Hotel for 4 night. I chose harbour view room. It is good view for me to relax . The room is very clean and comfortable for me. The staff is so nice and good service. The hotel is near MTR north point station. There are 2 thing that I will complain is 1. no foot towel in front of bathroom that make me slip when out of bathroom 2. room are not soundproofed room

Reviews.Title: “Great view, close to transport but the bed was really hard...”
Reviews.Author: Lexbex
Reviews.Content: I have read other peoples reviews before I left Australia and I thought "how hard can a bed be?" Until you have attempted sleep on one of these beds..... I ended up walking to the 7-11 and bought wine or beer just to help me get to sleep, even after walking around all day! I booked through accor.com and thought I had pre paid for breakfast.I was told on the second day of my stay that they did not charge me for it at the time of the booking so be aware that this may happen to you. Other than that, the staff are helpful and courteous, the elevators are a bit of a wait especially between 7am to 9am. I caught the train from the airport to the hotel and got caught having to drag my suitcase up a few flights of stairs in certain places. When I left, I caught a taxi to the airport express check in at Central/ Hong Kong station(approx. $55hk)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and Accor Website Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ibis North Point is nice. Clean rooms at reasonable prices. Staffs are nice and accommodating. Regarding the Accor Website, hope you can enhance the system. I booked two rooms at the same time and both are labeled "Complementary". However, when we checked in, it turns out that only one room is free. The receptionist's only explanation is that the system cannot check.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well situated, near MTR, shops, markets and the tram. Check in and out was very good. Ibis has left luggage facilities. Room was comfortable and clean, though noisey from other guests (this seems to be standard in Chinese budget hotels). I upgraded to get a harbourview room, well worth the HKD 55 daily charge. Ibis meals were good.

Reviews.Title: “Uncountable Stayed with this hotel..”
Reviews.Author: 0_Gyrfalcon_0
Reviews.Content: I was living here in Hong Kong for 2 yrs in this area.So,after I moved I still going back for shopping,meeting friends and etc. I always book a HarbourFront room.When I woke up and see all those boat in the the water...make me feel peaceful :) The room is very tiny but not too bad.I just have to stand my luggage up at all time if I wasn't need to open it. And when I needed,I have to open it on the bed. The bed and pillows is ok not to hard or not too soft.All sheets were clean. This hotel is 2 mins walk to North Point Station, only 3 stations to Causeway shopping area. and very close to pier that can take the boat to Hung Hom ( have a big shopping mall,coffee shop,restaurants and big buses terminal that you can take to Tsim Sha Tsui about 10 - 15 mins ) 3 - 4 mins walk to North Point wet market (market is clean and people there most of them speak good English..recommend to buy cherry there so cheap compare to bkk and singapore) / 3 mins walk to 2 hkd local shop I bought some hairs & nails accessories there same brand that sasa selling for 12 - 18 hkd like nails sticker,hairs clips (you needed to know a bit numeric in Cantonese for this one) You can also walk over to Parkinshop supermarket,10 dollars store,ijiban japanese snack shop,watsons,gardian and sasa all of them not a long walk .I thik only 10 mins max. P.S. I never try the breakfast here.I only book for the room and go out eat in Wanchai or Causeway. Like ; Location Dislike ; Nothing

Reviews.Title: “Almost all good...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderfully locate by the MTR (subway), easy access to everything. This is great. On the downside, the housekeeper seems to have no schedule; either show up too early or too late.... Very poor service of massage in the hotel; probably is just rented to someone, they don't care about you, you can get better service around, cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Shoebox with a View”
Reviews.Author: lieslb
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews prior to booking and was pleasantly surprised. Yes the rooms are compact, but they are neat, clean and an great value for Hong Kong. We had a renovated superior room that overlooked the harbor - an absolutely stunning view. We did not experience any noise issues from the neighboring rooms which may be due to our room location (end of the hallway). The toiletries were limited to a bar of soap and a generic soap dispenser in the shower. If you need a decent shampoo and conditioner, bring your own. It was very easy to get to the hotel from the Hong Kong Airport. We took the A11 Citybus from the airport. It's reasonably priced ($40HKD = $6 USD) and a great way to see the area. It's a double decker bus with a great view. Getting around was easy as the North Point MRT station is next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty basic, small room”
Reviews.Author: Fiver75
Reviews.Content: Ibis was reasonable, without being too great. The room was tiny, so much so that I had to leave my luggage sitting next to the bed (there was no wardrobe space). The room itself was very clean, but it was just SO tiny! Everything you would expect was jammed in there, though - TV, desk, fridge, kettle, etc... It was okay because I was on my own. The hotel is a little remote, but the MTR station is nearby, so it is not too bad. My room was on the south side, so there was no view to speak of - from memory you pay extra to get a room with a view. Ibis was okay, but I think you can get better value for money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room for the money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at Ibis Northpoint, the longest being 14 days, the shortest being 2 days. I've always had the harbor view room, and the view is magnificent, many other expensive hotels would kill to get these views. The staff is usually helpful and friendly. The rooms are, by Western standards, tiny. However, if you just want a place to sleep and clean up, this is the best choice for the money. At other hotels you get much less for much more money. My only complaint is the bed, the mattress is very very firm, but this is not unusual in Asia, so it's not a hotel-specific issue. The rooms are adequate for a comfortable, albeit cramped, stay. There are tea/coffee making facilities and a refridgerator, which I find most useful. The room is clean and the space is used quite well. Two people in a room is possible, but be prepared to knock elbows.

Reviews.Title: “Value for $. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked thru the Accor since I'm the member. Good discount offer. Very Convenience location as North Point MTR station is just less than 50m away. Local food (Cha Chaan Teng) is only 1 mins walk from hotel & it opens 24/7. No problem to grab nice food in the middle of the night. Great value for a harbour view room in HK. Small room though as expected in this city. Only set back is ventilation system for smoking rooms. If they find a solution to eliminate the after-smoke smell in the rm before the next check in will deserve a plus plus point. Reception staffs are friendly & helpful. Will go back for sure for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Economical, Convenient Stay”
Reviews.Author: jeffayn
Reviews.Content: The room is much smaller than I had expected. Its just nicely placed a queen bed and thats all. The bathroom is just a sink +toilet bowl + a 3'x2' shower area. So you can imagine how small the room is afterall. The room is only equipped with a 14" CRT tv. Thanks is still working. No free internet is provided. Is a clean(not sparkling clean, just comfortable clean) and convenient stay. The hotel is just beside North Point Metro exit. So is pretty convenient for traveller. Recommend for quick convenient stay, but not for leisure comfortable family trip. One more thing to watch out. Request only Harbour view. not City View.

Reviews.Title: “very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Aroundtheglobe18
Reviews.Content: It is not easy to find an affordable hotel in Hongkong. We had to change the room three times until the room was quite acceptable. So small you have problems to find space for the suitcases. Beds are horrible, too small for europeans. The higher rooms seem to be a little nicer but the lift will need a very long time to get there. Bathroom is clean and small. The next underground station is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Plesant stay”
Reviews.Author: SimonYYZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right beside the north point station. It is easy to get here from the airport taking the A11 bus. It actually stops just across the street from the hotel. The staff are great and the hotel is very clean. There is lots of shopping (including a grocery store) and several good eating options well within walking distance. Yes the rooms are small and there is no free internet, but this hotel is still great value.

Reviews.Title: “Small but very nice modern rooms with good service.”
Reviews.Author: colbolin
Reviews.Content: Went to Ibis for 3 nights as part of a 1 week holiday. We turned up early and was upgraded to a superior deluxe so we can only comment on that. The room was small, but this is Hong Kong. It was very modern and clean, with wall mounted LCD tv. Great view of Hong Kong harbour from North side of hotel. Newspaper supplied every morning. Rooms cleaned every day. We didn't eat in the hotel but there is a restaurant which looked quite nice and the food was very reasonably priced. Customer service was great, there is internet in the lobby and the staff help with any questions you might have. Location: we thought would be quite out of the way, but its so easy to get around Hong Kong that its not an issue whatsoever. All in all, for the price they offer its an absolute bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Rusandco
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from our first holiday to Asia and this hotel and city did not disappoint. I booked a superior harbour view room and I was so glad that I did. We were on the 19th floor ( room 1906) facing the front so we had a panoramic view of the harbor from our window. The room itself, although small, was spotlessly clean and was perfectly ok for two people. The shower was good, with plenty of hot water, and we also had tea and coffee making facilities plus a TV with several satellite channels ( Although not ESPN much to my husband's disgust, as we were there for superbowl!). I had read before we went that the beds were hard, which on first testing they do appear to be. However, they turned out to be very comfortableO

Reviews.Title: “The best option in HK if you don't wanna spend a fortune”
Reviews.Author: zorbailgreco87
Reviews.Content: This hotel is totally the best option in the whole city if u dont wanna spend a fortune...You are in a perfect location, on HK island and u get a great view on Kowloon if staying in a room from 20th floor over. Breakfast is acceptable, rooms are kinda small, but you are in Hong kong, why would u spend your stay in your room?!? It was clean enough. Staff was ok and this was not my first stay here. always making me satisfied and again, the value is great.

Reviews.Title: “OK but...”
Reviews.Author: fareaniborabora
Reviews.Content: Hotel confort limited to the strict minimun. A bed, a desk, a chair is what you will find in your small room. A kettle would have been nice to make coffee, especially when you are on a long stay.. the strenght is the easy access from the airport and the north point station is 30 secondes away excellent little japanese restaurant next to the hotel on the right when facing the building internet seems to be an issue in HK.. no cyber place, and connections are expensive in hotels I choosed this hotel because I know IBIS, but I think it is below usual standards. The prices are good deals thought.. But I could not bare this small room after 3 nights there..

Reviews.Title: “Lunar New Year”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent vacation for lunar new year in Hong Kong. Stayed at the Ibis at North Point and it was small but that was expected. It is right next to the North Point A2 subway station and there are a lot of things around it. The staff was great and the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Complaint of Poor Facility”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Flexible Hose shower head shall be installed, instead of fixed shower head. Fan Coil Unit nosy despite running at low speed

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK A "CLASSIC ROOM" WITH A "CITY VIEW"”
Reviews.Author: BabyBlueEyesParis
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at this hotel. I had originally booked a "Classic Room" with a "City View". Basically, this type of room is a dark, dirty (stains on the curtains, carpets, dirty marks all over the walls and the bathroom was black with mould), grey prison cell and the view was the tower block behind the hotel. See my photos attached. As soon as I opened the door to the room I went back downstairs to the reception to change rooms immediately. We paid extra to have a "Superior Room" with a harbour view. If you are going to stay in this hotel please spend the extra money to book the “Superior Room” with harbour view, as you WILL feel better during your stay. The "Superior Room" is exactly the same as the prison cell in size expect there is laminated wood flooring, a flat screen TV on the wall and the cupboard doors have been changed. The bathroom had a new lick of paint too but is still tiny. I must admit that the Harbour view is impressive. However, the hard as rock bed was still the same. Certain rooms, on higher floors, have obviously been refurbished and hence have the "Superior Room" status. The rooms are not soundproofed in any way. We could here people getting in and out of the lift, mobile phones ringing in other rooms, people using the bathroom and talking in other rooms. We were on the 19th floor and could here the traffic going by as well. The hotel has 31 floors and just 2 very slow lifts. After a couple of days, waiting for the lift all the time became very irritating. We didn’t have dinner in the hotel however, there didn’t seem to be a large choice on the menu nor was it very international. The breakfast buffet was well stocked but NOT very appetizing. The plus points of the hotel are that the staff are friendly and eager to help. The hotel is just next door to a metro line that takes you directly to the centre of Hong Kong and opposite a ferry that will take you across the bay to Hum Hong. The harbour view from the Superior rooms is fantastic. This ibis is definitely of a much lower standard that you would expect from an ibis in Europe but does offer a basic, “cheaper” place to stay whilst in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Usual quality”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Again very happy with the Ibis North Point. Stayed there a lot and its maybe not everyones cup of tea but i am always satisfied

Reviews.Title: “Quick Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Not too bad for a quick and cheap stay in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Harbour view room is a must!!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in late January. I've booked 2 rooms at Ibis North Point via Accor website and have requested for the room upgrade, using my a-club gold benefit. Staffs have taken care of my request so well, a staff called me (I'm in Thailand) to confirm if I wanted my rooms on non-smoking floor or not. Excellent service!!! I've checked in early and my rooms were ready. Process was swift and efficient. Rooms and beds were quite small but it's Hong Kong standard to me. Cleanliness was perfect. Doors were not fully sound-proofed. I woke up several times at night with the sound of slamming doors from other rooms. Elevators were slow as expected since there were only 2 elevators serving 31 floors. Location was perfect and really closed to the MTR. A food shop next door offered great choices of food. And if you walk to the left of the hotel, cross the road and then turn left, you will find a local bakery shop. It's egg tart was to die for!!!! (and it's only HKD2 a piece) Other choices of bakery were great and cheap too. So, you better try it once. All by all, I love this hotel. It would be great if the bed was bigger. And make sure that you book for a harbour view room. I've made a mistake by not choosing it and I still regret that!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small room small bed”
Reviews.Author: LuciDublin
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a 1 night stay. When other reviewers say small they really mean small. Not much room to move around and beds, well they has 2 in my room it took the two of them joined together to make a real bed. Ok for 1 night not good for many more. Located beside metro so that was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendlt staffs, horrible room.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I knew that the bed would be small, but didn't expect that it'd be THAT small. The bed was so hard, I felt that it'd hardly make any different between the bed and the floor. We were placed on the 7th floor. The room was extremely old and in serious need of renovation. The worst was the strong smell of stale cigarette. I asked to change the room, but was told that it was fully booked and what they did was sending a cleaning lady to spray some air freshener, which was worse. I read some reviews that the higher floor should be better. Well, the location was good, the staffs were helpful and friendly, but I don't think I'd recommend this hotel to anyone. If you could, pay a bit more and get proper bed in other Accor hotels.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good hotel good location small room but best value and cleanliness

Reviews.Title: “hotel facility and room service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I expect to have the toiletry provided, no asking of requirement non-smoking/smoking room. If there is no complaint, no upgraded provide (I learn from my friend). How ever this is good location near MRT station. Thank you,

Reviews.Title: “Bad Exeperience in Ibis HK”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The non renovated room was horrible! Room was so small that i cannot even open my luggage. Room was not clean and was dim. Bed was extremely hard and air con not working. Will definitely NOT go back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Northpoint”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this budget hotel previously for the price its great, very friendly staff who are only to happy to assist in any and every possible way. ideal for families, located very close to railway station Northpoint is also safe & a central, a good location to explore any area of Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Live in a box”
Reviews.Author: marcus_schuetz
Reviews.Content: Good to spend a night when stranded in Hong Kong. If you want to open your suitcase, you have to go on the corridor to find the space. Very small rooms. Practical.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 3 minutes walk to North point MTR station with 5 minutes trip you will be reach Central or causewaybay. the newly renovated room is compact. not much space but just nice. Worth paying. the only minus is the waiting time in the lift. so be prepared of this. other than that is worth and ok.

Reviews.Title: “quite good. beyond my expectation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: thanks, room is clean, and view is pretty, I am very satisfied, but the front desk is not too courtisous, especial the cool face of ladies

Reviews.Title: “The Small View”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The City view is, very misleading, what it means is that you are looking at more Concrete & Bricks 30 meters away, VIEW ??!! Very Small room, the Breakfasts are monotonous with no variation on a daily basis over my 4 days and the INET WIFI costs are high. However very close to the MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Good Harbour View and location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: easy to ride any transportation such as subway, tram and bus

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: value for money and staff very helpful. The location is easy to get there.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room is clean though its small. The TV is too small. The bathroom is clean and big enough. Its really a hotel with very reasonable price, and the location is excellent. One can go to and from the HK airport very easy by bus.

Reviews.Title: “Location A+, Everything else B”
Reviews.Author: Bazked
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location - step out and turn left and go 15 steps and you are entering the MTR. Hop across the street and you are at the Bus Terminus. You have a chinese food place 10 steps away that is open really late and you have the breakfast menu that starts at 6:30 AM and ends at 12 PM. Now these are the best things for someone on a touristy-kinda holiday. Clean towels & bed linen. Minus - Small rooms (lucky if you have the harbor facing else it would be cramped). Food menu is fixed everyday. No change. It gets boring if you are there for more than 3 days. Its a hotel for a business traveler so everything gets charged. Internet HKD 20 for 20 mins. Bad massage center. Do not even enter the place.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean and in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: YVR-AKI
Reviews.Content: Another hotel found through a local friend when my usual stay (the Charterhouse) was full. I had never been out to North Point before which was one of the reasons I never considered this hotel however this time the options were few. I was quite pleased however with the Ibis. Located a very close to the North Point MTR station along the north shore of Hong Kong Island. Lots of local restaurants including the local market and cooked food complex just down the street. The room was quite small, simple and clean. Had a nice view of Kowloon looking north across the harbour. One of the smallest rooms I have stayed in while in Hong Kong but it was perfectly fine for a few nights or week stay. Bed was comfy and the shower was a good size and there was plenty of light / large windows. Would certainly go back as the price was right and the upkeep / cleanliness was well done. Airport Express buses depart from across the street of the hotel which was very close and useful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located and close to MTR station. Great value for money and the rooms are decent with reasonable space. The bed is a bit hard in my opinion though.

Reviews.Title: “Low Price, Good Location! but surprising tiny room & bed”
Reviews.Author: OneXaverio
Reviews.Content: the (+): + Location is something u can't complain with this hotel. Just 2 minutes away from North Point MTR, it's very well located in the Hong Kong Island. + The Price, with only around US$ 80 per night, was surely a very good value. Now the (-) : - The rooms was very small, and even worse are the beds. It's only 120cm wide. I won't call it a double bed! - The guest elevator was so tiny! This hotel has 275 rooms, but only 2 tiny elevators serve the whole guests. A 10-minutes waiting for an elevator was never fun. - Be careful with "City View"! If you get lower floors, the city view means terrible gloomy view of the building behind the hotel. I would recommend this hotel ONLY to a pure business travelers, who only need a good bed and a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel near the MTR station, Bus, Ferry & tram. So that very easy to go anywhere

Reviews.Title: “Picture and reality”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: See the pictures in the web, the room looks comfortable. But in the reality, it's very small. The very good point is location.

Reviews.Title: “Needs tons of improvement”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The only good point is the location is fantastic otherwise can't expects too much. With only 11sq m the housekeeping can do a terrible job and if you are an environmentalist don't put anything on the bed or else bed will still be unmade.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, small room”
Reviews.Author: 8clopton
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 days at the start of a month long trip, but had muddled up booking (amongst the many), inadvertently only booking 7 nights which hotel staff courteously rectified for us when this came to light. The best aspect of this hotel is undoubtedly the views over the harbour from the rooms at the front. We were not happy with the first room we were given as the view was obscured, but we were moved after one night. The rooms are very compact, but functional, although there is no long hanging space for dresses and little room for suitcases. The rooms are very clean however & the bathroom in our second room was reasonably sized. The lifts are always busy so there was almost always a wait to use them, but when one broke down it was very quickly repaired. Staff are helpful, but always seem very busy, almost invariably there was a queue at the reception desk. The restaurant and cleaning staff are courteous and cheerful, although food seemed dull and expensive to us, compared with other local outlets (esp Java Road market food hall which is only a stones throw away). The Ibis is very close to the MTR station and harbour pier for crossings to Kowloon. For the price, I think the Ibis gives good value for money & we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, Grand view, Noisy night...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location was very good, near of North point MRT station and ferry pier. Tiny but clean and functional room. Spectacular view of harbour. No sound proofing. Reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Only remark : wifi connection is not very stable, keep rebooting. Maybe signal in a bit weak in some rooms (was in 911) But good stay as a whole

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, unbeatable rates if you book in advance”
Reviews.Author: Frenchbeachbum
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located next to Northpoint subway station, rates are awesome if you plan long enough in advance (got mine for less than 300HK$). However, this is HK so the room are small and they are in need of renovation. Spare your stomach and avoid the breakfast buffet. Walk around and you can find some good local restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much and you won't disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It is a cheap and tidy shoebox with a very hard bed and zero character - staff friendly but a little dizzy and not that helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for solo traveler”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is strategic to reach some central point as like wanchai or others shopping center, also easy to get the food by walking round the hotel. For the nightlife is also nice with walking and or by taxi/bus. Tips : after full day activities, better spend the time to wanchai, nice place for nightlife to get some food, drink and or entertainment, but be careful with some taxi driver, they can cheat us if we're not keep our self.

Reviews.Title: “good location, but pathetic infrastructure”
Reviews.Author: RiteshLakhotia
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on my return back to india. The hotel was chosen for only reason, that it belonged to the Accor group. The location was pretty good, just out of the MTR exit. But rooms are as small as the matchbox. I stayed with my brother, and the experience was terrible. I literally put things on the lobby to arrange my bag. Had to keep the toilet doors open, else, I would have suffocated to death. The size of the toilet was smaller than some hotels offering shower enclosures. The worst part is the elevators, .... this sucks big time. If i have to go up or down using the elevator, it was a min. 15 minutes task. The damn thing never stopped in my floor. just two lifts for the entire hotel. Its the worst ever offering from the Accors chain.

Reviews.Title: “Good base to visit Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A bit out of the way but very close to the subway station

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, smelly environement...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although I had read the reviews of other travelers that the rooms are small, I couldn't believe that they would be THAT small. The room size is less that 10 square meter. Check in process was quick but when I asked to change from city view to port view they REFUSED to do it with a non elegant way. Do NOT choose city view, as you will not be able to admire the sea view. The elevators take ages to arrive. Any sound from the corridor is heard loud and clear. The room was SO small that I could not move around with my 1 suitcase. I had to climb on the bed. The windows cannot open and the odor is not comfortable. The only pro is the metro station that is next to the hotel entrance. Breakfast is typical etap breakfast, nothing more than coffee and bread. I booked this hotel because it was the cheapest I could found at that time, although at that price (80euro) I could find much classier hotels in Europe or nearby China. Beware, have a second thought before booking at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Phanuphong
Reviews.Content: Hotel is quite far from hot toursit spot but can access very easy both by subway and bus. Can take bus from airport direct to the hotel. Hotel just few steps away from MTR North Point Station and HK tram. 1 7-Eleven near by and a small super market on the road behide the building. Hotel room a bit small and only double bed available. Compare to the price, this is the good choice for budget traveller and this is better than cheap hostel in Hong Kong. I stayed here twice.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean and small”
Reviews.Author: Bazalina
Reviews.Content: My key demand was to feel safe and I did. It's true that these rooms are SMALL. If you travel with big suitcases you might have trouble finding somewhere to put them. My pack stood up fine in the corner. I'm not really fussy but I loved it. My room looked out over the harbour. It was minutes walk to both North Point trainstation and the North Point Ferry Station. It wasn't the cheapest option but not that expensive. It's a big yellow building that you can see from the Northpoint bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the room is too small and I was not able to understand this when I was booking the room. I did asked the reception desk to allow me to see the room but somehow they said they couldn't. The size of the hotel room is even smaller then the hotel I stayed in Tokyo! So, it turn out to be a disaster. There isn't a proper closet hang my cloth which is rediculous. The corridor is so dark which is horriable. What upset me most is that the hotel is not setting the right expectation to the customer. And I think this is the responsibility of the hotel. And it should be the responsibility for the customer to check.

Reviews.Title: “Improve the employe in the front counter and lobby”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Poor service at the front counter and not friendly like the other accor in Hongkong they not welcome costomer

Reviews.Title: “Good for Hong Kong prices....”
Reviews.Author: andybony_99
Reviews.Content: We stay at Ibis for 3 night and I can not conplain for anything. The room were clean and the bed was ok. I read many negative comment about this hotel, what I don't understand is what you expect for the price you are paying?? Ibis give a good location, only few steps from MTR station, if you can get the better rooms, they have a sea view. Hey we paid 50 euro a night for two and we have got the view as well. I would stay here again and I will recomend this hotel to friends. If the budget is limited or you more happy to spend your money in shopping or dining then Ibis will give you that choice.

Reviews.Title: “Use of WiFi”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located and convenient. The room size is terribly small but this is reflected on the price. The use of wifi is restricted in one go of 3 hours is very inflexible. I cannot see too much benefit to the hotel in charging the use of internet, elsewhere it is provided free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff that listens, cares and helps”
Reviews.Author: wabushtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed early in October at this hotel . Was asked to do a survey, made my comments and they were responded to right away. I feel my comments were listened to and that the hotel cares about the guests experience. I was invited to contact the hotel if I was going to return to Hong Kong , and they would take care of any needs or requests. Well just before returning to Hong Kong I lost my wallet, and didnt have enough time to get a new credit card before returning to Canada. I was able to borrow enough money from a friend but wihout a credit card I thought I would have trouble booking a hotel. I wrote to Ibis management , explained my situation and asked if they could book a room and allow me to pay cash on check in. The reply way immediate, no problem. On arrival I was given a wonderful harbour view room, staff were aware of what happened and told me they were sorry for all the inconvenience I was experiencing, they told me that taking a city flyer bus to the airport would be a cheap and efficient way to get there , and I was extended the offer of a free breakfast for the 3 mornings I was there. I feel the hotel responded with care and consideration, and would happy to return and wish other hotels would be as considerate. I travel often, and at times have had issues that have not been resolved as well as this. The hotel is right next to the MTR (subway) Makes a great way to access trains, boats and perfect for day trips. The airport bus is close at hand, and there are lots of shops and restaurants all around. The area has more of a feel of real hong kong. I travel often, and am on a budget. This was perfect for my needs.Thanks again to all the staff , and one bit of advice to travellers . I often hear people complain about hotel staff, my experience is to treat people with respect, and the way you would like to be treated .

Reviews.Title: “Ibis hotel North Point - Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms for 2 people. Below Ibis standard. Two lifts only for more than 30 floors..you can wait for ages...Breakfast is fine. Not good value.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: aokec
Reviews.Content: Walls had stuff on them, carpets and curtains were completely stained, not just a stain here and there. Garbage was not cleaned up from under the bed. There was a cockroach, phoned downstairs, and they just sent a guy who looked like he came from the kitchen with a rubber glove. Not a single word of apology from management. Hotel was full so they didn't have any rooms for me to change into, and I paid a lot for this hotel room too.b

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good and friendly services from your staff making this stay pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in an interesting and safe Hong Kong neighbourhood. I had breakfast in the hotel each morning and it was good. Also, good local restaurants and great access to the underground system and transit to and from the airport. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: jkiwi2
Reviews.Content: Good budget hotel in Hong Kong. Central Location with Metro close and Pier Ferry across the road.. Rooms were small but comfortable.. Double bed, TV, desk and shower room.. Good servive, no frills hotel but still was still nice for the value... Hong Kong hotels are expensive but the Ibis was a good quality choice for a couple of nights stay.. Clean and Cheap... that's a gem in any hotel city stay....

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get the renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: HappyBoy218
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel for two weeks. Our first room was quite nice, in fact, it is the room they used on their marketing materials. However, they gave us a different room on the second week, which was on a non renovated floor. The room was quite disgusting, with dirty walls, carpet, bed covers, curtains, water stains on the ceiling, rusted curtain rod and fixtures, and worn down tv and furniture. We had to switch to a renovated room with an extra $100 HKD which we thought was totally worth it. The rooms and washrooms were very small, the elavator super slow, and doors not sound proof at all from the hallway... You could hear all the action in the hallway. I would consider other hotels next time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and ideally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisleb
Reviews.Content: I found IBIS North Point suprisingly cosy and modern for its cheap price. Though rooms are small (HK standard...) they are convenient, calm and clean. The hotel is ideally located in the center of hong kong island, one block away from the metro station and in front of the ferry pier to Kowloon. Breakfast was quite OK. I would gladly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nagydiofa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ibis North Point for one night during a 3-day trip to HK where I was attending a wedding. The hotel is ideally located on HK island, 10 minutes by cab from Central. The staff was friendly and helpful. My friend and I had reserved a double-room, which I must admit was small, but all the necessary furniture and equipment cleverly fit in. The room was silent, clean, and nicely decorated. The buffet breakfast was simple (as always at Ibis), but of fine quality & in the adequate quantity . I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for excellent value for money in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Izletnik
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ibis hotel only for one night, although we planned to stay for 4 nights but changed our minds after one day. The room was small but okay and the view was extremely nice, but the whole impression was poor. The thing that was most disappointng and really made us feel stupid was that you need to pay for the internet and then use the purchased time in one piece! I've stayed at most basic and cheap hostels and the internet was always for free! How come such a known chain of hotels cannot privide free internet for their guests? For the price you pay for a room there should be no doubt whether there is free access to the internet. We felt like we were being mocked of and this made us look for other places to stay in and we found a perfect, bigger one nearby for half the price and, guess what, even free wi-fi!!! Plus, the gentle music on the hallways seems nice when you walk towards your room but the effect it has during the night, when you can hear it inside your room, is quite the opposite. It makes you wanna crash the speakers outside the room so that you can sleep in quiet. And it is very thoughtful to put newspaper in front of every room in the morning but what use is it if it's Chinese? I assume the staff could keep track of their guests' nationality and decide on their own if they can make any use of Chinese newspapers. Perhaps they could replace the free Chinese newspapers for free internet. Very disappointed with Ibis Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to be”
Reviews.Author: chris_kock68
Reviews.Content: We were at Ibis North Point about 5 times already. Its really a nice place. The rooms are small but if you book harbour view it is unique. Its easily to reach and it takes you only 15 minutes to get to Central. Wan Chai and Causeway Bay are even nearer. Its a safe and clean place. Shops are around everwhere, even 7/ 11 so you get your daily needs around the clock. Its about walking distance to the harbour with great illumination.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and value for money”
Reviews.Author: vivitang
Reviews.Content: Although the room space is not as big as Ibis in Mainland China, the great view is really value for money. Sitting there doing work while overlooking the harbour view made me relax... Perfect for transportation as only 1-min walk to the North Point metro station, with easy access to all the major business centres within 20 minutes. Clean and tidy room, however, bathroom is quite small for me...

Reviews.Title: “Value for price”
Reviews.Author: maryhan1119
Reviews.Content: Ibis Hong Kong Century is a hotel value for price in terms of location, breakfast and service. The ocean view really surpirsed me during the evening time, especially at sun set time. The next morning, the welcoming waitress in the restaurant gave me a sound wake up. Of course, the food and various choice impressed me as well. This is my first time with Ibis and I think it's really a good choice for budget travel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and value for money”
Reviews.Author: BerryNi24
Reviews.Content: I've booked online at a special rate and surprisely got a harbour view room @ 18th floor upon arrival. The service was good above expectation actually, and the room was small but clean and bright. The harbour view is extremely a ++ for the amount we've paid for the room! (It's really nice to have a view when u wake up in the moring) Location is excellent with north point MTR beside the hotel of which opposite was a bus terminal (A11 directly to airport)

Reviews.Title: “Best harbour view”
Reviews.Author: pink63
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ibis North Point for 8 days in July 2010. I had a harbour view room for $75 Australian (booked with asiarooms.com). I had an ensuite bathroom, fridge, air conditioning, table and chair, wardrobe and cupboard and TV. It was fantastic. The room was clean and the unrestricted harbour view was great. The room was modern with floorboards and very clean. It was enough for one person or two to stay. Rooms in HK are not big but this was sufficient to put my bag down and sleep and watch television when I could. However, most of my time was spent out of the hotel. In July, it is very hot, so the air conditioner was great. It worked perfectly. The hotel is within 3 minutes walk to the MTR (underground train). Across the road is the bus station. Catch the A11 to the airport and you can get a return ticket for $80 to and from the airport.. Parrallel to Java road, where the Ibis is situated, is King's Road, full of buses and trams. The best idea is when you get to HK airport, buy an Octopus card. You can use that to travel with and put about $300 HK on it for 8 days. When you return your card at the airport, you get all your unspent money back plus your $50 deposit for the card. I am a single female traveller, so it was easy to get around and I felt safe. There are North Point markets down the road as well. The North Point ferry terminal is just down the road as well. You will love staying at the Ibis. The internet is $1 per minute. I didn't bring my computer but you can pay for internet access, which is cheaper with your own computer.

Reviews.Title: “I like harbor view”
Reviews.Author: anexplorer99
Reviews.Content: I have been stayed four-nights in Hotel Ibis North Point in the middle of July'10. I traveled with friends. We are party of five and booked three rooms at the same floor. We got a good deal package for double-bedroom plus breakfast from asiaweb website. I knew the standard room was so small (room size: 11 sqm) and gladly volunteering myself to sleep alone. The room is efficient for one person who travels all day long and back to the hotel at night. I like the harbor view from my window room, also watched ferry and see Kowloon side is a bonus plus for this room. Plus point: -the hotel is in front of shuttle bus station from HKIA, take bus A11 from there. -breakfast was served every morning. -near MRT North Point station and there was a best dessert at the back of the hotel. We bought Hui Lau San dessert almost every night before go back to room. Recommended: -the standard room for budget travelers /or people go to HK with friends and not suit for family with children. -foot massage at the same floor with receptionist (2nd floor) was a real treat after walking around HK most of the day.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag, but generally positive!”
Reviews.Author: tclstravel
Reviews.Content: As an Ibis hotel, you'd expect a bare minimum decent standard equaling around 3 star (as most Ibis hotels are). And this one is no exception although somethings are much better than others. The hotel was clean, room was pretty spotless and the bathroom was clean enough. Service we received was excellent. Free newspaper everyday. The staff were helpful, much better than hotel staff you may get in mainland China, that's for sure. They were right up to date with all the latest information on Chantu (the tropical storm that was nearing/passed HK as we stayed there) and they always had a smile on their face. The location from the main Hong Kong sights is a little far out but the proximity to the metro station is absolutely amazing - maybe 50m if less. This metro stop is North Point on the Island Line exit A1 - turn right and you are practically there. It cost around 6HKD to get to Central - around £0:50p. Value for an IBIS was good but for hotels as a whole average. The harbour view room was a nice plus. Breakfast was pretty good too, although probably not worth the money if it isn't included in the room rate (it was quite expensive). The Internet cost money as well although was very quick. Rooms. What can I say? As echoed by many on here, they are very small, there is no hiding from that. However, they are quiet, the sleep quality is good, beds are comfortable and the bathroom is nice. At the end of the day, if you're in Hong Kong on business or leisure, you shouldn't be spending much time in your room, so it doesn't matter (to me anyway). If you're in a hotel for other reasons then I guess you should be treating him/her to something to a little more upmarket!!

Reviews.Title: “No frills. Just what you need from a hotel on a shopping trip.”
Reviews.Author: Almacastellino
Reviews.Content: December 27 to 31, 2009 My husband and i booked 3 Nights 4 days at the Ibis, North Point, Hong Kong. This was my husbands first trip to Hong Kong.I had been to Hong Kong on several business trips but never taken a trip just to sight see and enjoy the shopping. So while i knew the city well, when it came to choosing a hotel, I wanted one that was centrally located yet comfortable. Not a fancy place but a clean bed and breakfast hotel. I knew that most of the day we would be out yet wanted the hotel to be close enough to head back and rest a while at mid day before getting out once again at sun down. After a search on the net for hotels in Hong Kong we decided we would stick to an international chain of hotels. Today most international hotel chains cater to the budget traveler.
