A traveler who wants a certain standard yet knows its not going to cost an arm and a leg. We chose the Accor Group of Hotels. Then decided on the budget chain IBIS. The Ibis in North Point is very well located. It's just a few steps away from the MTR ( Mass transit Railway) and in the city's circumference. So if you decide to hit the night spot Lan Kwai Fong and lose track of time, then getting a cab back in the wee hours of the morning is only a short drive back to your hotel. The hotel over looks the bay and rooms facing the bay cost extra but waking up and seeing the harbour across is well worth it. Between the harbour and the hotel is the city bus terminus. My husband is not a bus guy and at first refused to take the double decker bus from North Point to Stanley Market. But when i insisted he agreed. At the end of the journey he gave me a hug saying that this was the only time he was happy to listen to my advice. The scenes from the top of the bus of the harbour as the bus took the meandering hilly route was absolutely breathtaking. And since the bus starts from North Point, choosing your window seat is never a problem. The best part about staying at North Point was that we could always head back to the hotel if we got tired shopping. The hotel provides Tea and coffee in the room so you can always count on that to revive you from your tiring shopping escapades. In fact on the last day we tried the Massage center located in the Lobby of the Hotel and found it to be well worth the price. The hotel Lobby has Vending machines that offer you sodas, juice and candy bars. And if you need more that what the machine offers, there is a Seven Eleven just outside the Hotel. The area outside the hotel has a range of Chinese restaurants and even a local street bazaar. One morning we wanted to get a head start to our sightseeing so decided to head out early. We were happy to find a chines bakery selling all kinds of Breakfast buns just on the turn to the main road. The rooms are small and compact. But it has an ensuite bathroom and great for those who want to spend more time discovering the city and less time in the room. The coffee shop in the hotel serves a decent breakfast with a choice of western and traditional Chinese fare. If you are not adventurous with food then you can be sure you will find Eggs, toast, jam butter croissants and coffee and tea. Whats more the price is perfect. Its in fact what i would call a bargain especially if you avail of the special offers they have from time to time.

Reviews.Title: “NICE LOCATION. SMALL ROOMS”
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located . Close to bars, metro , buses,and nightlife. Although the rooms are pretty small, it's a great value for money in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like I Was in A Closet”
Reviews.Author: Lizarazu20
Reviews.Content: Room/Facility: Incredibly small. The closet was hilariously small, about the size and depth of a 15 inch tv. The bathroom is so small that you can sit on the toilet and rest your head on the sink. However the shower was a decent size, almost obnoxiously big when compared to the rest of room. When you lie in the bed, you can pretty much touch all four walls. And it's not the bed is big, it's really like a single, but that the room is that small. If you have 2 pieces of luggage, you'll have to open them one at a time, and you can forget about "walking" in the room. We chose this hotel because it was cheap, and we thought we would be out the entire time, just needing a place to sleep. Don't make the same mistake. Pay a little more, and get a room where you don't feel like you are trapped. Rating:(0/5) Staff: Not the friendliest. I asked if they had bigger rooms, and they gave a curt "No" and walked off. Check-in took a long time. Rating:(2/5) Location: Did not check out the area, only taking the MRT, which was only a minute walk away. Possibly the only positive of this hotel. Rating:(2/5)

Reviews.Title: “Ok for travellers on a budget you pay for what you get”
Reviews.Author: amaddrell
Reviews.Content: Prior to booking this hotel I browsed the internet to find the best deal in Hong Kong and also read the reviews in depth. I didn't expect much from this hotel as the price was alot cheaper then other hotels and the reviews were average to bad. So, I was pleasantly suprised when I arrived at the Ibis as the outside/reception areas and generaly communal space was nicely decorated. Also, the hotel was well located and easy to find. I was put on the 27th floor and being scared of heights and lifts the staff moved me to the 7th. Unfortunately this was a smoking floor and I had asked for a non-smoking room. The room however did not smell of smoke and the housekeeping came up to refresh the toom. The staff in the hotel were extremly helpful and friendly. The room itself was small and suffering from wear an tear though the bathroom was fine. I would not stay there again though it is ok for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Bed with fleas”
Reviews.Author: An0nym0u5
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not worth the getting Ibis brand. 1. Location is great, 1 minute walk to bus station and North Point mtr station. 2. Price is good, HKD3540 for 8 days (but we found out that we would rather pay more for any flea free hotels after staying) 2. Bed is extremely hard but acceptable for me, but could not sleep everyday after 9ish as hotel is under renovation. Noise level is unacceptable given that it starts at 9:30am, was advised nothing that they can do since all floors have the same noise level. 3. 2 lifts sharing 30 floors, my average waiting time was 4 minutes. 4. I knew HK is a place where small rooms are common, but those curtains and carpets with stains really need to be cleaned/replaced, they made me feeling like living in a very disgusting place. 5. bed was tidy but found hair on it, they may not replace sheet even traveller checks out. 6. on our 8 days stay, we had around 30 flea bites on day 3, with no apologies or what so ever, we were allowed to have another room after complaint. After chatting with a cleaner i was advised to turn on A/C on the time to calm the fleas otherwise they are very active (turned off A/C due to point 6) 7. (both) room temperature knob is not working, temperature remained the same on either 16 or 30 degrees. Fan speed can be adjusted though. 8. i was confused on the star rating on ibis north point (4 star from tripadvisor and 3 star from booking.com) but according to international hotel star classification (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star_(classification)#Hotel_ratings) this hotel is 2 star due to a few missing facilities. 9. asked if we can take our luggage (4 pcs) to the bus stop across the road with the hotel luggage trolley but was refused and advised that luggage trolley only as far as to the front door. 10. they had archived their "15 minutes" service promise when i asked for extra pillow and some spoons though. If you've read all the 10 points above and okay with those conditions, feel free to take your own risk. Ibis management if you see this review you can contact me I am happy to discuss this further as I could not find any complaint links on your website.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no frills... but several catches”
Reviews.Author: HK1013
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a full week and paid for a Harbour View room, which I received and the view was lovely most of the time, however the North Point area gets extremely cloudy in the summer and quite dark, compared to the West of the island however could often see cruise ships coming into the harbour each morning, people sailing during the day, the lights from Kowloon at night etc. The hotel is very basic for the cost and there are quite a lot of catches, I found. The breakfast was very inconsistent - some mornings there would be bacon rashers, other mornings none. Sometimes there would be brown and white bread for toast, other mornings just one or the other, etc. Quite a selection of Chinese-style options, of course, but no Western-style tea, just coffee or orange juice, or tap water. The hot breakfast was bacon (some mornings), small salami-style sausages, lovely scrambled egg (in abundance), potato wedges and fried skinless chicken pieces. No fruit at all or yoghurt which disappointed me in the beginning, however there was a small fridge for use in my room but I found that yoghurt which I bought went off very quickly in it. No room service either which was disappointing after a long flight but the restaurant operates during the day, I didn't try it but the menus looked nice each day and great value, about $30 for a mains and it always sounded busy. The district is full of local restaurants though, a couple had English menus, and there are corner shops and the MTR and tram stops are very near to the hotel which is a huge plus! There is wireless internet available in your room, if you have a laptop, but the cards which had to be purchased at reception cost HK$40 for 3 hours or I believe $300 for 24hrs, and these timings had to be used up all at once, could not be spread out over several days. The rooms are tiny compared to even basic Western standards and there was no wardrobe, just a few hangers in a hole in the wall above the safe. The carpet is old, there were significant pieces of missing ''wall'' or skirting board in my room and the bathroom. The bathroom was old but fine and the towels had a slight smell of disinfectant each day. The TV had several English-language channels, including a few local ones and France24, Fashion TV... Also some in French and German, but mainly Chinese of course and it was great to be able to come in after the day and catch up on some English-language news. I was a solo female staying at the hotel and one of the (male) room attendants seemed to take a shine to me, I mean he was very nice but when he would meet me as I was leaving he would frown and ask if I really needed my bed made that day... I just let him away with it each day as it's not something that bugs me too much and I don't believe in washing sheets too often during a hotel stay. It was a purely functional stopover place for me and I would recommend it based on the price, but please remember that HK hotels add on 10% service charge to your total bill.

Reviews.Title: “If you are on a budget-this is the place for you”
Reviews.Author: nairajay10
Reviews.Content: Yes this maybe the hotel with the tiniest room in the world but for the price I paid it was good, the bathroom was tiny too but it always had hot water and the view from the room was the wall of the next building there is even a small TV thats fits into the wall (and one english channel) but all this did'nt matter too much as we hardly spent time in the hotel.The best part about the hotel is that it is next door to the north point MRT station so basically no place in Hong Kong is too far away. The staff at the front desk were efficient as well (ofcourse it was a reception,concierge,travel desk etc all rolled into one) but they got the job done and were polite as well.So if you are in Hong Kong on a budget and would be spending most of the time out exploring then this is a good option.Oh and another good plus on the hotel -the A11 shuttle from the airport stops right in front of the hotel (it's the last stop when you travel from the airport) so basically you save since you don't need to take a taxi or the airport express which cost a lot more than the airport city bus.There are cheap places to eat around (mostly local food but thats good too) and a bustling market to check out if you have the time.A 7-11 really close also helps.

Reviews.Title: “Almost time to refurbish.”
Reviews.Author: patrick88Manila
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel due to the great deal $50 no rebook no cancellation promo. REally cheap- I guess you get what you pay for (at least we got upgraded to a Harbour View!) Good location, beside the MRT subway entrance, nice chinese noodle restaurant right outside the hotel, but at 11 sq m, rooms are indeed tiny. The carpets need to be replaced. I would not walk barefooted on them. We had to make a second trip to Hong kong and rebooked but without the promo was about $100 a night- seems like a Toy s & gift trade fair and China HOng Kong holiday weekend no more promo. Not worth $100 a nite.NOt great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean room, great view of harbor, great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: WestsideJack
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 days at the Ibis North Point in April 2010 and was very pleased with the hotel. As others have noted the room is very small (about 100 Square feet) -- about half the size of the typical cruise ship. The bathroom layout was also close to what you'd find on a cruise ship. The room was adequate for a solo traveler, but would be tight for a couple. Location is fantastic -- MTR North Point station is 50 meters west of the hotel's entrance. The A11 bus to the Airport stops about 100 meters South of the hotel at the NOrth Point Bus Terminal. The North Point ferry terminal is about 200 meters South of the hotel. The Tram stop on Kings Road is two blocks North of the hotel. There's also a McDonalds on Kings Road that you can access from the MTR station. If you need an electrical adapter plug, there's an electronics store just around the corner from the MTR exit on Java Road that sold me one for HK$ 6. Elevators were very slow. Several times I walked down from my 16th Floor room to save time. There was a bit of noise from the several busloads of Chinese tourists that stayed at the Ibis North point, but nothing that should prevent you from sleeping. TV in room had about 16 channels, but no CNN (Voice of America (VOA) was probably the best news channel) I'd would stay at Ibis North Point again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view can't compensate for the tiny, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: asia_short_tripper
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Hong Kong from Macau late in the afternoon. I was supposed to meet a local friend and stay at his place my first night in Hong Kong, but the plans fell through and I found myself homeless for the night. I tried to recall cheap hotels I had seen on the net. I could remember the unusual look of the building, and my other hotel was in North Point. The rate was inflated as I was a "Walk in", as I recall it was around $800.00 HK for the night. The room was so small that I actually laughed. I have stayed in Hong Kong before and was aware that Hong Kong rooms are generally smaller than those anywhere else in the world, but this one took the cake. The view was quite impressive from the room, I was on the 26th floor and had great views out over causeway bay and across to Kowloon. Travelling alone the size was not much of an issue for one night, but I think more than that and I would have started to feel way too claustrophobic. Hong Kong is a hard place to find personal space in as it is without sleeping in a shoe box. To be fair, the room was very clean (hard surface floors ensure carpet cleanliness is no issue) and rates on the internet are quite reasonable for any bed in Hong Kong. Just don't try to fit more than one person to a room. There is space for a double bed, a shower and a toilet, and if you're lucky, you might find a tiny slither of space to stow one medium sized suitcase. All in all, no frills miniscule rooms, but clean and bearable for short stops if you're travelling solo. Who knows, you might get a great view too. Just don't pay too much.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room ever!”
Reviews.Author: bubblybenji
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival at this hotel, we were delighted by the view from the reception desk and the style which was stylish and all, but when we got to our room, that's when we came to a shock. The room was sooooo small that we're so confused how to manage our luggages (there's only 2 of us, and 2 suitcases - mid size). My friend and I had to take turns to walk in the room. The TV is sunk in the wall and we had to take it out to watch, and since the location os right at the bed-foot, we accidently kicked the TV during sleep. I would recommend this hotel only for business-travellers, where you'll be out all day and dont care much about anything else but your work. Regardless to the room, the breakfast is nice and nicely decorated with large windows where you can see the pier just right at front.

Reviews.Title: “the world smallest.”
Reviews.Author: santhira
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the room through telephone. I was thinking it is the best hotel in the city. Upon landing in the room (after paying for 10 nights) we found that it is the smallest room so far we stayed., The room hardly is 6 sq. m. Two persons cannot walk freely wtihout knocking each other. The table and the bed is hardly half a meter far. So is the bed and the wall to wallk hardly one feet.. the T.V. (the world smallest t.v. ) is placed just by the side of the bed, which is so difficult to watch and it is not equiped with cnn or bbc. mainly chinese channels. We were not given any breakfast, for that we have to pay HK$100.00. The bath room is just too small for any two person to go in. The shower place is just one meter sq. If you bath freely then you get your elbows knocked to the wall. There is any space to hang the towels. No closet is proivided as there is no more space. This room is just fit for little kids for the age of 10 and below. and surely not for adults. Nothing great about this hotel as the reception counter is just the worse. For 10 nights you stay you never got anything free. Please go to some o ther hotels and stay.

Reviews.Title: “avoid the hotel”
Reviews.Author: starjen
Reviews.Content: As a member of accor club, you will be given a member discount, so I chose this hotel without checking the reviews...how I wish I did... this is one of their hotels that has lower price, but I'd rather stay in other hotels that has the same rate but with a bigger room and cleaner... this hotel has a very very very small room, no space for luggage, carpet is so dirty, has foul odor, I ask the reception to transfer us but they said no available, they just sent a room-boy and spray some freshener but it doesn't work at all, the bathroom is so small, the only hotel that do not provide room slippers...the TV is so small (14")...Everything here is small...I just stayed for one night...

Reviews.Title: “Price you pay is price you get”
Reviews.Author: jodieodie
Reviews.Content: When we first arrive at this hotel we are not too surprised, with a long walk to the stairs to go to small check-in counter which we didn't know where the queue starting from. Chek-in counter staff (Ms. Bird) was excellently quick and prompt, good English and giving a very good explanation. Got the 18th Floor room, exactly across the lift, slow lift, small but nice one. Enter the room with difficulties, not being able to put 2 luggages (1 big and 1 small), the bed was awfully hard, magnificent view to pier. Extraordinarry SMALL 14" TV. Internet was not free, HKD 40 for 3 hours if I 'm not mistaken. Bathroom was not clean, especially the floor and toilet. Shower was awesome, warm water also flowing good. Wash-basin was clean. The room has small safe deposit box, small refrigerator. We can hear people chattering from outside and we can hear people taking shower from above and next room. Location was marvelous, near the Northpoint MTR (20-50m walk to the left) We can find any food, 7-Eleven, Circle K around, we even can see the market on accross the street. Easy to find taxi except on rainy days. Check-out time was quick (Ms. Bird again).

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: flapflap
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 10 night stay after finding it on the ibis website for $AU60 a night. We read all the reviews on tripadvisor so knew that the rooms would be tiny, the beds hard and the lifts extremely slow. We were keen to take advantage of a bargain though, particularly given the convenient location. On arrival we were put in an eighth floor room not facing the harbour, which was ok because we figured we could take the fire stairs if the lifts took too long (we only had to do this once during the stay). The bed was quite firm, although already softer than what we'd experienced in some of the budget hotels we stayed in the week before in Taiwan! Basically this hotel served its purpose in giving us a hot shower, bed to sleep in, space to store shopping and proximity to MTR/bus/tram. There's a laundry around the corner that washes clothes by the pound and several cafes downstairs (our favourite for breakfast was You Me You Me, only $HK20 for noodles, a drink and bacon and eggs on toast). If you're planning on being out all day and just using the hotel as a crash pad, this is a satisfactory option that won't break the budget.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid & go to the Newton Inn nearby”
Reviews.Author: hellobayo
Reviews.Content: The Ibis North Point has been the most disappointing hotel I've ever stayed in. Pro: - Very close to MTR exit. Less than a minute's walk. - Main North Point bus statino right in front of hotel, perfect for airport shuttle. - Nice view of the expressway and harbour. Cons: - We were significantly overcharged on our credit card. Queried it once we discovered it on our credit card bill, but received no satisfactory response from hotel. Only that what they charged us was correct, even though our confirmed booking, which we've printed off, states a lower price. Gave up the ghost trying to argue with them. - Very small room. We expected this as had read TA reports, just reiterating. - Dirty carpet, dirty wall, mouldy bathroom. - Thin walls, can hear everything in neighbour's room and whoever is chatting in the corridor. - Non smoking floor (hotel staff did not enforce). Tour groups from China do not seem to care/understand. Open their hotel room door wide with TV blaring at all hours and smoke wafting out into corridor. - Steep charge for internet usage. Can't remember cost, but must be more than £10 a day, as we ended up walking 3 mins to McDonald's to use their complimentary WiFi. BTW that McDonald's also does delivery 24 hours a day! They are plenty of affordable hotels in the area, please do yourself a favour and give this hotel a miss. I wished someone had told me!

Reviews.Title: “Poor, poor and again POOR”
Reviews.Author: Gev-Sar
Reviews.Content: I have known IBIS as budget hotel, with simple facilities, but I didn't imagine such a poor thing in Hong Kong's Ibis. The room was so small, we couldn't even put our bags without obstracting our way out. There was absolutely nothing except of dinosaur's era TV, and a old bed. Walls are so thin, that you can hear every noise from next door. They say, that there is a nice view of Hong Kong harbour from hotel room, but in fact all you see is a bus interchange station and a few ships near dirty pier. Staff has very little idea, what is English about, all they know is how to get to Disneyland. Overall, I was expecting, that it will be not something special, as we were intend not to spend more on hotel, but for THAT kind of hotel, even cheap price looks like we have been overcharged. Doesn't worth, really...

Reviews.Title: “small room but u got all what u need for a fraction of price”
Reviews.Author: iloveskittles
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for bout a week, they have a nice buffet breakfast but you have to be early. its a bit small for a family or even a couple but if youre on a tight budget and you want to be in a nice location and clean hotel these is for you. the room has everything from hair dryer to mugs, but the wifi is not free so i suggest you to just check your email in the cafe where its free.

Reviews.Title: “Shall certainly avoid recommending to family travellers”
Reviews.Author: MHRC
Reviews.Content: Bookings.com has always been great and nearly accurate on rating hotels...the reason for landing in this awful place with kids on 9 days trip to Hongkong. Rooms are TOO SMALL to breathe (forget about moving!) - so what to write about bathrooms??. If you are excited about HARBOUR VIEW room - as a picture on web site shows - for sure disappointment will be much more. Stinking carpets and long waiting at elevators add on to pain. Not good at all for stay over one night and that too if you do not have any choice.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: radvani
Reviews.Content: Given the low prices, I wasn't expecting much, and my expectations were met. The hotel has a fairly good location, just steps away from the Northpoint MTR station. A cab into Central would take around 15 minutes and be around HKD 50, but it depends on the traffic. The most I paid in peak traffic was HKD 80, it took around 30 minutes. Don't expect exceptional service, or any service at all. Check in was swift, my only grouse was that I paid for a Superior Harbour View Room, but all I could see was the parking lot and bus interchange. I was on the 9th floor, the higher floors probably have a better view. The room is tiny to a fault - if I lay down spread-eagled on the floor, I could have touched all 4 walls with little effort. The furnishing is basic, they provide an electronic safe, refrigerator, electric kettle and cable TV (mainly Chinese channels though). The bed was rock hard and on wheels for some reason, so everytime I turned the bed would roll a few inches. The toilet is clean but tiny. Try not to get an erection in the shower, there just isn't enough space. Tips: take your own drinking water & toiletries They have a "restaurant" on the second floor, but I would reccomend trying the restaurants near the hotel, they're cheap and clean if you don't mind the local food. There are also two 7-11's nearby. All in all, it's definitely worth it if you want to stay on the island. However, there are far bette places in Kowloon or Mongkok if you don't mind the distance.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but not horrible either.”
Reviews.Author: UnclePaulie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for four nights at the Ibis North Point. Having stayed at several of the chain's hotels in Germany I can say that the room here is somewhat smaller and the bathroom particularly so. The shower stall is about a meter square which means the shower curtain will cling to your butt, and we're not big people. As for food, if you're not intimidated by working-class eateries with chinese-only signage then you won't go hungry, but otherwise you'll be dining on 7-11 fare. The good thing is the transportation; you are steps away from the North Point MTR station, the North Point bus station (direct buses to Stanley, Repulse Bay, HKG airport) and about a block away from the tram. Plus, the Ibis enabled us to stay on HK Island for US$80/night. If I wanted to stay on HK Island again, I'd look hard at alternatives but I can see us returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: ski_or_snowboard
Reviews.Content: well located and very affordable. breakfast is not wort it. not immaculate either but i guess it's hong kong. would recommand with a yellow flag.

Reviews.Title: “How small can a hotel room get?!?”
Reviews.Author: Raels216
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location for the overseas traveller. It is the last stop for the A11 city flyer bus from the airport so you can't go wrong and it is two minutes from MTR station. BUT...the room was so small it was claustrophobic. We had actually paid for an upgrade and a double bed so I can't imagine what the normal room is like. The lifts were slow and the restaurant was pretty poor. I have stayed in many Ibis hotels all over the world but this was the smallest room I have ever been in.

Reviews.Title: “Accessible, Value”
Reviews.Author: rsky1124
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Hotel is that it is located right next to the subway station (North Point). There is also a Bus depot in front of the Hotel which has regular Direct Airport Bus service starting very early in the morning. The Hotel has a Restaurant and the breakfast served was scrumptious. Cannot expect much from the Hotel in terms of service as it is sort of self service Hotel.The rooms are small which I guess is the norm across HongKong. The bed is just big enough for a average size couple. It is a perfect Hotel for young travellers who would spend most of their day out in the city and just need a decent place to spend the night. The room had a small Television, Refrigerator, Coffee Maker, Locker.

Reviews.Title: “A budget hotel but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: taiwantraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 days when I arrived in Hong Kong. Overall, staff is friendly and helpful. Internet services are provided at a fee, a little pricey but convenient. Laundry services are also available but expensive. Rooms are fit only a bed and a few pieces of luggage. There are no closets or storage. TV in room, a few news channels. Safe and fridge in room. Kettle and coffee cups in room. Beds are very hard but pillows are good. The daily room cleaning service is okay but not great. For some reason they won't replace my used coffee cups. Nice view of Kowloon. Wake up call is not always on time.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but great location”
Reviews.Author: jacky0106
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay in this hotel for 10 days during December 2008. The first impression after entering the room is "tiny". It is probably very tiny but this is HK. For HK$500 a night during December, this is good value in HK. The best thing about this hotel is the location - Love the location as it is just right next to MTR station and bus to airport is only a few steps away too. Staff are friendly and ladies clean the room every day. clean towels provided every day. I would highly recommand to those who is cautious about the $$ and just want a good location.. and not having a big build body. The drawback is that sometimes you want for 10mins for the lift during peak hours (ie. morning) as there were only 2 small lifts. And the tiny room does not have enough space for us to place our shoppings. I would stay here for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Absan
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel for single travellors, Great view form each Room. Privacy gauranteed

Reviews.Title: “Nice views and a cheap night... that's about it”
Reviews.Author: Bobbykat
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room hotel through Accor hotels website for a cheap price of 350 HKD per night ! Hotel was a tall 30 floor building with very small rooms; maybe 15m2 with a hard bed and extremely dirty carpet. The bed did eventually make us sleep thought the nine hour flight probaly made us fall asleep quite easily also :) I had a pair of slippers with me and preferred wearing them rather that walking barefoot on the carpet. Staff was very friendly eventhough most english words spoken to them went ignored which was quite hilarious. Easiest way to Kowloon was to take a 10,50 HKD MTR ticket; MTR was located within 30 metres from the front door. Before we've stayed in Tsim Tsa Tsui's hotels for some 1300 HKD per night but this time wanted to be on a low budget. Arriving to Hong Kong airport it was easy to take a public 'Airbus' A11 from the airport for a mere 40 HKD per person fare straight to the hotel which is located opposite to the North Point ferry terminal (and bus park). Drive took almost an hour but was very good for sightseeing also ! Fares had to be paid either by purchasing a ticket from the airport building or paying exact fare to the driver.

Reviews.Title: “Good BUDGET hotel”
Reviews.Author: ET_105
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a few friends around Christmas to New Years. Was very busy. Started in a Standard view for one night but ended up booking the Harbour View room for the rest of our stay. Very budget hotel. But recommended for travellers who want a cheap rate and not too fussy about space as these rooms are tiny. The Harbourview room view made a difference to the view from the standard room (an office building wall). For a budget hotel at this price, the cleanliness is OK. One of the room cleaners was actually very friendly which made our stay a bit more pleasant. It is in a really good location, just a few steps away from the Northpoint MTR station and there is some good food around the corner. I would recommend this hotel for budget travellers for example, a group of friends who aren't that fussy about where they stay as it is a really good price for Hong Kong. Oh there are a couple of restaurants in the hotel which we didn't actually get to try as there are alot of places to eat just outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “tinest room ever”
Reviews.Author: AjayShinde
Reviews.Content: Worst place to stay with family..tinest room ever possible. also, i was informed the entire hotel as similar rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A prison cell would have more room”
Reviews.Author: welshjohn1953
Reviews.Content: We had booked 3 nights but left after 2. The room was small, had dirty carpets, walls, the net curtains were grey,bed hard as a rock, no where to put your suit cases, no hanging space and the TV was about the size of a postage stamp. The corridor carpet was stained and worn out.There are only 2 lifts that are so small and have a habit of going straight past your floor without stopping. The staff only smile or laugh when you complain. I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy let alone a stranger so be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't wait to leave”
Reviews.Author: AandBN
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights in the Ibis Hotel with wotif.com. One of the major problems is this 31 storey hotel has 2 tiny elevators which fit two people with suitcases comfortably. And yet how did 8 people manage to squeeze in with us? The lobby is not at ground level and can only be accessed by the tiny elevators or by dragging your luggage up a very high flight of stairs. We only had a few days in Hong Kong, so we gave up on waiting for the elevator and dragged our suitcases up and down the stairs. When you finally get to the lobby you have to wait while bus loads of travellers are processed - and once your turn to be served arrives be prepared to defend your position. The room was so tiny we had to put our suitcases on the floor at the foot of the bed, which meant climbing over the bed to cross the room. When leaving the room the cases had to be moved onto the bed. And this was the hardest bed we have ever tried to sleep on. The ensuite bathroom was 1 metre by 2.5 metres, with a toilet at one end, a shower cubicle at the other and a wash basin inconveniently bulging out in the centre. There was just enough room for me to dry myself after a shower, but my broad-shouldered husband had to step out into the bedroom. People talking in the hallway may just as well have been in our room. The carpet was grubby. The sheets had edges which had not been sewn. It was an awful experience, but wotif arranged a refund on our remaining 2 nights, and we moved over the a fantastic hotel in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, brilliant price - very small rooms though”
Reviews.Author: DeanKate
Reviews.Content: Compared to other hotels in Hong Kong, this is amazing value. It is on the water at North Point perfectly placed for the Metro, buses (the airport shuttle goes to and from the bus station opposite so no need to get a taxi from/to the airport - allow over an hour for this) The rooms are titchy but if, like us, you are sightseeing and only sleeping in them, this is great. I wouldn't recommend these rooms for large people as you do have to shuffle around the bed - yes, they're that small or for long stays as there is very limited wardrobe space and storage. It really is just for sleeping for a couple of nights. North Point is a much more authentic Hong Kong experience than Central or Wan Chai but is only 5 mins from them on the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Filthy Shoe Box room”
Reviews.Author: Substance
Reviews.Content: i was going to stay at the ibis a full 5 nights i checked in and went to my room and wanted to slit my wrists. the room was small, dirty, stains on the carpet and walls the tv...well i wouldnt even classify it as a tv i didnt even use the bathroom... after a few hours i decided to cancel my reservation and go to a nicer hotel.. i had to pay for 1 nights accomodation but i am glad i didnt stay there because it was disgusting. i ended up staying at the Luk Kwok Hotel in Wan Chai, for a bit extra $$ it was worth it. avoid this so called "hotel" all all costs.

Reviews.Title: “The most awful place in which I ever stayed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Virginiekya
Reviews.Content: This is most terrible place I ever stayed in Hong Kong!!! The rooms are small, like a prison in which you hardly can find a place for your suitcase, the rooms are very dirty, the carpet had so much dirt that I could not even risk to put off my street shoes. Lying in the bed was not easy to forget the dirt around. Ugly!! The bathroom was terrible small, you hardly can´t move around yourself. Shower was small and of course you are afraid to touch the walls with any part. The breakfast was terrible. There was nearly nothing and the quality bad. Also the breakfast room was dirty and absolutely nonconfortable. The staff was not pretty friedly. The biggest problem I had was the high price for this shed!! Its expensive and terrible!!! I was in Hong Kong several times and always stayed in nice hotels. Now I kow that just a little higher price can decide to be in a much much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Like a jail with seaview”
Reviews.Author: helsinki45
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very, very small (the smallest we had until now although frequent travellers) - around the bed only some one meter space to move around. The bed is small for 2 people but takes the whole room`s space. There are no closets for clothes. Carpet was very dirty! Hotel service unfriendly and poor. The nice seaview compensates partly for the negative facts and that the regular bus No. 11A from airport has its last stop in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to belive, but they call it hotel”
Reviews.Author: kasiaWarsaw
Reviews.Content: It was a nightmare: - poor service - dirty room - expecially CARPETS !!! - small room with 10x10m window - unconfortable bed ( for two people ) - dirty blankets - noisy aircon ( and probably broken ) - never again It was a jail, not a hotel room. It was about 60EUR/night without breakfast, I think is too much. Quite good located, just next to MRT station

Reviews.Title: “Small but convenient, good value”
Reviews.Author: fahrin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small, convenient and simple. There are no frills, but you get what you pay for. The MTR station is stone's throw away, there are lots of cafes and restaurants in the area and the bus stop is across the road. The view from our room on the 27th floor was pretty good too. The room is very tiny - the smallest bathroom I have ever seen, but it is adequate, and apparently the room sizes on Hong Kong Island are small. The bed is a little hard, but we stayed at 3 hotels and all 3 had slightly hard beds, so it must be a Hong Kong thing. North Point is not a very exciting location - slightly run down but the MTR station is close by and the rest of Hong Kong is only a few minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “it doesn't really suck too much”
Reviews.Author: schtarker
Reviews.Content: The reviews here have got this place covered pretty well. Rooms are super small: I'd guess the bedroom area in our room to be 2.2m x 2.2m. Yes, the bed is small and hard, pillows are flimsy and you wouldn't want to rely on the blanket and bedspread to get you through an arctic winter. But...it's clean, it's cheap and it's convenient. Next door to the North Point train station, or close enough; it's maybe 3 doors down the street. Our room was around USD50/night. And the bathroom was clean and functional. Wireless internet access is available in the room for a cost of HK$50/3 hours. About the only thing that really sucks is the elevator. It moves at granny pace and seems to visit your floor every second Tuesday. Here's a tip though: in between reception and the elevators is a door leading to the service elevator. No key or code required, just hit the button and it's all yours. The staff don't bat an eye if they see you using it.

Reviews.Title: “2 Star hotel, no better”
Reviews.Author: jkofman
Reviews.Content: This is a decidedly 2 star hotel. Any source that suggests it is 3 star quality - - as many travel sites do - - is not living on the same planet as the rest of us. Given a 2 star classification, the Ibis hits all the right buttons. Rooms are small but clean, functional but barely so, location is convenient but not useful, desk staff is efficient but not overly helpful, no gym, walls are thin so lots of hallway noise, etc, etc. I experienced no problems with the Ibis but I feel I was oversold on the expected quality and I paid for 3 star lodging. Hence my low rating. If I paid for 2 star accomodation I would rate it higher.

Reviews.Title: “It wasnt as bad as the reviews”
Reviews.Author: hind83
Reviews.Content: The reviews make this hotel sound terrible. but for the price you pay you get a really good deal. the room is clean and theres a great view of the harbour. the ibis is right outside the North Point metro line which made everything so convenient. my friend and i shared a room, it was really TINY but there are so many things to do in Hong Kong that you will barely find the time to spend in the rooms anyway. it was clean, the location is nice, North Point is not far from Causeway Bay or other major streets. all in all it was a good experience and i would definatley go stay there if i visit hong kong again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: smachim
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is on the cheap side and you get what you pay for. The room was tiny, the bed was big and hard as a rock (good), it had a safe and a small fridge, and everything was clean but rundown. A fresh coat of paint and new carpets would do wonders. Regarding its location, North Point is a blue collar neighborhood east of downtown. Transportation is easy, cheap and convenient with the subway (12' from Central) entrance 50 yards from the Hotel, trams (25' from Central) 2 blocks away and a bus terminal just in front with routes to the whole island. The neighborhood was interesting and there was an excellent supermarket/bakery called Wellcome two blocks away in King's Road where we ended buying breakfast and drinks every morning to eat at the McDonalds' café (kind of a Starbucks inside McDonalds.

Reviews.Title: “ok...but”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Steve_Ong
Reviews.Content: you could do worse for a hotel in hong kong when on a budget. like all other rooms in HK these are small but overall comfortable and clean for the money and cost conscious traveller. the biggest plus for me is that there is good food places around to go to and also it is literally a few steps away from the MTR. when you book the hotel, go for the superior room facing kowloon, if not you get the back of the hotel looking into another building which can make your room dark and somewhat depressing some of the non smoking rooms smell of smoke which is sad but i always buy a can of air freshner wherever i go just in case. like many hotels in Hong Kong and Macau, you will have mainland china visitors who are incredibly noisy both in the corridors and in the lifts and public lobbies.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money but the CRABBINESS will bite you...”
Reviews.Author: trippinorange
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ibis Hotel in HK and wasn't disappointed with the room. Yes, indeed, it was small, but that was expected in HK. Rooms were not impeccable but for the price, it was good enough. The bed was a bit harder than I expected, but at the end of the day, you'd be too tired from all the walking that you wouldn't have the time to mull it over. Hot water is available, so are shampoo, body wash and towels, everything else you have to get yourself. The location was good, just a few steps from an MTR entrance, roughly 20-25 mins to get to Mongkok/TST, etc. Here's the thing though...I can't get over the crabbiness and lack of manners of some of the hotel employees. On the last night of our stay, I needed a calculator to compute my purchases so I called front desk (because it's the only local that works, i wonder what all the other buttons on the phone were for since they don't offer too many services) to request for a calculator. I've been so used to hotel employees falling all over themselves to give anything you request for, so I thought this wasn't too much to ask, right? WRONG. The person on the other end of the line very tersely said, "no calculator", but I insisted still with a hint of sarcasm out of frustration, "no calculator, ANYWHERE IN THIS HOTEL?"..the quick reply was "go downstairs" <dial tone>. They're very good at putting down the phone when speaking to hotel guests, that's what I noticed. Well it doesn't end there...I went downstairs for the calculator and was 'welcomed' by the front desk person who seems very unhappy to see me (starting to wonder why he got in the hospitality industry in the first place if he hates seeing and interacting with people). I went on to borrow the calculator from the front desk officer (KENNETH WONG) and stayed there for a couple of minutes only to see him heavily put down the phone (bang is better word) and curse after speaking with guests on the phone. I was both appalled and shocked by this behavior which I didn't expect from an employee of such a huge hotel chain. I'm from Manila and I've been to a number of hotels in my country and outside of my country, but it's the very first time I got this kind of service...very disappointing indeed. I read a review written by someone who suffered from burns and was told to call a cab...I can totally imagine their employees doing that. They have ZERO interest in giving their guests good customer service...no concept of that whatsoever. I'm sorry to say, but that person really soured my stay at Ibis Hotel, which, overall, I would have said was 'good', but now, I'm not too sure.

Reviews.Title: “GUEST IS BURNED WITH WATER AND TELLS HER TO CALL TAXI HERSELF!!!”
Reviews.Author: azianangel8011
Reviews.Content: CUSTOMER SERVICE SERIOUSLY ATTROCIOUS!!! My friend and I booked a room for a month. Besides the fact that the rooms are the size of a queen-sized bed, with a sliver of an entrance with an itty-bitty bathroom squished in to the right, we could deal with it ( since we're low-maintenance, and were going to travel to other countries, and needed somewhere for our basic needs). In general, the people there treated my friend and I alright because we're cute. But whenever we called down and spoke in chinese for extra towels or something, they would be very rude say, "yes" then hang-up aruptly then take forever for the stuff to arrive, making me call them again and having them get short-fused with me. Unbelievable. I thought they gave the same treatment to everyone until I saw on multiple occasions, (like whenever the magnet on my door key wore off) where I would go up to the front desk, only to have them hurry me along with no warmth, then without skipping a beat, and not even finished dealing with me, see them rush over, with lights in their eyes whenever foreigners arrived! They would suddenly be gracious in their manners, very accommodating, speak english, and kiss-[--]. They are definitely racist against their own people. I happen to be chinese, and I honestly can see the immediate difference when I stopped speaking cantonese and spoke straight english; I'm american born. So if your foreign, you look rich, or you have a giant-wad of cash and speak english, you're straight. If you think I'm done, your sadly mistaken. What I wrote before was nothing, just the tip of the ice. Here's what really gets me: Like I said, the place is so damn small, my roommate was boiling some water with a portable boiler included in the room, but there was no where to put it. One socket was located in the sliver of a doorway where the bathroom is, and above is an open closet area. Too bad there was no room to put the portable boiler so she stuffed it in the small closet area, where wonderfully, the cable too long and hanging, and I commenced to come out of the bathroom, trip over the cord, resulting in hot boiling water pouring down both legs. Now, that's not their fault. The room was small, [--] happens. NOW, when I hobbled my crippled body to the shower to get doused with freezing water (which the hotel doesn't supply), my friend calls the front desk to call an ambulance and explains about the incidence. First, whoever answered at the front desk, proceeded to give [--] to my friend for not speaking chinese clearly, THEN TOLD MY FRIEND AND I TO CALL A TAXI AND HAUL OURSELVES TO THE HOSPITAL!!! HOW THE HELL AM I SUPPOSED TO WALK?! I'M IN SHEER AGONY!!! WHAT KIND OF TREATMENT IS THIS?? I proceeded to hop with all the strength left in me (sheer rage powering me) flung myself onto the bed where I ripped the phone outta my friends grip and I cursed the living hell out of him,(all in crystal clear english, mind you) demanding an ambulance or I will get him fired, let alone write reviews online so that NO ONE will come to this insensitive hotel!! After wasting time where my burns could have been salvaged as 2nd degree burns, they became third degree burns (joy). The ambulance came and as I was going down, strapped onto a bed, with two dudes hauling me, some worker from the hotel decided now would be a good time to ask if I was alright. DO I LOOK ALRIGHT? TOOK YOU LONG ENOUGH, JACK[--]! I didn't mean for this rant to go as far as it did, but it's necessary. TAKE MY WORD, GO ELSEWHERE FOR BETTER TREATMENT FOR ONLY AN ADDITIONAL $10.00 LIKE METROPARK HOTEL; MORE COMFY, SPACIOUS, AND I WISH I HAD! (I had been there on another stay 2 years ago)

Reviews.Title: “Great value stay”
Reviews.Author: markismith50
Reviews.Content: I arrived more than four hours before my check-in time due to an early morning flight, but the desk staff were exceptionally helpful in making up a room for me rather than keeping me waiting with my luggage, at no extra cost. Paying the little extra for a harbour view is well worth it and really made the stay extra special with a superb panorama from the 17th floor. Okay, the rooms are small, but hey this is Hong Kong and, for the money, what do you seriously expect? Still I found the rooms to be a decent enough size, probably helped by the fact I was travelling on my own, but the A/C, TV, fridge, bathroom etc all worked fine. An earlier report on here had criticised the 'rock hard beds'. Okay, they are very firm, but personally I like that so another tick in the box. Overall this was a very interesting base from which to explore HK, and with the MTR and bus station right on the doorstep you can get anywhere without any real hassle. You could spend much more on a luxury hotel, but in terms of value for money over a three-day stay to have a look round this city, this is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: kawaifan
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night with a friend. I already stayed there previously so I knew what to expect. The room was small but cozy. Basic amenities were there. Safe included. Yes, the bed took up the entire space and there was barely enough space for a suitcase but for one night or two, it was a good place to be. Since my friend and I were too tired from all the shopping, the size of the bed didn't really matter since we just conked out minutes after our heads hit the pillow. Staff were fast and efficient. Not sure about the rude staff but the staff I encountered were nice enough. The staff might appear cold and brusque to people unused to the "deal with the client as fast as you can and send them on their way" manner but I already expected it but still they do it in a respectful way. They didn't even hassle us when we went beyond the late check-out time.

Reviews.Title: “Great price/value”
Reviews.Author: Kasparainens
Reviews.Content: Hotel, previously owned by other company, however perfectly in line with IBIS philosophy: tiny roooms for reasonable price. All a/c, floors for non-smokers. Harbour view is nice to have, however, the view is not so nice to struggle for it. I was travelling alone, so no trouble at all with the size of room, however, if there are 2 of you and a lot of purchases on the list, you might consider another option. The hotel has 16+ floors, but only 2 quite slow elevators, so you might need some patience, especially in the mornings and evenings. There is underground station within 2 mins walk and great hot-pot restaurant around the corner, 7eleven store and market very close: all in all, if you are not into grand hotels, but prefer reasonably priced hotel in convinient location, this is the option for you!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but extremely convenient”
Reviews.Author: NomadgirlManila
Reviews.Content: It was purely a business trip. We stayed for 3 nights, and visited two exhibition halls, and went to our supplier's demo centers. We walked a lot, thats why we appreciated the location of IBIS Hotel, just a few steps away from the MTR. Because of the major exhibits being held, the cost of the other hotels are terribly high and almost always fully booked. It was good that our supplier was able to get us accommodation at IBIS. We travel light and had only 2 small luggages with us. So its not a big problem for us cause the rooms are "cute"and beds are small, so don't recommend to tall and stout people, although I saw a lot of westerners checked in. But all basic necessities,like clean towels, beddings, soft pillows, hair dryer, television, plenty of sockets for charging mobiles and laptops, space for hanging clothes, mini ref and safe, electric water pot, coffee and tea are available in the room. The mini ref is empty, so you can store your own stuff. You can adjust the air conditioning. Curtains are sunlight proof. But the walls are not so sound proof. Be sure your toiletries are stored in a hanging container, as the bathroom is quite small and you don't want them falling into the toilet bowl. On our return trip, we just walked across the hotel to the bus terminal in front, and took the airport bus. The breakfast buffet does not offer much choices, but you go out and plenty of affordable restaurants are serving good food.

Reviews.Title: “Not That Bad All Told”
Reviews.Author: Nowaysis
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on here for the hotel, I was a bit apprehensive when I arrived. My first impression was that the room was small, but it was clean and perfectly adequate. Bed was small and rock hard though. No springs on this one.... Just a matress placed on a hard board on top of the bed frame ! Don't expect any soft mattress luxury! As a base, the hotel is in an excellent location just beside North Point MTR station, allowing easy access to the entire city. Probably wouldn't suit all types, but for those looking to travel and stay cheaply, would probably be just the thing they are after.

Reviews.Title: “Good as a base.”
Reviews.Author: woody44
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ibis with my wife for 4 nights in March. We did review this hotel on trip advisor before we booked it and were aware that the rooms were very small. Therefore we were not surprised when we got there. We used this hotel because it was cheap and right next to a MTR which made it easy to get around. The rooms were small, however the room was cleaned daily with fresh towels. The room did have a small fridge and more importantly a safe. The bathroom was very small but the shower was clean and powerful. If you intend to book this hotel and use it just as a base read the reviews and take on board the comments you will then not be disappointed when you get there. We booked the room, a harbour view, through the hotels website and had no problems checking in or out.

Reviews.Title: “Low Grade Ibis”
Reviews.Author: scotguard
Reviews.Content: My sons and I had booked two rooms at this hotel as our base for the Hong Kong sevens, we had requested twin rooms but told by the staff that they were not available. The hotel information says double/twin with queen bed if this was correct things would have been fine, what you get is a very small room with a 4ft bed no wardrobe or draws, just a little hanging rail above the safe, so you would have to live out of your suite case. The paint work and the carpet are both stained and marked plus the TV is built into the wall next to the bed, which means it can not be seen if you lie on the bed. In its favour it has a safe and fridge, near the North Point bus station. North point is not central so the rate for a poor standard hotel makes it expensive, we only stayed one night so would say to other tourist think hard about this one.

Reviews.Title: “lousy hotel,never ever go back again even it's free!!”
Reviews.Author: vijmrita
Reviews.Content: The room is so small, hardly any space to walk after u've placed your luggage. The double bed is not a queen size bed, it's just like a super single bed(around 42"). Feel so cheated. The tv is at the side of the bed, just don't know which angle shd be comfortable for me to watch the programmes. No shower screen, just a cheapskate shower curtain to divide the toilet bowl with the shower area.. The staff are rude & they usually have 1 or 2 staff on duty, a long wait at the counter. No way to ask me spend my $$ to go back to this hotel again, even if give me free stay i would say NO!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, location is fine”
Reviews.Author: pattayainsider
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for five nights. I was worried about the location, but being 30 seconds walk to the MTR subway station, makes it extreamly well-located for all of Hong Kong. There is even a ferry across from the hotel, that goes over to Kowloon, which makes it convenient that way too. Yes, the room is small, but it was perfectly clean. I highly recommend spending the small extra fee for the Harbor view rooms. It's nice to watch all the activity in the harbor, day and night. The bed was a little on the hard side, but passable. The breakfast was a good value, but very limited choices, but enough to satisfy. Bring your own fruit. They are also open for dinner, simple menu, but good value. The hotel staff were all friendly, and the service was just fine. I didn't like the hotel soap/shampoo dispenser stuff, so i would recommend bringing your own. The hotel cost almost the same price as lots of dumpy guesthouses on the Kowloon side. So if you want a name brand hotel, at a fair price, it's just fine. Two minutes walk is a McDonald's and a KFC. There is lots of great shopping, very reasonable, nearby. The tram is not far away, but it's slow to get anywhere... best to get the Octopus card from the MTR subway, which operates like 6 AM to 1 AM. The internet in the lobby was reasonable. The TV channels are rather limited, not much english, and it's true the t.v. is at a bad angle for viewing. But if you want a spacious hotel room, expect to pay about FOUR TIMES the price. Overall, I liked the place, considering the good price.

Reviews.Title: “Cupboard”
Reviews.Author: Seemonkey
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location right above North point station, and nearby to local food markets, but the room is tiny, Hong Kong is prime real estate so you can live with it, the room was a bit dank and gloomy though due to the surrounding buildings, which I'm sure is commonplace across the island. The TV has a selection of English channels , but that's it really, the hotel has no other services.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the review”
Reviews.Author: L0velyTravel
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying there 4 days. After reading the review, I was so scared but it was the only hotel that has the reasonable price during Christmas time. I didn't have to wait for check-in and check-out ( even the hotel was full at that time). The room is small but it is enough for our Asian family ( with one 3 years old daughter). After the first night, we were able to manage the space. Actually they give us a lots of hidden things to keep your stuff such as drawers and hangers. The area around the hotel is good. It close to subway station, opposite the bus station. The shops there also good. I went to Tsim sa Tsui to shop and have to stand in the long line just only to pay. So I went shopping near the hotel, there are so many shops around like Sasa, Bossini, Giordano and G2000 - No wating in line and more sales. ( Except if you want to buy brand name, high-end product) The cafe in the hotel is good price, I ate there and it is cheaper than some local restaurants. Anyway, I still do not recommend the hotel for Western person if you want to stay for more than 1 person in a room.

Reviews.Title: “Well done Ibis”
Reviews.Author: lizeganleeds
Reviews.Content: Just spent 7 nights with my husband at the Ibis, North Point. Yes, the rooms were quite small, but ours had a 4ft 6ins bed (traditional british double), was cleaned every day, fresh fluffy white towels etc. For the money we paid and the location we were well impressed. I have looked at the other hotel chains websites and have found nothing to compare pricewise. We say well done Ibis for providing, cheap adequate accomodation for those of us doing Hong Kong on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Ibis North Point.”
Reviews.Author: Matymoo
Reviews.Content: 1 person at the desk checking people in, around 5 people waiting. I got my room "card", went to the room, opened the door and there was someone else in the room. Went back and got another card for an empty room this time! Room was TINY. I have stayed in Hotels in HK for $20AUD more that have rooms twice as big. Carpet was filthy. Walls were dirty. Stayed on the southern side and found an open wireless connection. Hotel charges $30HKD for 3hrs! (That's around $4AUD)

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: Tomazz
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel cause it was near Tai Koo (2 MTR stations away), though not expecting it would be right next to the station. The location is very convenient for moving around, especially if you have 3 days octopus card, giving you unlimited rides on MTR and a return trip from/to airport. There was no queue at the 2nd floor reception during checkin, perhaps due to my late arrival. I got the room on 21st floor. It was a non-smoking floor, but seems some indian neighbours didn't care about that, as they kept on walking around with cigarettes, and filling the ashtray in front of the elevator. The elevator wait was a long one though, sometimes up to 5 minutes. There are 2 lifts, but they seemed to be stopping nearly every floor... and with 30+ floors, that takes quite some time. The room was tiny and as many others say, unless you put your stuff under the bed, you have nowhere to walk. It is functional though, despite being far from tidy. Dust was everywhere, on clothes hangers, safe, hairdryer, "desk", ... The towels in the bathroom were full of long black hair, the "shower gel & shampoo" on the wall empty, as was the fridge. Maybe I am accustomized to Sofitel, but usually you get at least a bottle of water in the fridge, not so here. Good there's 7-eleven 50m to the left, so you should expect to go there first thing after unpacking (likely before the shower). As others mentioned, carpet wasn't clean, it was full of stains, but not in my room, mostly on corridor. Staff attendance was on par with general generosity of Hongki people - there wasn't much of it. Still I wouldn't complain over bad service. And the restaurant... I didn't really expect a russian canteen style (or ok, if you don't know what it means, think of a prison) wooden benches and tables with a 5 options, all including toast-it-yourself bread, dry croissants and a choice of fried or scrambled eggs. I hated the potato croquettes and measly salad they included, but the chicken steak was actually quite tasty. Oh, forgot, there's also a choice of drinks (coffee, tea, water, orange juice) and jam, butter. All in all, I am wondering if I'd stay there again. Yes, location is marvelous, especially if on Octopus card and there for 3 days, as it's right next to the MTR and one big double decker bus station as well as a ferry port, the view out the window is magnificent, overlooking the harbour to Kowloon with some cruiser ships always there (too bad the airport moved, else you could look at the planes taking off also... ok, maybe not so good cause of the noise), but the size makes it practical only for one person, and that's for a person that's not very fussy about tidiness, which I am. You mentioned internet... one day and hourly fees are truly a rip off, but they also have a 7 days card, which I was using (costs same as good 2 days), which I gave my neighbour when I was leaving. Prices were on par with other hotels I was staying in across asia pacific. So it's OK for a budget traveler, who likes convenience and a good view, travels alone and doesn't really care about the tidiness or good service.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: alternativegurle
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very close to the MTR and bus station. As for the area on Hong Kong Island, it is a bit farther than I wanted to stay (12 min-Central, 20 min- MongKok). The rooms are clean and small (but that is really common in HK). They have a restaurant that serves western breakfast for $35HKD.

Reviews.Title: “Not my hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: Vesa-Finland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 4 weeks on July 2006. The rooms ARE small, so that only place you can put your luggages are under the bed. Otherways you can't move in room. The picture do not tell you thruth. My room carpet was really dirty (what ever dropped into it) and I asked to change room but the other room floow was as dirty as first one. Not really nice at all. Staff was nice and helpfull. Breakfast not worth of money at all. Use this hotel only if you are travelling with low budget as possible. Been in HK many times and I know rooms are usually smalla but this is bit too small. No cold box or good place for your clothes so you have to keep them in you luggage. Vesa from Finland

Reviews.Title: “small but quite decent”
Reviews.Author: judy1019
Reviews.Content: the room is small but so are most rooms in hong kong that are of the same class. i travelled solo so i found the room to be quite acceptable. the place was neat and the view was quite nice, overlooking the highway and water. the location was great, on the same block of north point station if you get off the right exit. it was strange that reception was on the first floor while the entrance was on the ground floor and there is no security when you enter but it is quite safe. the room may be tight with two travellers but i believe it's worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific experience”
Reviews.Author: Bucharest
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ibis North Point for 3 nights in August 2007. I stayed in Ibis in Vienna and Milan and I thought that Ibis Hong Kong should be alike. But It proved to be a horrific experience for me and I wouldn't advise anyone to try this hotel. It should be declassified, shut down and renovated. And it is not about the size of the room (given the case, it should be clearly indicated on sites) but about the stains and spots which are everywhere, on the corridors carpets, on the tiles from the bathroom, on the blankets on beds etc. And if you take a look to the wall paper colour you freeze. It has various tones of grey to black. The first room I entered smelled of urine, like the closet never being washed with detergent. I had to ask for the second, which was as dirty as the previous one but without that particular smell. Unfortunately it was to late for me to change the hotel because I had already given it as meeting point to some friends. In brief, the hotel is much dirtier than words could describe it and any dollar you pay for a room there is waisted.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and tidy hotel for single person”
Reviews.Author: EC_Voyager
Reviews.Content: This is a nice clean hotel especially if you are on a tight budget. Rooms are small with very little room to move around, but i think for one person is fine. I had my gf living with me and we managed to get through the 4 days without much dramas because most of the time, we're out shopping, seeing friends and enjoying the place.(you suppose do that in HK anyway) Showerhead had very good pressure( a plus for me) and location is very convenient to North Point MTR(2 minutes walk) and bus terminal is across the road. Airport connection to hotel by bus is very simple, catch the A11 and ride all the way to the end.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Exploring”
Reviews.Author: buddhaboyLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for ten days and it was well worth it. Right on the Island line MTR Route so getting around was really easy. Oppisite ferry piers to Hung Hom & Kowloon City. Central Mtr ins about 20 minutes from here. Rooms are smallish but then space is at a premium in Hong Kong. Rooms serviced every day, fresh towels etc. Resturant in hotel is amazing, excellent food at amazing prices, highly reccomended. Next door is great Chinese resturant called "You Me You Me" try it, great food. Dont use the hotel laundry service, its a rip off. Next to hotel in the alley way is a small laundry who will do a plastic bag full of laundry in three hours for 25HKD, open from 8am to 9pm. Hotel has internet service etc. Good all round place to stay, east access into Hong Kong centre, most main tourist places only 30 mins away max.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service with dirty and VERY small rooms”
Reviews.Author: crispy123
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here against the advice of previous reviews as the room rate was so cheap. Please do not make the same mistake. This hotel is awful, from start to finish. We checked in with only one word from the receptionist demanding our passports - and that was it, she didn't even tell us our room number! The room is extremely small - pretty much the same size as the small double bed. Absolutely no room for moving around or for storage. I know Hotel Ibis is a budget chain, but the rooms here are a LOT smaller than other Hotel Ibis we have stayed in. Please do not underestimate this point. In addition, the room was dirty - hairs in the bed and a strong smell of urine throughout the room and the corridor outside. The average wait for a lift was literally 5 minutes, which was frustrating at times. On the up side, it is pretty much next door to North Point MTR station and convenient for the trams down to Central. Checking out was horrendous - one person on the desk, and a long queue led to a wait of nearly 40 minutes! Didn't even receive an apology for the delay. Really, really bad hotel - overall, probably the worst I have ever stayed in. Please, please avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but great location”
Reviews.Author: cosmicgirl1978
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great base for exploring Hong Kong for a few days. Our room was very small, but if you organise your baggage well, it's not a problem. The room and bathroom were kept clean. The hotel as a whole felt clean and tidy, and yes, there were amazing views from the building. Best of all was the location - 1 minute from the MTR station, and we could get around Hong Kong very easily from there. Recommended as a base for seeing the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: antic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights before flying further to Bali on our honeymoon. We wanted a cheap and reasonable hotel close to the underground and basically that's what we got. Very good value for money. We had a special deal so I was also curious what the hotel looked like: the hotel is relatively new and it has a modern style, the rooms are extremely small, but clean and from the upper levels you have a nice view to the channel and Kowloon. It seemed to me that hotel staff (both at the reception and the restaurant) did not speak proper English, which was quite strange in Hong Kong. Anyway one of the exits of the Nort Point underground station is really 50 meters from the hotel entrance, so it is with a good location. We really returned to the hotel late night and to have a place to sleep: Ibis North Point was an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the views”
Reviews.Author: Momoi
Reviews.Content: We were very worried about this hotel after reading all the reviews. At check in the staff were very polite, the first room we were allocated was grim. But after a very brief conversation with the receptionist we were allocated a room on the 28th floor a non smoking floor - the decor was acceptable, the sheets on the bed were clean and nice fluffy towels in the bathroom, and a decent shower which always worked and always had hot water of a consistent temperature. Yes the bedooms are small - but if you move the bed against the wall for day time mode and out again at night it works really well. The room is a typical HK budget room, small but perfectly formed. The harbour view was probably the best we have ever had in HK , we have stayed tin HK four times at different hotels. Should you be sad enough to be in your room at 8 o'clock at night you can see the light show!!!! Breakfast in the hotel is a real bargain at only 35 dollars for an american breakfast. The bus station is just outside where you can catch a bus to almost anywhere on the island. The Airport bus leaves from the bus station at regular intervals and at a bargain price will whisk you to the airport in 50 minutes (the receptionist will tell you it takes 2 hrs but dont believe her). The MTR station is just 100 metres away and if you invest in an Octopus card you can get around HK really easily. There is little storage space in the hotel room but this is normal for HK so be prepared to live out of your suitcase but it is worth the experience!!! This is a budget hotel but worth giving it a go. How long do you want to stay in you room. You will find that once in HK your room will only be a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Receptionist Ms Bird is the best”
Reviews.Author: Farangdingdong
Reviews.Content: The staff are unsmiling but efficient except for Ms Bird who remembers your name and is verry efficient but a little too businesslike and not chatty.The rooms are tiny(not much bigger than the bed)The bathroom has great water pressure in the shower.The double beds are hard.If you can find out where they hid the electric kettle it is nice to not need room service to make a drink of tea or coffee.The phone rings off the hook when you need assistance from your room.The airport bus(A11/12 $65hk r/t)stops outside.It is next to the underground train station which is on the Wan Chai line.Try the restaurant on the second floor! The restaurant has very friendly and attentive service. However even though you could stay in the best hotels in Los Angeles(with a discount) for less than than the cost of the Ibis, You would not get the spectacular unobstructed harbour view from your room and that is what makes this hotel a great deal for the price in Hong Kong.Alexander Williams, Los Angeles Ca.USA

Reviews.Title: “Good for the prices of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: ScottRo
Reviews.Content: For anyone that has ever stayed in an Ibis hotel before - this one is no different. The rooms are small, the reception can be crowded (then again, I was checking in just before the Rugby Sevens) and is on the second floor and only two small lifts provide access the entire hotel. This is not a complaint - just a reality. North Point is still being developed but the location still had harbour views (mostly over the old airport) and the hotel is right at the entry of the MTR. Alight at the North Point station of the Island Line. Follow the signs to Java Road. You will have to carry your luggage up two flights of stairs at the end. Once out on Java road, turn right. The hotel is less than 100m away. A 7 eleven is just to the left of the MTR exit. Hope this helps my fellow travellers Scott

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room No service, Is it a hotel?”
Reviews.Author: yrtx4e
Reviews.Content: i stayed at Ibis NorthPoint early March for two nights. I was astound by the cold and indifferent manner of the buff male manager at the reception. The young female staff was courteous though. I booked a single occupancy room was told it's a double bed. I was offered a twin-room thus I explained I only need one bed. but the manager was cold and rude asking me to talk to my agent since the request was a twin. I explained since i was there, it's easier for them to accommodate my request while they can have a twin room to sell for double occupancy. It took so much effort and skills for the rude manager to reluctantly offer me a double bed room. I was also surprised that guest has to pay a deposit to enjoy the room telephone service!!! Never heard of in Asia!!! All visitors should aware there is no bell service. Though Ibis is known for her small room, but Ibis NorthPoint room is tiny. Not recommendable for most Europeans & Americans. The hotel is in an older residential area. I paid a higher rate than normal still didn't get a front facing room - which is a sea view but not that of a glamours harbor view of Hong Kong. There are many choice of accommodation in Hong Kong. I will never stay in Ibis in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: brunni
Reviews.Content: The smallest room at a hotel I've ever been! plus: new equipment, clean; 2min to metro, shops in walking distance; cheap price, view to waterfront minus: small room, even more small bathroom (you can't close the door if you are washing your face, you can't bend down in the shower); check in is in first floor and only two small elevators available had room 1612, stayed 2006-10-19 till 2006-10-21 location and price were very good, but if you stay more than two nights take a more spacious hotel

Reviews.Title: “Where are the Queen size beds?”
Reviews.Author: CornwallGeorge
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending nine nights at the IBIS Hotel in Hong Kong. The room was clean and the maid service was good. Yes the room is small and the bed is hard but my beef is that I booked a standard room with a Queen size bed. A Queen size bed is sixty inches. When we arrived we discovered that the bed was a 3/4 (48 inches). When I took this up with the desk (3 different times) I was told that all the beds were the same size and that this was a Queen size bed for Asia. I disputed this but got nothing more than a meaningless polite "we are sorry". On my last day, several rooms across the hall had been checked out and the doors were open and I saw that those rooms had double beds (54 inches). Maybe its not a big deal but I like to get what I pay for and I do not like being deceived. George from Canada

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: carnbry
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our 2-week stay. There were 4 of us travelling and we booked 2 different hotel rooms. There is nothing good I can say about the Ibis. The reception was rude and not very helpful, there room is small (although not the worst of their problems, I could've lived with a small room), there were stains on the bedsheets, and the room smelled.
