According to my mother, who I travelled with, it smelled like dead rat. In reality, it really just smelled like musty wet towel that has been out for months. When asked to change rooms, they made it difficult. We eventually had to change hotels. I do not recommend this hotel for anyone. Not unless you want the worst service and the dirtiest hotel ever.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad lah”
Reviews.Author: tissueprata
Reviews.Content: maybe it was because we read the reviews here before booking the ibis north point, or maybe it was because we stayed in an even smaller room in mongkok the night before.. but it wasn't that bad actually. staff were ok, room was also ok. a bit on the small side, but much larger than most of the hostels in hk which are not that cheap as well. i think for budget accomodation the ibis north point is about as cheap as you can get without staying in hostels, so i don't think you should expect a lot, but it was satisfactory. for the few hk$100 extra i'd prefer to stay here than in chungking or mirador mansions.

Reviews.Title: “where is the service ?”
Reviews.Author: lolobkk
Reviews.Content: the location is not bad , the rooms are really small and the bed made of wood probably ! the worse point is many people tried to call me and NOONE picked up the phone ... seems there is no operator in this hotel , when I complained about it , they just replied they were probably busy .. sure in a matter of emergency better be busy doing something else ... I never seen any hotel in the world with such incompetent people ... IBIS group is a big hotel group they should be more carefull , I have sent a complain by email to the hotel and of course , never get any reply ..... Cheap hotel = cheap service ( or no service at all) .. This is totally outreagous ! next time I would defenetly pay more and get better ...anyway it cannot be worse than that !

Reviews.Title: “Small, small, small”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandJen
Reviews.Content: We had to stay here because it was the only hotel in our budget price range in Hong Kong, We booked a double room, when we checked in the receptionist asked if there were two people sleeping in the room and looked surprised that there were. When we finally got to the room, after waiting for the lift for 10 mins we found out why. The hotel room is a cupboard with a small table posing as a bed. It is a tiny tiny bed and very very hard. Only one person can do anything the room at any one time, the other has to sit on the bed because it is so so small. Poor facilities on site, expensive internet, rubbish restaurant, no launderette and the reception staff struggled. Plus points are the hotel is clean and right next to the tube. Depends what you're after at this price range you don't have much choice in Hong Kong. If I went back I'd stay somewhere nicer in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Small.. but OK”
Reviews.Author: eagertofly
Reviews.Content: Definitely the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed. All bed in queen size.. no extra bed available. Good price for budget traveller. All room equipment work well. Very easy access from subway.

Reviews.Title: “Too small, Too hard, Too squashy!”
Reviews.Author: eddy621
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ibis this March, i WON'T be staying there again. The room i had was meant to be a superior but it was the size of a postage stamp, the bed was very hard and the pillows squashed completely flat when you put your head on it. There was very little storage for clothes - thank god it was only me in the room - and my suitcase had to be stored at reception because there was no space. I have stayed in the guest houses in H.K. and the rooms are around the same size, but around half the price. On the plus side , it was clean and you got a free newspaper every day

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, saved me a lot of money”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshire_Lass34
Reviews.Content: I found the check-in staff to be very friendly and helpful indeed, also very efficient. The breakfast however was a real rip-off. Tiny portions and terrible rude service at an expensive price. Give it a miss!!! Sure the room is small but it is very clean and had a nice harbour view where u could watch the ships go by. Shower was great and room was quiet. The TV had some useful channels in English but majority were in Chinese. Very low price which made it ideal for someone like me on a tight budget. Liked the free newspaper each morning as well. I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hilariously small”
Reviews.Author: quanster
Reviews.Content: I'd read the negative reviews here on tripadvisor but this was the only hotel I could get into in my price range! I actually quite liked the design of the hotel and the rooms aesthetically - it's like living in a miniature IKEA land, slick, shining surfaces and carefully designed so that space is conserved. But that's the problem in the end. I had a medium sized suitcase so the door did close - thank goodness - but if it was a really large one, it wouldn't have. Get this: when I sat down on the toilet, I had to angle my knees because there was no space to put them out straight (the sink was in the way!). There was barely room to do push-ups. There was no extra supplies in the bathroom besides liquid soap. Even the bathmat was miniature. I actually found this hilarious. I had a non-smoking room - but the carpets were pretty run-down. And one night there was an electrical buzzing sound that wouldn't go away. Location is pretty good, minutes from the MTR and north point is close to causeway bay (my favourite neighbourhood to shop). However, the YWCA Anne Black was better value in Kowloon, I suspect Chaterhouse, which I wanted to get into, would have been better too. Oh, one good thing: high-speed internet access in the room (though you have to pay). If you have to stay here, be prepared and have a laugh about the negative aspects - and try to book earlier next time for somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Very small room, but excellent location and resonably priced”
Reviews.Author: whimsical_sd
Reviews.Content: We still decided to stay at Ibis after the mixed reviews we've seen on Trip Advisor. Yes, the room is really small, as most people said on the reviews. The room is clean overall. The towels are clean, bed is clean, and the room is clean. The bed is hard. Morden design interior. Free newspapers every morning. Staff is polite and helpful. There is a restaurant on the second floor of the hotel. Great price. For a full dinner set with soup, main course, desert, and tea/coffee, it ranges from HK$40-60 (US$5.2-8). Taste okay. Hotel is in a very convenient location. North Point subway station is only 2 minutes walk. Across the hotel is a big bus terminus that you can go to many places, including to the aiport for HK$40 (US$5.2). Next to the bus terminus is also a ferry station where you can take the ferry across the harbor to Kowloon (Whampoa). Convenient stores are only another block away to get your water, etc. The room is perfect for 1-2 people at most, with light/little luggages. For the great price and location, I'll definitly stay there again.
